verses.vh1: Blessed are they who have not walked in the counsel of the wicked, ⁕
vh2: nor lingered in the way of sinners,
nor sat in the assembly of the scornful.

verses.vh1: Their delight is in the law of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and they meditate on God’s law day and night.

vh1: Like a tree planted by streams of water bearing fruit in its season,
with leaves that do not wither, ⁕
verses.vh2: whatever they do, it shall prosper.

verses.vh1: As for the wicked, it is not so with them; ⁕
verses.vh2: they are like chaff which the wind blows away.

verses.vh1: Therefore the wicked shall not be able to stand in the judgement, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor the sinner in the congregation of the righteous.

verses.vh1: For God knows the way of the righteous, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the way of the wicked shall perish.

refrain: God knows the way of the righteous.

verses.vh1: Why are the nations in tumult, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why do the peoples devise a vain plot?

vh1: The rulers of the earth rise up
and take counsel together, ⁕
verses.vh2: against God and against God’s anointed:

verses.vh1: ‘Let us break their bonds asunder ⁕
verses.vh2: and cast away their cords from us.’

verses.vh1: The one who dwells in heaven shall laugh them to scorn; ⁕
verses.vh2: God shall have them in derision.

verses.vh1: Then shall God speak to them in God’s wrath ⁕
verses.vh2: and terrify them in God’s fury:

verses.vh1: ‘Yet have I set my King ⁕
verses.vh2: upon my holy hill of Zion.’

verses.vh1: I will proclaim the decree of God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God said to me: ‘You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.

verses.vh1: ‘Ask of me and I will give you the nations for your inheritance ⁕
verses.vh2: and the ends of the earth for your possession.

verses.vh1: ‘You shall break them with a rod of iron ⁕
verses.vh2: and dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.’

verses.vh1: Now therefore be wise, O rulers; ⁕
verses.vh2: be prudent, you judges of the earth.

verses.vh1: Serve God with fear, and with trembling kiss God’s feet, ⁕
vh2: lest God be angry and you perish from the way,
for God’s wrath is quickly kindled.

verses.vh1: Happy are all they ⁕
verses.vh2: who take refuge in God.

refrain: God is the strength of God’s people,
a safe refuge for God’s anointed.

verses.vh1: God, how many are my adversaries; ⁕
verses.vh2: many are they who rise up against me.

verses.vh1: Many are they who say to my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘There is no help for you in your God.’

verses.vh1: But you, God, are a shield about me; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

verses.vh1: When I cry aloud to God, ⁕
verses.vh2: you will answer me from your holy hill;

verses.vh1: I lie down and sleep and rise again, ⁕
verses.vh2: because God sustains me.

verses.vh1: I will not be afraid of hordes of the peoples ⁕
verses.vh2: that have set themselves against me all around.

verses.vh1: Rise up, O God, and deliver me, O my God, ⁕
vh2: for you strike all my enemies on the cheek
and break the teeth of the wicked.

verses.vh1: Salvation belongs to God: ⁕
verses.vh2: may your blessing be upon your people.

refrain: You, God, are a shield about me.

verses.vh1: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness; ⁕
vh2: you set me at liberty when I was in trouble;
have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

verses.vh1: How long will you people dishonour my glory; ⁕
verses.vh2: how long will you love vain things and seek after falsehood?

verses.vh1: But know that God has shown me God’s marvellous kindness; ⁕
verses.vh2: when I call upon God, God will hear me.

verses.vh1: Stand in awe, and sin not; ⁕
verses.vh2: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still.

verses.vh1: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and put your trust in God.

verses.vh1: There are many that say, ‘Who will show us any good?’ ⁕
verses.vh2: God, lift up the light of your countenance upon us.

verses.vh1: You have put gladness in my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: more than when their corn and wine and oil increase.

verses.vh1: In peace I will lie down and sleep, ⁕
verses.vh2: for it is you God, only, who make me dwell in safety.

refrain: In peace I will lie down and sleep.

verses.vh1: Give ear to my words, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: consider my lamentation.

verses.vh1: Hearken to the voice of my crying, my Ruler and my God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for to you I make my prayer.

verses.vh1: In the morning, God, you will hear my voice; ⁕
verses.vh2: early in the morning I make my appeal to you, and look up.

verses.vh1: For you are the God who takes no pleasure in wickedness; ⁕
verses.vh2: no evil can dwell with you.

verses.vh1: The boastful cannot stand in your sight; ⁕
verses.vh2: you hate all those that work wickedness.

verses.vh1: You destroy those who speak lies; ⁕
verses.vh2: the bloodthirsty and deceitful God will abhor.

vh1: But as for me, through the greatness of your mercy,
I will come into your house; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will bow down towards your holy temple in awe of you.

vh1: Lead me, God, in your righteousness,
because of my enemies; ⁕
verses.vh2: make your way straight before my face.

vh1: For there is no truth in their mouth,
in their heart is destruction, ⁕
vh2: their throat is an open sepulchre,
and they flatter with their tongue.

verses.vh1: Punish them, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them fall through their own devices.

verses.vh1: Because of their many transgressions cast them out, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they have rebelled against you.

verses.vh1: But let all who take refuge in you be glad; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them sing out their joy for ever.

verses.vh1: You will shelter them, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that those who love your name may exult in you.

verses.vh1: For you, O God, will bless the righteous; ⁕
verses.vh2: and with your favour you will defend them as with a shield.

refrain: You, O God, will bless the righteous.

verses.vh1: O God, rebuke me not in your wrath; ⁕
verses.vh2: neither chasten me in your fierce anger.

verses.vh1: Have mercy on me, God, for I am weak; ⁕
verses.vh2: God, heal me, for my bones are racked.

verses.vh1: My soul also shakes with terror; ⁕
verses.vh2: how long, O God, how long?

verses.vh1: Turn again, O God, and deliver my soul; ⁕
verses.vh2: save me for your loving mercy’s sake.

verses.vh1: For in death no one remembers you; ⁕
verses.vh2: and who can give you thanks in the grave?

verses.vh1: I am weary with my groaning; ⁕
vh2: every night I drench my pillow
and flood my bed with my tears.

verses.vh1: My eyes are wasted with grief ⁕
verses.vh2: and worn away because of all my enemies.

verses.vh1: Depart from me, all you that do evil, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God has heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.vh1: God has heard my supplication; ⁕
verses.vh2: God will receive my prayer.

verses.vh1: All my enemies shall be put to shame and confusion; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall suddenly turn back in their shame.

refrain: Turn again, O God, and deliver my soul.

verses.vh1: O God my God, in you I take refuge; ⁕
verses.vh2: save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me,

verses.vh1: Lest they rend me like a lion and tear me in pieces ⁕
verses.vh2: while there is no one to help me.

verses.vh1: O God my God, if I have done these things: ⁕
verses.vh2: if there is any wickedness in my hands,

verses.vh1: If I have repaid my friend with evil, ⁕
verses.vh2: or plundered my enemy without a cause,

verses.vh1: Then let my enemy pursue me and overtake me, ⁕
vh2: trample my life to the ground,
and lay my honour in the dust.

vh1: Rise up, O God, in your wrath;
lift yourself up against the fury of my enemies. ⁕
verses.vh2: Awaken, my God, the judgement that you have commanded.

verses.vh1: Let the assembly of the peoples gather round you; ⁕
verses.vh2: be seated high above them: O God, judge the nations.

verses.vh1: Give judgement for me according to my righteousness, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and according to the innocence that is in me.

vh1: Let the malice of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous; ⁕
verses.vh2: for you test the mind and heart, O righteous God.

verses.vh1: You are my shield that is over me; ⁕
verses.vh2: you save the true of heart.

verses.vh1: You are a righteous judge; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are provoked all day long.

verses.vh1: If they will not repent, you will whet your sword; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have bent your bow and made it ready.

verses.vh1: You have prepared the weapons of death; ⁕
verses.vh2: you make your arrows shafts of fire.

verses.vh1: Behold those who are in labour with wickedness, ⁕
verses.vh2: who conceive evil and give birth to lies.

verses.vh1: They dig a pit and make it deep ⁕
verses.vh2: and fall into the hole that they have made for others.

verses.vh1: Their mischief rebounds on their own head; ⁕
verses.vh2: their violence falls on their own scalp.

verses.vh1: I will give thanks to God for God’s righteousness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will make music to the name of God Most High.

refrain: Give judgement for me
according to my righteousness, O God.

verses.vh1: O God our governor, ⁕
verses.vh2: how glorious is your name in all the world!

verses.vh1: Your majesty above the heavens is praised ⁕
verses.vh2: out of the mouths of babes at the breast.

verses.vh1: You have founded a stronghold against your foes, ⁕
verses.vh2: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.

verses.vh1: When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers, ⁕
verses.vh2: the moon and the stars that you have ordained,

verses.vh1: What are mortals, that you should be mindful of them; ⁕
verses.vh2: mere human beings, that you should seek them out?

verses.vh1: You have made them little lower than the angels ⁕
verses.vh2: and crown them with glory and honour.

verses.vh1: You have given them dominion over the works of your hands ⁕
verses.vh2: and put all things under their feet,

verses.vh1: All sheep and oxen, ⁕
verses.vh2: even the wild beasts of the field,

verses.vh1: The birds of the air, the fish of the sea ⁕
verses.vh2: and whatsoever moves in the paths of the sea.

verses.vh1: O God our governor, ⁕
verses.vh2: how glorious is your name in all the world!

verses.vh1: I will give thanks to you, God, with my whole heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will tell of all your marvellous works.

verses.vh1: I will be glad and rejoice in you; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will make music to your name, O Most High.

verses.vh1: When my enemies are driven back, ⁕
verses.vh2: they stumble and perish at your presence.

verses.vh1: For you have maintained my right and my cause; ⁕
verses.vh2: you sat on your throne giving righteous judgement.

verses.vh1: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: The enemy was utterly laid waste. ⁕
vh2: You uprooted their cities;
their very memory has perished.

verses.vh1: But God shall endure for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have made fast your throne for judgement.

verses.vh1: For you shall rule the world with righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and govern the peoples with equity.

verses.vh1: Then will God be a refuge for the oppressed, ⁕
verses.vh2: a refuge in the time of trouble.

verses.vh1: And those who know your name will put their trust in you, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you, God, have never failed those who seek you.

verses.vh1: Sing praises to God who dwells in Zion; ⁕
verses.vh2: declare among the peoples the things God has done.

verses.vh1: The avenger of blood has remembered them; ⁕
verses.vh2: God did not forget the cry of the oppressed.

verses.vh1: Have mercy upon me, O God; ⁕
vh2: consider the trouble I suffer from those who hate me,
you that lift me up from the gates of death;

verses.vh1: That I may tell all your praises in the gates of the city of Zion ⁕
verses.vh2: and rejoice in your salvation.

verses.vh1: The nations shall sink into the pit of their making ⁕
verses.vh2: and in the snare which they set will their own foot be taken.

verses.vh1: O God, you make yourself known by your acts of justice; ⁕
verses.vh2: the wicked are snared in the works of their own hands.

verses.vh1: They shall return to the land of darkness, ⁕
verses.vh2: all the nations that forget you.

verses.vh1: For the needy shall not always be forgotten ⁕
verses.vh2: and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.

verses.vh1: Arise, O God, and let not mortals have the upper hand; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the nations be judged before your face.

verses.vh1: Put them in fear, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that the nations may know themselves to be but mortal.

refrain: You, God, have never failed those who seek you.

verses.vh1: Why stand so far off, O God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Why hide yourself in time of trouble?

verses.vh1: The wicked in their pride persecute the poor; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.

verses.vh1: The wicked boast of their heart’s desire; ⁕
verses.vh2: the covetous curse and revile God.

verses.vh1: The wicked in their arrogance say, ‘God will not avenge it’; ⁕
verses.vh2: in all their scheming God counts for nothing.

vh1: They are stubborn in all their ways
for your judgements are far above out of their sight; ⁕
verses.vh2: they scoff at all their adversaries.

verses.vh1: They say in their heart, ‘I shall not be shaken; ⁕
verses.vh2: no harm shall ever happen to me.’

verses.vh1: Their mouth is full of cursing, deceit and fraud; ⁕
verses.vh2: under their tongue lie mischief and wrong.

vh1: They lurk in the outskirts
and in dark alleys they murder the innocent; ⁕
verses.vh2: their eyes are ever watching for the helpless.

vh1: They lie in wait, like a lion in its den;
they lie in wait to seize the poor; ⁕
verses.vh2: they seize the poor when they get them into their net.

verses.vh1: The innocent are broken and humbled before them; ⁕
verses.vh2: the helpless fall before their power.

verses.vh1: They say in their heart, ‘God has forgotten; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s face is hidden; God will never see it.’

verses.vh1: Arise, O God God, and lift up your hand; ⁕
verses.vh2: forget not the poor.

verses.vh1: Why should the wicked be scornful of God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Why should they say in their hearts, ‘You will not avenge it’?

verses.vh1: Surely, you behold trouble and misery; ⁕
verses.vh2: you see it and take it into your own hand.

verses.vh1: The helpless commit themselves to you, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you are the helper of the orphan.

verses.vh1: Break the power of the wicked and malicious; ⁕
verses.vh2: search out their wickedness until you find none.

verses.vh1: God, you shall reign for ever and ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: the nations shall perish from you land.

verses.vh1: You will hear the desire of the poor; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will incline your ear to the fullness of their heart,

verses.vh1: To give justice to the orphan and oppressed, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that people are no longer driven in terror from the land.

refrain: You, God, have never failed those who seek you.

verses.vh1: In God have I taken refuge; ⁕
vh2: how then can you say to me,
‘Flee like a bird to the hills,

vh1: ‘For see how the wicked bend the bow
and fit their arrows to the string, ⁕
verses.vh2: to shoot from the shadows at the true of heart.

verses.vh1: ‘When the foundations are destroyed, ⁕
verses.vh2: what can the righteous do?’

verses.vh1: God is in God’s holy temple; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s throne is in heaven.

verses.vh1: God’s eyes behold, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s eyelids try every mortal being.

verses.vh1: God tries the righteous as well as the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: but those who delight in violence God’s soul abhors.

vh1: Upon the wicked God shall rain coals of fire
and burning sulphur; ⁕
verses.vh2: scorching wind shall be their portion to drink.

vh1: For God is righteous;
God loves righteous deeds, ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who are upright shall behold God’s face.

refrain: God’s throne is in heaven.

verses.vh1: Help me, God, for no one godly is left; ⁕
verses.vh2: the faithful have vanished from the whole human race.

verses.vh1: They all speak falsely with their neighbour; ⁕
verses.vh2: they flatter with their lips, but speak from a double heart.

verses.vh1: O that God would cut off all flattering lips ⁕
verses.vh2: and the tongue that speaks proud boasts!

verses.vh1: Those who say, ‘With our tongue will we prevail; ⁕
verses.vh2: our lips we will use; who rules over us?’

vh1: ‘Because of the oppression of the needy,
and the groaning of the poor, ⁕
vh2: I will rise up now,’ says God,
‘and set them in the safety that they long for.’

verses.vh1: The words of God are pure words, ⁕
vh2: like silver refined in the furnace
and purified seven times in the fire.

verses.vh1: You, O God, will watch over us ⁕
verses.vh2: and guard us from this generation for ever.

verses.vh1: The wicked strut on every side, ⁕
verses.vh2: when what is vile is exalted by the whole human race.

refrain: You, O God, will watch over us.

verses.vh1: How long will you forget me, O God; for ever? ⁕
verses.vh2: How long will you hide your face from me?

vh1: How long shall I have anguish in my soul
and grief in my heart, day after day? ⁕
verses.vh2: How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

verses.vh1: Look upon me and answer, O God my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: lighten my eyes, lest I sleep in death;

verses.vh1: Lest my enemy say, ‘I have prevailed against them,’ ⁕
verses.vh2: and my foes rejoice that I have fallen.

verses.vh1: But I put my trust in your steadfast love; ⁕
verses.vh2: my heart will rejoice in your salvation.

verses.vh1: I will sing to God, ⁕
verses.vh2: who has dealt so bountifully with me.

refrain: I love God, who has heard the voice of my supplication.

verses.vh1: Fools have said in their hearts, ‘There is no God.’ ⁕
vh2: Corrupt are they, and abominable in their wickedness;
there is no one that does good.

verses.vh1: God has looked down from heaven upon the children of earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks after God.

vh1: But every one has turned back;
all alike have become corrupt: ⁕
verses.vh2: there is none that does good; no, not one.

verses.vh1: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers, ⁕
vh2: who eat up my people as if they ate bread
and do not call upon God?

verses.vh1: There shall they be in great fear; ⁕
verses.vh2: for God is in the company of the righteous.

verses.vh1: Though they would confound the counsel of the poor, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet God shall be their refuge.

verses.vh1: O that Israel’s salvation would come out of Zion! ⁕
vh2: When God restores the fortunes of God’s people,
then will Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

refrain: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.

verses.vh1: God, who may dwell in your tabernacle? ⁕
verses.vh2: Who may rest upon your holy hill?

verses.vh1: Whoever leads an uncorrupt life ⁕
verses.vh2: and does the thing that is right;

verses.vh1: Who speaks the truth from the heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and bears no deceit on the tongue;

verses.vh1: Who does no evil to a friend ⁕
verses.vh2: and pours no scorn on a neighbour;

verses.vh1: In whose sight the wicked are not esteemed, ⁕
verses.vh2: but who honours those who fear God.

verses.vh1: Whoever has sworn to a neighbour ⁕
verses.vh2: and never goes back on that word;

verses.vh1: Who does not lend money in hope of gain, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor takes a bribe against the innocent;

verses.vh1: Whoever does these things ⁕
verses.vh2: shall never fall.

refrain: Through the greatness of your mercy,
I will come into your house.

verses.vh1: Preserve me, O God, for in you have I taken refuge; ⁕
vh2: I have said to God, ‘You are my keeper,
all my good depends on you.’

verses.vh1: All my delight is upon the godly that are in the land, ⁕
verses.vh2: upon those who are noble in heart.

verses.vh1: Though the idols are legion that many run after, ⁕
vh2: their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
neither make mention of their names upon my lips.

verses.vh1: You yourself, O God, are my portion and my cup; ⁕
verses.vh2: in your hands alone is my fortune.

verses.vh1: My share has fallen in a fair land; ⁕
verses.vh2: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.

verses.vh1: I will bless you, God, who have given me counsel, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in the night watches you instruct my heart.

verses.vh1: I have set God always before me; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are at my right hand; I shall not fall.

verses.vh1: Wherefore my heart is glad and my spirit rejoices; ⁕
verses.vh2: my flesh also shall rest secure.

verses.vh1: For you will not abandon my soul to Death, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor suffer your faithful one to see the Pit.

vh1: You will show me the path of life;
in your presence is the fullness of joy ⁕
verses.vh2: and in your right hand are pleasures for evermore.

refrain: God is at my right hand; I shall not fall.

verses.vh1: Hear my just cause, O God; consider my complaint; ⁕
verses.vh2: listen to my prayer, which comes not from lying lips.

verses.vh1: Let my vindication come forth from your presence; ⁕
verses.vh2: let your eyes behold what is right.

verses.vh1: Weigh my heart, examine me by night, ⁕
verses.vh2: refine me, and you will find no impurity in me.

verses.vh1: My mouth does not trespass for earthly rewards; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have heeded the words of your lips.

verses.vh1: My footsteps hold fast in the ways of your commandments; ⁕
verses.vh2: my feet have not stumbled in your paths.

verses.vh1: I call upon you, O God, for you will answer me; ⁕
verses.vh2: incline your ear to me, and listen to my words.

verses.vh1: Show me your marvellous loving-kindness, ⁕
verses.vh2: O Saviour of those who take refuge at your right hand from those who rise up against them.

verses.vh1: Keep me as the apple of your eye; ⁕
verses.vh2: hide me under the shadow of your wings,

verses.vh1: From the wicked who assault me, ⁕
verses.vh2: from my enemies who surround me to take away my life.

verses.vh1: They have closed their heart to pity ⁕
verses.vh2: and their mouth speaks proud things.

verses.vh1: They press me hard, they surround me on every side, ⁕
verses.vh2: watching how they may cast me to the ground,

verses.vh1: Like a lion that is greedy for its prey, ⁕
verses.vh2: like a young lion lurking in secret places.

verses.vh1: Arise, God; confront them and cast them down; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver me from the wicked by your sword.

verses.vh1: Deliver me, O God, by your hand ⁕
verses.vh2: from those whose portion in life is unending,

verses.vh1: Whose bellies you fill with your treasure, ⁕
vh2: who are well supplied with children
and leave their wealth to their little ones.

verses.vh1: As for me, I shall see your face in righteousness; ⁕
verses.vh2: when I awake and behold your likeness, I shall be satisfied.

refrain: Deliver me, O God, by your hand.

verses.vh1: I love you, O God my strength. ⁕
verses.vh2: God is my crag, my fortress and my deliverer,

verses.vh1: My God, my rock in whom I take refuge, ⁕
verses.vh2: my shield, the horn of my salvation and my stronghold.

verses.vh1: I cried to God in my anguish ⁕
verses.vh2: and I was saved from my enemies.

verses.vh1: The cords of death entwined me ⁕
verses.vh2: and the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.

verses.vh1: The cords of the Pit fastened about me ⁕
verses.vh2: and the snares of death entangled me.

verses.vh1: In my distress I called upon God ⁕
verses.vh2: and cried out to my God for help.

verses.vh1: You heard my voice in your temple ⁕
verses.vh2: and my cry came to your ears.

verses.vh1: The earth trembled and quaked; ⁕
vh2: the foundations of the mountains shook;
they reeled because you were angry.

vh1: Smoke rose from your nostrils
and a consuming fire went out of your mouth; ⁕
verses.vh2: burning coals blazed forth from you.

verses.vh1: You parted the heavens and came down ⁕
verses.vh2: and thick darkness was under your feet.

verses.vh1: You rode upon the cherubim and flew; ⁕
verses.vh2: you came flying on the wings of the wind.

verses.vh1: You made darkness your covering round about you, ⁕
verses.vh2: dark waters and thick clouds your pavilion.

verses.vh1: From the brightness of your presence, through the clouds ⁕
verses.vh2: burst hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.vh1: God, you also thundered out of heaven; ⁕
verses.vh2: O Most High, you uttered your voice with hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.vh1: You sent out your arrows and scattered them; ⁕
verses.vh2: you hurled down lightnings and put them to flight.

vh1: The springs of the ocean were seen,
and the foundations of the world uncovered ⁕
vh2: at your rebuke, O God,
at the blast of the breath of your displeasure.

verses.vh1: You reached down from on high and took me; ⁕
verses.vh2: you drew me out of the mighty waters.

verses.vh1: You delivered me from my strong enemy, ⁕
verses.vh2: from foes that were too mighty for me.

verses.vh1: They came upon me in the day of my trouble; ⁕
verses.vh2: but God was my upholder.

verses.vh1: You brought me out into a place of liberty; ⁕
verses.vh2: you rescued me because you delighted in me.

verses.vh1: You rewarded me, God, after my righteous dealing; ⁕
verses.vh2: according to the cleanness of my hands you recompensed me,

verses.vh1: Because I had kept the ways of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and had not gone wickedly away from my God,

verses.vh1: For I had an eye to all your laws, ⁕
verses.vh2: and did not cast out your commandments from me.

verses.vh1: I was also wholehearted before you ⁕
verses.vh2: and kept myself from iniquity;

verses.vh1: Therefore God rewarded me after my righteous dealing, ⁕
verses.vh2: and according to the cleanness of my hands in your sight.

verses.vh1: With the faithful you show yourself faithful; ⁕
verses.vh2: with the true you show yourself true;

verses.vh1: With the pure you show yourself pure, ⁕
verses.vh2: but with the crooked you show yourself perverse.

verses.vh1: For you will save a lowly people ⁕
verses.vh2: and bring down the high looks of the proud.

verses.vh1: You also shall light my candle; ⁕
verses.vh2: God my God shall make my darkness to be bright.

verses.vh1: By your help I shall run at an enemy host; ⁕
verses.vh2: with the help of my God I can leap over a wall.

vh1: As for you, O God, your way is perfect;
the word of God is tried in the fire; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are a shield to all who trust in you.

verses.vh1: For who is God but God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and who is the rock except our God?

verses.vh1: It is you who gird me about with strength ⁕
verses.vh2: and make my way perfect.

verses.vh1: You make my feet like hinds’ feet ⁕
verses.vh2: so that I tread surely on the heights.

verses.vh1: You teach my hands to fight ⁕
verses.vh2: and my arms to bend a bow of bronze.

verses.vh1: You have given me the shield of your salvation; ⁕
vh2: your right hand upholds me
and your grace has made me great.

verses.vh1: You enlarge my strides beneath me, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet my feet do not slide.

verses.vh1: I will pursue my enemies and overtake them, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor turn again until I have destroyed them.

verses.vh1: I will smite them down so they cannot rise; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall fall beneath my feet.

verses.vh1: You have girded me with strength for the battle; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will cast down my enemies under me;

verses.vh1: You will make my foes turn their backs upon me ⁕
verses.vh2: and I shall destroy them that hate me.

verses.vh1: They will cry out, but there shall be none to help them; ⁕
verses.vh2: they will cry to God, but you will not answer.

verses.vh1: I shall beat them as small as the dust on the wind; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will cast them out as the mire in the streets.

verses.vh1: You will deliver me from the strife of the peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will make me the head of the nations.

vh1: A people I have not known shall serve me;
as soon as they hear me, they shall obey me; ⁕
verses.vh2: strangers will humble themselves before me.

verses.vh1: The foreign peoples will lose heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and come trembling out of their strongholds.

verses.vh1: God lives, and blessed be my rock! ⁕
verses.vh2: Praised be the God of my salvation,

verses.vh1: Even the God who vindicates me ⁕
verses.vh2: and subdues the peoples under me!

vh1: You that deliver me from my enemies,
you will set me up above my foes; ⁕
verses.vh2: from the violent you will deliver me;

verses.vh1: Therefore will I give you thanks, O God, among the nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and sing praises to your name,

verses.vh1: To the one who gives great victory to God’s King ⁕
vh2: and shows faithful love to God’s anointed,
to David and his descendants for ever.

refrain: God my God shall make my darkness to be bright.

verses.vh1: The heavens are telling the glory of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and the firmament proclaims your handiwork.

verses.vh1: One day pours out its song to another ⁕
verses.vh2: and one night unfolds knowledge to another.

verses.vh1: They have neither speech nor language ⁕
verses.vh2: and their voices are not heard,

verses.vh1: Yet their sound has gone out into all lands ⁕
verses.vh2: and their words to the ends of the world.

verses.vh1: In them have you set a tabernacle for the sun, ⁕
vh2: that comes forth as a newlywed out of a chamber
and rejoices as a champion to run their course.

vh1: It goes forth from the end of the heavens
and runs to the very end again, ⁕
verses.vh2: and there is nothing hidden from its heat.

verses.vh1: The law of God is perfect, reviving the soul; ⁕
vh2: the testimony of God is sure
and gives wisdom to the simple.

verses.vh1: The statutes of God are right and rejoice the heart; ⁕
vh2: the commandment of God is pure
and gives light to the eyes.

verses.vh1: The fear of God is clean and endures for ever; ⁕
vh2: the judgements of God are true
and righteous altogether.

vh1: More to be desired are they than gold,
more than much fine gold, ⁕
vh2: sweeter also than honey,
dripping from the honeycomb.

verses.vh1: By them also is your servant taught ⁕
verses.vh2: and in keeping them there is great reward.

verses.vh1: Who can tell how often they offend ⁕
verses.vh2: O cleanse me from my secret faults!

verses.vh1: Keep your servant also from presumptuous sins lest they get dominion over me; ⁕
vh2: so shall I be undefiled,
and innocent of great offence.

verses.vh1: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, my strength and my redeemer.

refrain: The commandment of God is pure
and gives light to the eyes.

verses.vh1: May God hear you in the day of trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: the name of the God of Jacob defend you;

verses.vh1: Send you help from God’s sanctuary ⁕
verses.vh2: and strengthen you out of Zion;

verses.vh1: Remember all your offerings ⁕
verses.vh2: and accept your burnt sacrifice;

verses.vh1: Grant you your heart’s desire ⁕
verses.vh2: and fulfil all your mind.

vh1: May we rejoice in your salvation
and triumph in the name of our God; ⁕
verses.vh2: may God perform all your petitions.

verses.vh1: Now I know that God will save God’s anointed; ⁕
vh2: God will answer from God’s holy heaven,
with the mighty strength of God’s right hand.

verses.vh1: Some put their trust in chariots and some in horses, ⁕
verses.vh2: but we will call only on the name of God our God.

verses.vh1: They are brought down and fallen, ⁕
verses.vh2: but we are risen and stand upright.

verses.vh1: O God, save the King ⁕
verses.vh2: and answer us when we call upon you.

refrain: We will call on the name of God our God.

verses.vh1: The King shall rejoice in your strength, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: how greatly shall he rejoice in your salvation!

verses.vh1: You have given him his heart’s desire ⁕
verses.vh2: and have not denied the request of his lips.

verses.vh1: For you come to meet him with blessings of goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

verses.vh1: He asked of you life and you gave it him, ⁕
verses.vh2: length of days, for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: His honour is great because of your salvation; ⁕
verses.vh2: glory and majesty have you laid upon him.

verses.vh1: You have granted him everlasting felicity ⁕
verses.vh2: and will make him glad with joy in your presence.

verses.vh1: For the King puts his trust in God; ⁕
vh2: because of the loving-kindness of the Most High,
he shall not be overthrown.

verses.vh1: Your hand shall mark down all your enemies; ⁕
verses.vh2: your right hand will find out those who hate you.

verses.vh1: You will make them like a fiery oven in the time of your wrath; ⁕
vh2: God will swallow them up in anger
and the fire will consume them.

verses.vh1: Their fruit you will root out of the land ⁕
verses.vh2: and their descendants from among its inhabitants.

verses.vh1: Because they intend evil against you ⁕
verses.vh2: and devise wicked schemes which they cannot perform,

verses.vh1: You will put them to flight ⁕
verses.vh2: when you aim your bow at their faces.

verses.vh1: Be exalted, O God, in your own might; ⁕
verses.vh2: we will make music and sing of your power.

refrain: The King puts his trust in God.

verses.vh1: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me, ⁕
vh2: and are so far from my salvation,
from the words of my distress?

vh1: O my God, I cry in the daytime,
but you do not answer; ⁕
verses.vh2: and by night also, but I find no rest.

verses.vh1: Yet you are the Holy One, ⁕
verses.vh2: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.

verses.vh1: Our forebears trusted in you; ⁕
verses.vh2: they trusted, and you delivered them.

verses.vh1: They cried out to you and were delivered; ⁕
verses.vh2: they put their trust in you and were not confounded.

verses.vh1: But as for me, I am a worm and no man, ⁕
verses.vh2: scorned by all and despised by the people.

verses.vh1: All who see me laugh me to scorn; ⁕
verses.vh2: they curl their lips and wag their heads, saying,

verses.vh1: ‘He trusted in God; let God deliver him; ⁕
verses.vh2: let God deliver him, if God delights in him.’

verses.vh1: But it is you that took me out of the womb ⁕
verses.vh2: and laid me safe upon my mother’s breast.

verses.vh1: On you was I cast ever since I was born; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are my God even from my mother’s womb.

verses.vh1: Be not far from me, for trouble is near at hand ⁕
verses.vh2: and there is none to help.

verses.vh1: Mighty oxen come around me; ⁕
verses.vh2: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.

verses.vh1: They gape upon me with their mouths, ⁕
verses.vh2: as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.

vh1: I am poured out like water;
all my bones are out of joint; ⁕
verses.vh2: my heart has become like wax melting in the depths of my body.

vh1: My mouth is dried up like a potsherd;
my tongue cleaves to my gums; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have laid me in the dust of death.

vh1: For the hounds are all about me,
the pack of evildoers close in on me; ⁕
verses.vh2: they pierce my hands and my feet.

verses.vh1: I can count all my bones; ⁕
verses.vh2: they stand staring and looking upon me.

verses.vh1: They divide my garments among them; ⁕
verses.vh2: they cast lots for my clothing.

verses.vh1: Be not far from me, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are my strength; hasten to help me.

verses.vh1: Deliver my soul from the sword, ⁕
verses.vh2: my poor life from the power of the dog.

vh1: Save me from the lion’s mouth,
from the horns of wild oxen. ⁕
verses.vh2: You have answered me!

verses.vh1: I will tell of your name to my people; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the midst of the congregation will I praise you.

verses.vh1: Praise God, you that fear God; ⁕
vh2: O descendants of Jacob, glorify God;
stand in awe of God, O descendants of Israel.

vh1: For you have not despised nor abhorred the suffering of the poor;
neither have you hidden your face from them; ⁕
verses.vh2: but when they cried to you, you heard them.

verses.vh1: From you comes my praise in the great congregation; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will perform my vows in the presence of those that fear you.

verses.vh1: The poor shall eat and be satisfied; ⁕
vh2: those who seek you, God, shall praise you;
their hearts shall live for ever.

verses.vh1: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the families of the nations shall bow before you.

verses.vh1: For the kingdom is yours, O God ⁕
verses.vh2: and you rule over the nations.

verses.vh1: How can those who sleep in the earth bow down in worship, ⁕
verses.vh2: or those who go down to the dust kneel before you?

vh1: You have saved my life for yourself;
my descendants shall serve you; ⁕
verses.vh2: this shall be told of God for generations to come.

vh1: They shall come and make known your salvation,
to a people yet unborn, ⁕
verses.vh2: declaring that you, God, have done it.

refrain: Be not far from me, O God.

verses.vh1: God is my shepherd; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore can I lack nothing.

verses.vh1: You make me lie down in green pastures ⁕
verses.vh2: and lead me beside still waters.

verses.vh1: You shall refresh my soul ⁕
verses.vh2: and guide me in the paths of righteousness for your name’s sake.

vh1: Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I will fear no evil; ⁕
vh2: for you are with me;
your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

verses.vh1: You spread a table before me in the presence of those who trouble me; ⁕
vh2: you have anointed my head with oil
and my cup shall be full.

verses.vh1: Surely goodness and loving mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will dwell in the house of God for ever.

refrain: I will dwell in the house of God for ever.

verses.vh1: The earth is God’s and all that fills it, ⁕
verses.vh2: the compass of the world and all who dwell therein.

verses.vh1: For God has founded it upon the seas ⁕
verses.vh2: and set it firm upon the rivers of the deep.

verses.vh1: ‘Who shall ascend the hill of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: or who can rise up in God’s holy place?’

verses.vh1: ‘Those who have clean hands and a pure heart, ⁕
vh2: who have not lifted up their soul to an idol,
nor sworn an oath to a lie;

verses.vh1: ‘They shall receive a blessing from God, ⁕
verses.vh2: a just reward from the God of their salvation.’

verses.vh1: Such is the company of those who seek God, ⁕
verses.vh2: of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.

vh1: Lift up your heads, O gates;
be lifted up, you everlasting doors; ⁕
verses.vh2: and the Sovereign of glory shall come in.

verses.vh1: ‘Who is the Sovereign of glory?’ ⁕
vh2: ‘God, strong and mighty,
God who is mighty in battle.’

vh1: Lift up your heads, O gates;
be lifted up, you everlasting doors; ⁕
verses.vh2: and the Sovereign of glory shall come in.

verses.vh1: ‘Who is this Sovereign of glory?’ ⁕
vh2: ‘God of hosts,
God is the Sovereign of glory.’

refrain: God of hosts: God is the Sovereign of glory.

vh1: To you, O God, I lift up my soul;
O my God, in you I trust; ⁕
vh2: let me not be put to shame;
let not my enemies triumph over me.

verses.vh1: Let none who look to you be put to shame, ⁕
verses.vh2: but let the treacherous be shamed and frustrated.

verses.vh1: Make me to know your ways, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and teach me your paths.

verses.vh1: Lead me in your truth and teach me, ⁕
vh2: for you are the God of my salvation;
for you have I hoped all the day long.

verses.vh1: Remember, God, your compassion and love, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they are from everlasting.

verses.vh1: Remember not the sins of my youth or my transgressions, ⁕
vh2: but think on me in your goodness, O God,
according to your steadfast love.

verses.vh1: Gracious and upright is God; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore shall you teach sinners in the way.

verses.vh1: You will guide the humble in doing right ⁕
verses.vh2: and teach your way to the lowly.

verses.vh1: All the paths of God are mercy and truth ⁕
verses.vh2: to those who keep your covenant and testimonies.

verses.vh1: For your name’s sake, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: be merciful to my sin, for it is great.

verses.vh1: Who are those who fear God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Them will you teach in the way that they should choose.

verses.vh1: Their soul shall dwell at ease ⁕
verses.vh2: and their offspring shall inherit the land.

verses.vh1: The hidden purpose of God is for those who fear you ⁕
verses.vh2: and you will show them your covenant.

verses.vh1: My eyes are ever looking to God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verses.vh1: Turn to me and be gracious to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I am alone and brought very low.

verses.vh1: The sorrows of my heart have increased; ⁕
verses.vh2: O bring me out of my distress.

verses.vh1: Look upon my adversity and misery ⁕
verses.vh2: and forgive me all my sin.

verses.vh1: Look upon my enemies, for they are many ⁕
verses.vh2: and they bear a violent hatred against me.

verses.vh1: O keep my soul and deliver me; ⁕
verses.vh2: let me not be put to shame, for I have put my trust in you.

verses.vh1: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for my hope has been in you.

verses.vh1: Deliver Israel, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: out of all its troubles.

refrain: Remember, God, your compassion and love.

vh1: Give judgement for me, O God,
for I have walked with integrity; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have trusted in God and have not faltered.

verses.vh1: Test me, O God, and try me; ⁕
verses.vh2: examine my heart and my mind.

verses.vh1: For your love is before my eyes; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have walked in your truth.

verses.vh1: I have not joined the company of the false, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor consorted with the deceitful.

verses.vh1: I hate the gathering of evildoers ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will not sit down with the wicked.

verses.vh1: I will wash my hands in innocence, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may go about your altar,

verses.vh1: To make heard the voice of thanksgiving ⁕
verses.vh2: and tell of all your wonderful deeds.

verses.vh1: God, I love the house of your habitation ⁕
verses.vh2: and the place where your glory abides.

verses.vh1: Sweep me not away with sinners, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor my life with the bloodthirsty,

verses.vh1: Whose hands are full of wicked schemes ⁕
verses.vh2: and their right hand full of bribes.

verses.vh1: As for me, I will walk with integrity; ⁕
verses.vh2: redeem me, God, and be merciful to me.

verses.vh1: My foot stands firm; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the great congregation I will bless God.

refrain: God, I love the place where your glory abides.

vh1: God is my light and my salvation;
whom then shall I fear? ⁕
vh2: God is the strength of my life;
of whom then shall I be afraid?

vh1: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes,
came upon me to eat up my flesh, ⁕
verses.vh2: they stumbled and fell.

vh1: Though a host encamp against me,
my heart shall not be afraid, ⁕
vh2: and though there rise up war against me,
yet will I put my trust in you.

vh1: One thing have I asked of you, God
and that alone I seek: ⁕
vh2: that I may dwell in the house of God
all the days of my life,

verses.vh1: To behold the fair beauty of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and to seek your will in your temple.

verses.vh1: For in the day of trouble you shall hide me in your shelter; ⁕
vh2: in the secret place of your dwelling shall you hide me
and set me high upon a rock.

verses.vh1: And now you shall lift up my head ⁕
verses.vh2: above my enemies round about me;

verses.vh1: Therefore will I offer in your dwelling an oblation with great gladness; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing and make music to God.

verses.vh1: Hear my voice, O God, when I call; ⁕
verses.vh2: have mercy upon me and answer me.

verses.vh1: My heart tells of your word, ‘Seek my face.’ ⁕
verses.vh2: Your face, God, will I seek.

verses.vh1: Hide not your face from me, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor cast your servant away in displeasure.

verses.vh1: You have been my helper; ⁕
verses.vh2: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.vh1: Though my father and my mother forsake me, ⁕
verses.vh2: God will take me up.

verses.vh1: Teach me your way, O God; ⁕
vh2: lead me on a level path,
because of those who lie in wait for me.

verses.vh1: Deliver me not into the will of my adversaries, ⁕
vh2: for false witnesses have risen up against me,
and those who breathe out violence.

verses.vh1: I believe that I shall see the goodness of God ⁕
verses.vh2: in the land of the living.

vh1: Wait for God;
be strong and God shall comfort your heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: wait patiently for God.

refrain: God is my light and my salvation.

vh1: To you I call, O God my rock;
be not deaf to my cry, ⁕
vh2: lest, if you do not hear me,
I become like those who go down to the Pit.

verses.vh1: Hear the voice of my prayer when I cry out to you, ⁕
verses.vh2: when I lift up my hands to your holy of holies.

vh1: Do not snatch me away with the wicked,
with the evildoers, ⁕
vh2: who speak peaceably with their neighbours,
while malice is in their hearts.

verses.vh1: Repay them according to their deeds ⁕
verses.vh2: and according to the wickedness of their devices.

verses.vh1: Reward them according to the work of their hands ⁕
verses.vh2: and pay them their just deserts.

vh1: They take no heed of your doings, O God,
nor of the works of your hands; ⁕
vh2: therefore shall you break them down
and not build them up.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you have heard the voice of my prayer.

verses.vh1: You, O God, are my strength and my shield; ⁕
verses.vh2: my heart has trusted in you and I am helped;

verses.vh1: Therefore my heart dances for joy ⁕
verses.vh2: and in my song will I praise you.

verses.vh1: God is the strength of the people, ⁕
verses.vh2: a safe refuge for the anointed.

verses.vh1: Save your people and bless your inheritance; ⁕
verses.vh2: shepherd them and carry them for ever.

refrain: God is my strength and my shield.

verses.vh1: Ascribe to God, you powers of heaven, ⁕
verses.vh2: ascribe to God glory and strength.

verses.vh1: Ascribe to God the honour due to God’s name; ⁕
verses.vh2: worship God in the beauty of holiness.

vh1: The voice of God is upon the waters;
the God of glory thunders; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is upon the mighty waters.

verses.vh1: The voice of God is mighty in operation; ⁕
verses.vh2: the voice of God is a glorious voice.

verses.vh1: The voice of God breaks the cedar trees; ⁕
verses.vh2: God breaks the cedars of Lebanon;

verses.vh1: God makes Lebanon skip like a calf ⁕
verses.vh2: and Sirion like a young wild ox.

vh1: The voice of God splits the flash of lightning;
the voice of God shakes the wilderness; ⁕
verses.vh2: God shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

vh1: The voice of God makes the oak trees writhe
and strips the forests bare; ⁕
verses.vh2: in God’s temple all cry, ‘Glory!’

verses.vh1: God sits enthroned above the water flood; ⁕
verses.vh2: God sits enthroned as ruler for evermore.

verses.vh1: God shall give strength to God’s people; ⁕
verses.vh2: God shall give God’s people the blessing of peace.

refrain: God shall give God’s people the blessing of peace.

vh1: I will exalt you, O God,
because you have raised me up ⁕
verses.vh2: and have not let my foes triumph over me.

verses.vh1: O God my God, I cried out to you ⁕
verses.vh2: and you have healed me.

verses.vh1: You brought me up, O God, from the dead; ⁕
verses.vh2: you restored me to life from among those that go down to the Pit.

verses.vh1: Sing to God, you servants of God’s; ⁕
verses.vh2: give thanks to God’s holy name.

vh1: For God’s wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye,
God’s favour for a lifetime. ⁕
vh2: Heaviness may endure for a night,
but joy comes in the morning.

vh1: In my prosperity I said,
‘I shall never be moved. ⁕
vh2: You, God, of your goodness,
have made my hill so strong.’

verses.vh1: Then you hid your face from me ⁕
verses.vh2: and I was utterly dismayed.

verses.vh1: To you, O God, I cried; ⁕
verses.vh2: to God I made my supplication:

vh1: ‘What profit is there in my blood,
if I go down to the Pit? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will the dust praise you or declare your faithfulness?

verses.vh1: ‘Hear, O God, and have mercy upon me; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, be my helper.’

verses.vh1: You have turned my mourning into dancing; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness;

verses.vh1: Therefore my heart sings to you without ceasing; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God my God, I will give you thanks for ever.

refrain: You brought me up, O God, from the dead.

vh1: In you, O God, have I taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver me in your righteousness.

verses.vh1: Incline your ear to me; ⁕
verses.vh2: make haste to deliver me.

vh1: Be my strong rock, a fortress to save me,
for you are my rock and my stronghold; ⁕
verses.vh2: guide me, and lead me for your name’s sake.

verses.vh1: Take me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you are my strength.

verses.vh1: Into your hands I commend my spirit, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you have redeemed me, O God God of truth.

verses.vh1: I hate those who cling to worthless idols; ⁕
verses.vh2: I put my trust in God.

verses.vh1: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy, ⁕
vh2: for you have seen my affliction
and known my soul in adversity.

verses.vh1: You have not shut me up in the hand of the enemy; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have set my feet in an open place.

verses.vh1: Have mercy on me, God, for I am in trouble; ⁕
vh2: my eye is consumed with sorrow,
my soul and my body also.

vh1: For my life is wasted with grief,
and my years with sighing; ⁕
vh2: my strength fails me because of my affliction,
and my bones are consumed.

vh1: I have become a reproach to all my enemies
and even to my neighbours,
an object of dread to my acquaintances; ⁕
verses.vh2: when they see me in the street they flee from me.

verses.vh1: I am forgotten like one that is dead, out of mind; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have become like a broken vessel.

vh1: For I have heard the whispering of the crowd;
fear is on every side; ⁕
vh2: they scheme together against me,
and plot to take my life.

verses.vh1: But my trust is in you, O God. ⁕
verses.vh2: I have said, ‘You are my God.

verses.vh1: ‘My times are in your hand; ⁕
vh2: deliver me from the hand of my enemies,
and from those who persecute me.

verses.vh1: ‘Make your face to shine upon your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: and save me for your mercy’s sake.’

vh1: God, let me not be confounded
for I have called upon you; ⁕
vh2: but let the wicked be put to shame;
let them be silent in the grave.

verses.vh1: Let the lying lips be put to silence ⁕
verses.vh2: that speak against the righteous with arrogance, disdain and contempt.

vh1: How abundant is your goodness, O God,
which you have laid up for those who fear you; ⁕
verses.vh2: which you have prepared in the sight of all for those who put their trust in you.

verses.vh1: You hide them in the shelter of your presence from those who slander them; ⁕
verses.vh2: you keep them safe in your refuge from the strife of tongues.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God! ⁕
verses.vh2: For you have shown me your steadfast love when I was as a city besieged.

vh1: I had said in my alarm,
‘I have been cut off from the sight of your eyes.’ ⁕
verses.vh2: Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer when I cried out to you.

verses.vh1: Love God, all you God’s servants; ⁕
vh2: for God protects the faithful,
but repays to the full the proud.

verses.vh1: Be strong and let your heart take courage, ⁕
verses.vh2: all you who wait in hope for God.

refrain: Into your hands I commend my spirit.

verses.vh1: Happy the one whose transgression is forgiven, ⁕
verses.vh2: and whose sin is covered.

verses.vh1: Happy the one to whom God imputes no guilt, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.vh1: For I held my tongue; ⁕
verses.vh2: my bones wasted away through my groaning all the day long.

verses.vh1: Your hand was heavy upon me day and night; ⁕
verses.vh2: my moisture was dried up like the drought in summer.

verses.vh1: Then I acknowledged my sin to you ⁕
verses.vh2: and my iniquity I did not hide.

verses.vh1: I said, ‘I will confess my transgressions to God,’ ⁕
verses.vh2: and you forgave the guilt of my sin.

verses.vh1: Therefore let all the faithful make their prayers to you in time of trouble; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the great water flood, it shall not reach them.

vh1: You are a place for me to hide in;
you preserve me from trouble; ⁕
verses.vh2: you surround me with songs of deliverance.

verses.vh1: ‘I will instruct you and teach you in the way that you should go; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will guide you with my eye.

verses.vh1: ‘Be not like horse and mule which have no understanding; ⁕
vh2: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle,
or else they will not stay near you.’

verses.vh1: Great tribulations remain for the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: but mercy embraces those who trust in God.

verses.vh1: Be glad, you righteous, and rejoice in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: shout for joy, all who are true of heart.

refrain: Be glad, you righteous, and rejoice in God.

verses.vh1: Rejoice in God, O you righteous, ⁕
verses.vh2: for it is good for the just to sing praises.

verses.vh1: Praise God with the lyre; ⁕
verses.vh2: on the ten-stringed harp sing God’s praise.

verses.vh1: Sing for God a new song; ⁕
verses.vh2: play skilfully, with shouts of praise.

verses.vh1: For the word of God is true ⁕
verses.vh2: and all God’s works are sure.

verses.vh1: God loves righteousness and justice; ⁕
verses.vh2: the earth is full of the loving-kindness of God.

verses.vh1: By the word of God were the heavens made ⁕
verses.vh2: and all their host by the breath of God’s mouth.

verses.vh1: God gathers up the waters of the sea as in a waterskin ⁕
verses.vh2: and lays up the deep in God’s treasury.

verses.vh1: Let all the earth fear God; ⁕
verses.vh2: stand in awe of God, all who dwell in the world.

verses.vh1: For God spoke, and it was done; ⁕
verses.vh2: God commanded, and it stood fast.

verses.vh1: God brings the counsel of the nations to naught; ⁕
verses.vh2: God frustrates the designs of the peoples.

verses.vh1: But the counsel of God shall endure for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and the designs of God’s heart from generation to generation.

verses.vh1: Happy the nation whose God is God ⁕
verses.vh2: and the people God has chosen for God’s own.

verses.vh1: God looks down from heaven ⁕
verses.vh2: and beholds all the children of earth.

verses.vh1: From where God sits enthroned God gazes ⁕
verses.vh2: on all who dwell on the earth.

verses.vh1: God fashions all the hearts of them ⁕
verses.vh2: and understands all their works.

verses.vh1: No ruler is saved by the might of their host; ⁕
verses.vh2: no warrior delivered by their great strength.

verses.vh1: A horse is a vain hope for deliverance; ⁕
verses.vh2: for all its strength it cannot save.

vh1: Behold, the eye of God
is upon those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: on those who wait in hope for God’s steadfast love,

verses.vh1: To deliver their soul from death ⁕
verses.vh2: and to feed them in time of famine.

verses.vh1: Our soul waits longingly for God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is our help and our shield.

verses.vh1: Indeed, our heart rejoices in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: in God’s holy name have we put our trust.

verses.vh1: Let your loving-kindness, O God, be upon us, ⁕
verses.vh2: as we have set our hope on you.

refrain: The earth is full of the loving-kindness of God.

verses.vh1: I will bless God at all times; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s praise shall ever be in my mouth.

verses.vh1: My soul shall glory in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the humble hear and be glad.

verses.vh1: O magnify God with me; ⁕
verses.vh2: let us exalt God’s name together.

verses.vh1: I sought God and God answered me ⁕
verses.vh2: and delivered me from all my fears.

verses.vh1: Look upon God and be radiant ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faces shall not be ashamed.

verses.vh1: This poor soul cried, and God heard me ⁕
verses.vh2: and saved me from all my troubles.

verses.vh1: The angel of God encamps around those who fear God ⁕
verses.vh2: and delivers them.

verses.vh1: O taste and see that God is gracious; ⁕
verses.vh2: blessed is the one who trusts in God.

verses.vh1: Fear God, all you God’s holy ones, ⁕
verses.vh2: for those who fear God lack nothing.

verses.vh1: Lions may lack and suffer hunger, ⁕
vh2: but those who seek God
lack nothing that is good.

verses.vh1: Come, my children, and listen to me; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will teach you the fear of God.

verses.vh1: Who is there who delights in life ⁕
verses.vh2: and longs for days to enjoy good things?

verses.vh1: Keep your tongue from evil ⁕
verses.vh2: and your lips from lying words.

verses.vh1: Turn from evil and do good; ⁕
verses.vh2: seek peace and pursue it.

verses.vh1: The eyes of God are upon the righteous ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s ears are open to their cry.

verses.vh1: The face of God is against those who do evil, ⁕
verses.vh2: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.vh1: The righteous cry and God hears them ⁕
verses.vh2: and delivers them out of all their troubles.

verses.vh1: God is near to the brokenhearted ⁕
verses.vh2: and will save those who are crushed in spirit.

verses.vh1: Many are the troubles of the righteous; ⁕
verses.vh2: from them all will God deliver them.

verses.vh1: God keeps all their bones, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that not one of them is broken.

verses.vh1: But evil shall slay the wicked ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.

verses.vh1: God ransoms the life of God’s servants ⁕
verses.vh2: and will condemn none who seek refuge in God.

refrain: O taste and see that God is gracious.

verses.vh1: Contend, O God, with those that contend with me; ⁕
verses.vh2: fight against those that fight against me.

verses.vh1: Take up shield and buckler ⁕
verses.vh2: and rise up to help me.

verses.vh1: Draw the spear and bar the way against those who pursue me; ⁕
verses.vh2: say to my soul, ‘I am your salvation.’

verses.vh1: Let those who seek after my life be shamed and disgraced; ⁕
verses.vh2: let those who plot my ruin fall back and be put to confusion.

verses.vh1: Let them be as chaff before the wind, ⁕
verses.vh2: with the angel of God thrusting them down.

verses.vh1: Let their way be dark and slippery, ⁕
verses.vh2: with the angel of God pursuing them.

verses.vh1: For they have secretly spread a net for me without a cause; ⁕
verses.vh2: without any cause they have dug a pit for my soul.

verses.vh1: Let ruin come upon them unawares; ⁕
vh2: let them be caught in the net they laid;
let them fall in it to their destruction.

verses.vh1: Then will my soul be joyful in God ⁕
verses.vh2: and glory in God’s salvation.

verses.vh1: My very bones will say, ‘God, who is like you? ⁕
vh2: You deliver the poor from those that are too strong for them,
the poor and needy from those who would despoil them.’

verses.vh1: False witnesses rose up against me; ⁕
verses.vh2: they charged me with things I knew not.

verses.vh1: They rewarded me evil for good, ⁕
verses.vh2: to the desolation of my soul.

verses.vh1: But as for me, when they were sick I put on sackcloth ⁕
verses.vh2: and humbled myself with fasting;

verses.vh1: When my prayer returned empty to my bosom, ⁕
verses.vh2: it was as though I grieved for my friend or sibling;

verses.vh1: I behaved as one who mourns for their parent, ⁕
verses.vh2: bowed down and brought very low.

vh1: But when I stumbled, they gathered in delight;
they gathered together against me; ⁕
vh2: as if they were strangers I did not know
they tore at me without ceasing.

verses.vh1: When I fell they mocked me; ⁕
verses.vh2: they gnashed at me with their teeth.

verses.vh1: O God, how long will you look on? ⁕
vh2: Rescue my soul from their ravages,
and my poor life from the young lions.

verses.vh1: I will give you thanks in the great congregation; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will praise you in the mighty throng.

verses.vh1: Do not let my treacherous foes rejoice over me, ⁕
verses.vh2: or those who hate me without a cause mock me with their glances.

verses.vh1: For they do not speak of peace, ⁕
verses.vh2: but invent deceitful schemes against those that are quiet in the land.

verses.vh1: They opened wide their mouths and derided me, saying ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘We have seen it with our very eyes.’

verses.vh1: This you have seen, O God; do not keep silent; ⁕
verses.vh2: go not far from me, O God.

verses.vh1: Awake, arise, to my cause, ⁕
verses.vh2: to my defence, my God and my Ruler!

vh1: Give me justice, O God my God,
according to your righteousness; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them not triumph over me.

vh1: Let them not say to themselves,
‘Our heart’s desire!’ ⁕
verses.vh2: Let them not say, ‘We have swallowed them up.’

verses.vh1: Let all who rejoice at my trouble be put to shame and confusion; ⁕
verses.vh2: let those who boast against me be clothed with shame and dishonour.

verses.vh1: Let those who favour my cause rejoice and be glad; ⁕
vh2: let them say always,
‘Great is God, who delights in God’s servant’s well-being.’

verses.vh1: So shall my tongue be talking of your righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and of your praise all the day long.

refrain: Give me justice, O God my God,
according to your righteousness.

verses.vh1: Sin whispers to the wicked, in the depths of their heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.vh1: They flatter themselves in their own eyes ⁕
verses.vh2: that their abominable sin will not be found out.

verses.vh1: The words of their mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit; ⁕
verses.vh2: they have ceased to act wisely and to do good.

vh1: They think out mischief upon their beds
and have set themselves in no good way; ⁕
verses.vh2: nor do they abhor that which is evil.

verses.vh1: Your love, O God, reaches to the heavens ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

vh1: Your righteousness stands like the strong mountains,
your justice like the great deep; ⁕
verses.vh2: you, God, shall save both human and beast.

verses.vh1: How precious is your loving mercy, O God! ⁕
verses.vh2: All mortal flesh shall take refuge under the shadow of your wings.

verses.vh1: They shall be satisfied with the abundance of your house; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall drink from the river of your delights.

verses.vh1: For with you is the well of life ⁕
verses.vh2: and in your light shall we see light.

verses.vh1: O continue your loving-kindness to those who know you ⁕
verses.vh2: and your righteousness to those who are true of heart.

verses.vh1: Let not the foot of pride come against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor the hand of the ungodly thrust me away.

verses.vh1: There are they fallen, all who work wickedness. ⁕
verses.vh2: They are cast down and shall not be able to stand.

refrain: With you, O God, is the well of life.

verses.vh1: Fret not because of evildoers; ⁕
verses.vh2: be not jealous of those who do wrong.

verses.vh1: For they shall soon wither like grass ⁕
verses.vh2: and like the green herb fade away.

verses.vh1: Trust in God and be doing good; ⁕
verses.vh2: dwell in the land and be nourished with truth.

verses.vh1: Let your delight be in God ⁕
verses.vh2: and God will give you your heart’s desire.

verses.vh1: Commit your way to God and put your trust in God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God will bring it to pass.

verses.vh1: God will make your righteousness as clear as the light ⁕
verses.vh2: and your just dealing as the noonday.

verses.vh1: Be still before God and wait for God; ⁕
verses.vh2: do not fret over those that prosper as they follow their evil schemes.

verses.vh1: Refrain from anger and abandon wrath; ⁕
verses.vh2: do not fret, lest you be moved to do evil.

verses.vh1: For evildoers shall be cut off, ⁕
verses.vh2: but those who wait upon God shall possess the land.

verses.vh1: Yet a little while and the wicked shall be no more; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will search for their place and find them gone.

verses.vh1: But the lowly shall possess the land ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall delight in abundance of peace.

verses.vh1: The wicked plot against the righteous ⁕
verses.vh2: and gnash at them with their teeth.

verses.vh1: God shall laugh at the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God sees that their day is coming.

verses.vh1: The wicked draw their sword and bend their bow to strike down the poor and needy, ⁕
verses.vh2: to slaughter those who walk in truth.

verses.vh1: Their sword shall go through their own heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and their bows shall be broken.

verses.vh1: The little that the righteous have ⁕
verses.vh2: is better than great riches of the wicked.

verses.vh1: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, ⁕
verses.vh2: but God upholds the righteous.

verses.vh1: God knows the days of the godly, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their inheritance shall stand for ever.

verses.vh1: They shall not be put to shame in the perilous time, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in days of famine they shall have enough.

vh1: But the wicked shall perish;
like the glory of the meadows, the enemies of God shall vanish; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall vanish like smoke.

verses.vh1: The wicked borrow and do not repay, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the righteous are generous in giving.

verses.vh1: For those who are blest by God shall possess the land, ⁕
verses.vh2: but those who are cursed by God shall be rooted out.

verses.vh1: When your steps are guided by God ⁕
verses.vh2: and you delight in God’s way,

verses.vh1: Though you stumble, you shall not fall headlong, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God holds you fast by the hand.

verses.vh1: I have been young and now am old, ⁕
vh2: yet never have I seen the righteous forsaken,
or their children begging their bread.

verses.vh1: All the day long they are generous in lending, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their children also shall be blest.

verses.vh1: Depart from evil and do good ⁕
verses.vh2: and you shall abide for ever.

verses.vh1: For God loves the thing that is right ⁕
verses.vh2: and will not forsake God’s faithful ones.

verses.vh1: The unjust shall be destroyed for ever, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the offspring of the wicked shall be rooted out.

verses.vh1: The righteous shall possess the land ⁕
verses.vh2: and dwell in it for ever.

verses.vh1: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their tongue speaks the thing that is right.

verses.vh1: The law of their God is in their heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and their footsteps shall not slide.

verses.vh1: The wicked spy on the righteous ⁕
verses.vh2: and seek occasion to slay them.

verses.vh1: God will not leave them in their hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor let them be condemned when they are judged.

verses.vh1: Wait upon God and keep God’s way; ⁕
vh2: God will raise you up to possess the land,
and when the wicked are uprooted, you shall see it.

verses.vh1: I myself have seen the wicked in great power ⁕
verses.vh2: and flourishing like a tree in full leaf.

verses.vh1: I went by and lo, they were gone; ⁕
verses.vh2: I sought them, but they could nowhere be found.

verses.vh1: Keep innocence and heed the thing that is right, ⁕
verses.vh2: for that will bring you peace at the last.

verses.vh1: But the sinners shall perish together, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the posterity of the wicked shall be rooted out.

verses.vh1: The salvation of the righteous comes from God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is their stronghold in the time of trouble.

verses.vh1: God shall stand by them and deliver them; ⁕
vh2: God shall deliver them from the wicked and shall save them,
because they have put their trust in God.

refrain: The salvation of the righteous comes from God.

verses.vh1: Rebuke me not, O God, in your anger, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither chasten me in your heavy displeasure.

verses.vh1: For your arrows have stuck fast in me ⁕
verses.vh2: and your hand presses hard upon me.

vh1: There is no health in my flesh
because of your indignation; ⁕
verses.vh2: there is no peace in my bones because of my sin.

verses.vh1: For my iniquities have gone over my head; ⁕
verses.vh2: their weight is a burden too heavy to bear.

verses.vh1: My wounds stink and fester ⁕
verses.vh2: because of my foolishness.

verses.vh1: I am utterly bowed down and brought very low; ⁕
verses.vh2: I go about mourning all the day long.

verses.vh1: My loins are filled with searing pain; ⁕
verses.vh2: there is no health in my flesh.

verses.vh1: I am feeble and utterly crushed; ⁕
verses.vh2: I roar aloud because of the disquiet of my heart.

verses.vh1: O God, you know all my desires ⁕
verses.vh2: and my sighing is not hidden from you.

verses.vh1: My heart is pounding, my strength has failed me; ⁕
verses.vh2: the light of my eyes is gone from me.

verses.vh1: My friends and companions stand apart from my affliction; ⁕
verses.vh2: my neighbours stand afar off.

verses.vh1: Those who seek after my life lay snares for me; ⁕
vh2: and those who would harm me whisper evil
and mutter slander all the day long.

verses.vh1: But I am like one who is deaf and hears not, ⁕
verses.vh2: like one that is dumb, who does not open their mouth.

verses.vh1: I have become like one who does not hear ⁕
verses.vh2: and from whose mouth comes no retort.

verses.vh1: For in you, God, have I put my trust; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will answer me, O God my God.

verses.vh1: For I said, ‘Let them not triumph over me, ⁕
verses.vh2: those who exult over me when my foot slips.’

verses.vh1: Truly, I am on the verge of falling ⁕
verses.vh2: and my pain is ever with me.

verses.vh1: I will confess my iniquity ⁕
verses.vh2: and be sorry for my sin.

verses.vh1: Those that are my enemies without any cause are mighty, ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who hate me wrongfully are many in number.

verses.vh1: Those who repay evil for good are against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: because the good is what I seek.

verses.vh1: Forsake me not, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: be not far from me, O my God.

verses.vh1: Make haste to help me, ⁕
verses.vh2: O God of my salvation.

refrain: Make haste to help me,
O God of my salvation.

verses.vh1: I said, ‘I will keep watch over my ways, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that I offend not with my tongue.

verses.vh1: ‘I will guard my mouth with a muzzle, ⁕
verses.vh2: while the wicked are in my sight.’

verses.vh1: So I held my tongue and said nothing; ⁕
verses.vh2: I kept silent but to no avail.

verses.vh1: My distress increased, my heart grew hot within me; ⁕
vh2: while I mused, the fire was kindled
and I spoke out with my tongue:

verses.vh1: ‘God, let me know my end and the number of my days, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may know how short my time is.

vh1: ‘You have made my days but a handsbreadth,
and my lifetime is as nothing in your sight; ⁕
verses.vh2: truly, even those who stand upright are but a breath.

vh1: ‘We walk about like a shadow
and in vain we are in turmoil; ⁕
verses.vh2: we heap up riches and cannot tell who will gather them.

verses.vh1: ‘And now, what is my hope? ⁕
verses.vh2: Truly my hope is even in you.

verses.vh1: ‘Deliver me from all my transgressions ⁕
verses.vh2: and do not make me the taunt of the fool.’

verses.vh1: I fell silent and did not open my mouth, ⁕
verses.vh2: for surely it was your doing.

verses.vh1: Take away your plague from me; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am consumed by the blows of your hand.

vh1: With rebukes for sin you punish us;
like a moth you consume our beauty; ⁕
verses.vh2: truly, everyone is but a breath.

verses.vh1: Hear my prayer, O God, and give ear to my cry; ⁕
verses.vh2: hold not your peace at my tears.

verses.vh1: For I am but a stranger with you, ⁕
verses.vh2: a wayfarer, as all my forebears were.

verses.vh1: Turn your gaze from me, that I may be glad again, ⁕
verses.vh2: before I go my way and am no more.

refrain: God, let me know my end and the number of my days.

verses.vh1: I waited patiently for God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God inclined to me and heard my cry.

vh1: God brought me out of the roaring pit,
out of the mire and clay; ⁕
verses.vh2: God set my feet upon a rock and made my footing sure.

vh1: God has put a new song in my mouth,
a song of praise to our God; ⁕
vh2: many shall see and fear
and put their trust in God.

verses.vh1: Blessed is the one who trusts in God, ⁕
verses.vh2: who does not turn to the proud that follow a lie.

vh1: Great are the wonders you have done, O God my God.
How great your designs for us! ⁕
verses.vh2: There is none that can be compared with you.

verses.vh1: If I were to proclaim them and tell of them ⁕
verses.vh2: they would be more than I am able to express.

verses.vh1: Sacrifice and offering you do not desire ⁕
verses.vh2: but my ears you have opened;

verses.vh1: Burnt offering and sacrifice for sin you have not required; ⁕
verses.vh2: then said I: ‘Lo, I come.

verses.vh1: ‘In the scroll of the book it is written of me that I should do your will, O my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I delight to do it: your law is within my heart.’

verses.vh1: I have declared your righteousness in the great congregation; ⁕
vh2: behold, I did not restrain my lips,
and that, O God, you know.

vh1: Your righteousness I have not hidden in my heart;
I have spoken of your faithfulness and your salvation; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have not concealed your loving-kindness and truth from the great congregation.

verses.vh1: Do not withhold your compassion from me, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let your love and your faithfulness always preserve me,

vh1: For innumerable troubles have come about me;
my sins have overtaken me so that I cannot look up; ⁕
vh2: they are more in number than the hairs of my head,
and my heart fails me.

verses.vh1: Be pleased, O God, to deliver me; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, make haste to help me.

verses.vh1: Let them be ashamed and altogether dismayed who seek after my life to destroy it; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be driven back and put to shame who wish me evil.

verses.vh1: Let those who heap insults upon me ⁕
verses.vh2: be desolate because of their shame.

verses.vh1: Let all who seek you rejoice in you and be glad; ⁕
vh2: let those who love your salvation say always,
‘God is great.’

verses.vh1: Though I am poor and needy, ⁕
verses.vh2: God cares for me.

verses.vh1: You are my helper and my deliverer; ⁕
verses.vh2: O my God, make no delay.

refrain: Great are the wonders you have done, O God my God.

verses.vh1: Blessed are those who consider the poor and needy; ⁕
verses.vh2: God will deliver them in the time of trouble.

vh1: God preserves them and restores their life,
that they may be happy in the land; ⁕
verses.vh2: God will not hand them over to the will of their enemies.

verses.vh1: God sustains them on their sickbed; ⁕
verses.vh2: their sickness, God, you will remove.

verses.vh1: And so I said, ‘God, be merciful to me; ⁕
verses.vh2: heal me, for I have sinned against you.’

verses.vh1: My enemies speak evil about me, ⁕
verses.vh2: asking when I shall die and my name perish.

verses.vh1: If they come to see me, they utter empty words; ⁕
vh2: their heart gathers mischief;
when they go out, they tell it abroad.

verses.vh1: All my enemies whisper together against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: against me they devise evil,

verses.vh1: Saying that a deadly thing has laid hold on me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and that I will not rise again from where I lie.

vh1: Even my bosom friend, whom I trusted,
who ate of my bread, ⁕
verses.vh2: has lifted up their heel against me.

verses.vh1: But you, O God, be merciful to me ⁕
verses.vh2: and raise me up, that I may reward them.

verses.vh1: By this I know that you favour me, ⁕
verses.vh2: that my enemy does not triumph over me.

verses.vh1: Because of my integrity you uphold me ⁕
verses.vh2: and will set me before your face for ever.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God God of Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.

refrain: O God, be merciful to me.

verses.vh1: As the deer longs for the water brooks, ⁕
verses.vh2: so longs my soul for you, O God.

verses.vh1: My soul is athirst for God, even for the living God; ⁕
verses.vh2: when shall I come before the presence of God?

verses.vh1: My tears have been my bread day and night, ⁕
verses.vh2: while all day long they say to me, ‘Where is now your God?’

verses.vh1: Now when I think on these things, I pour out my soul: ⁕
vh2: how I went with the multitude
and led the procession to the house of God,

verses.vh1: With the voice of praise and thanksgiving, ⁕
verses.vh2: among those who kept holy day.

verses.vh1: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why are you so disquieted within me?

verses.vh1: O put your trust in God; ⁕
vh2: for I will yet give God thanks,
who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.vh1: My soul is heavy within me; ⁕
vh2: therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan,
and from Hermon and the hill of Mizar.

verses.vh1: Deep calls to deep in the thunder of your waterfalls; ⁕
verses.vh2: all your breakers and waves have gone over me.

verses.vh1: God will grant God’s loving-kindness in the daytime; ⁕
vh2: through the night God’s song will be with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.

vh1: I say to God my rock,
‘Why have you forgotten me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresses me?’

verses.vh1: As they crush my bones, my enemies mock me; ⁕
verses.vh2: while all day long they say to me, ‘Where is now your God?’

verses.vh1: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why are you so disquieted within me?

verses.vh1: O put your trust in God; ⁕
vh2: for I will yet give God thanks,
who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

vh1: Give judgement for me, O God,
and defend my cause against an ungodly people; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver me from the deceitful and the wicked.

vh1: For you are the God of my refuge;
why have you cast me from you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresses me?

verses.vh1: O send out your light and your truth, that they may lead me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and bring me to your holy hill and to your dwelling,

vh1: That I may go to the altar of God,
to the God of my joy and gladness; ⁕
verses.vh2: and on the lyre I will give thanks to you, O God my God.

verses.vh1: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: and why are you so disquieted within me?

verses.vh1: O put your trust in God; ⁕
vh2: for I will yet give God thanks,
who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.vh1: We have heard with our ears, O God, our forebears have told us, ⁕
verses.vh2: all that you did in their days, in time of old;

verses.vh1: How with your hand you drove out nations and planted us in, ⁕
verses.vh2: and broke the power of peoples and set us free.

verses.vh1: For not by their own sword did our ancestors take the land ⁕
verses.vh2: nor did their own arm save them,

verses.vh1: But your right hand, your arm, and the light of your countenance, ⁕
verses.vh2: because you were gracious to them.

verses.vh1: You are my Sovereign and my God, ⁕
verses.vh2: who commanded salvation for Jacob.

verses.vh1: Through you we drove back our adversaries; ⁕
verses.vh2: through your name we trod down our foes.

verses.vh1: For I did not trust in my bow; ⁕
verses.vh2: it was not my own sword that saved me;

verses.vh1: It was you that saved us from our enemies ⁕
verses.vh2: and put our adversaries to shame.

verses.vh1: We gloried in God all the day long, ⁕
verses.vh2: and were ever praising your name.

verses.vh1: But now you have rejected us and brought us to shame, ⁕
verses.vh2: and go not out with our armies.

verses.vh1: You have made us turn our backs on our enemies, ⁕
verses.vh2: and our enemies have despoiled us.

verses.vh1: You have made us like sheep to be slaughtered, ⁕
verses.vh2: and have scattered us among the nations.

verses.vh1: You have sold your people for a pittance ⁕
verses.vh2: and made no profit on their sale.

verses.vh1: You have made us the taunt of our neighbours, ⁕
verses.vh2: the scorn and derision of those that are round about us.

verses.vh1: You have made us a byword among the nations; ⁕
verses.vh2: among the peoples they wag their heads.

verses.vh1: My confusion is daily before me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and shame has covered my face,

verses.vh1: At the taunts of the slanderer and reviler, ⁕
verses.vh2: at the sight of the enemy and avenger.

vh1: All this has come upon us,
though we have not forgotten you ⁕
