verses.vh2: and have not played false to your covenant.

verses.vh1: Our hearts have not turned back, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor our steps gone out of your way,

verses.vh1: Yet you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals, ⁕
verses.vh2: and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.vh1: If we have forgotten the name of our God, ⁕
verses.vh2: or stretched out our hands to any strange god,

verses.vh1: Will not God search it out? ⁕
verses.vh2: For God know the secrets of the heart.

verses.vh1: But for your sake are we killed all the day long, ⁕
verses.vh2: and are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

verses.vh1: Rise up! Why sleep, O God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Awake, and do not reject us for ever.

verses.vh1: Why do you hide your face ⁕
verses.vh2: and forget our grief and oppression?

verses.vh1: Our soul is bowed down to the dust; ⁕
verses.vh2: our belly cleaves to the earth.

verses.vh1: Rise up, O God, to help us ⁕
verses.vh2: and redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love.

refrain: Rise up, O God, to help us.

verses.vh1: My heart is astir with gracious words; ⁕
vh2: as I make my song for the King,
my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

verses.vh1: You are the fairest of men; ⁕
vh2: full of grace are your lips,
for God has blest you for ever.

verses.vh1: Gird your sword upon your thigh, O mighty one; ⁕
verses.vh2: gird on your majesty and glory.

verses.vh1: Ride on and prosper in the cause of truth ⁕
verses.vh2: and for the sake of humility and righteousness.

verses.vh1: Your right hand will teach you terrible things; ⁕
vh2: your arrows will be sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies,
so that peoples fall beneath you.

verses.vh1: Your throne is God’s throne, for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: the sceptre of your kingdom is the sceptre of righteousness.

verses.vh1: You love righteousness and hate iniquity; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.

verses.vh1: All your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes and cassia; ⁕
verses.vh2: from ivory palaces the music of strings makes you glad.

verses.vh1: The children of rulers are among your court; ⁕
verses.vh2: at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.

verses.vh1: Hear, O child; consider and incline your ear; ⁕
verses.vh2: forget your own people and your parents’ house.

verses.vh1: So shall the King have pleasure in your beauty; ⁕
verses.vh2: he is your ruler, so do him honour.

verses.vh1: The people of Tyre shall bring you gifts; ⁕
verses.vh2: the richest of the people shall seek your favour.

verses.vh1: The King’s child is all glorious within; ⁕
verses.vh2: their clothing is embroidered cloth of gold.

verses.vh1: They shall be brought to the King in raiment of needlework; ⁕
verses.vh2: after them the ones that are their companions.

verses.vh1: With joy and gladness shall they be brought ⁕
verses.vh2: and enter into the palace of the King.

verses.vh1: ‘Instead of your parents you shall have heirs, ⁕
verses.vh2: whom you shall make rulers over all the land.

verses.vh1: ‘I will make your name to be remembered through all generations; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore shall the peoples praise you for ever and ever.’

refrain: Behold our defender, O God,
and look upon the face of your anointed.

verses.vh1: God is our refuge and strength, ⁕
verses.vh2: a very present help in trouble;

verses.vh1: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved, ⁕
verses.vh2: and though the mountains tremble in the heart of the sea;

verses.vh1: Though the waters rage and swell, ⁕
verses.vh2: and though the mountains quake at the towering seas.

verses.vh1: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: the holy place of the dwelling of the Most High.

vh1: God is in the midst of them;
therefore shall they not be removed; ⁕
verses.vh2: God shall help them at the break of day.

verses.vh1: The nations are in uproar and the kingdoms are shaken, ⁕
verses.vh2: but God utters God’s voice and the earth shall melt away.

verses.vh1: God of hosts is with us; ⁕
verses.vh2: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

verses.vh1: Come and behold the works of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: what destruction God has wrought upon the earth.

verses.vh1: God makes wars to cease in all the world; ⁕
vh2: God shatters the bow and snaps the spear
and burns the chariots in the fire.

verses.vh1: ‘Be still, and know that I am God; ⁕
vh2: I will be exalted among the nations;
I will be exalted in the earth.’

verses.vh1: God of hosts is with us; ⁕
verses.vh2: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

verses.vh1: Clap your hands together, all you peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: O sing to God with shouts of joy.

verses.vh1: For God Most High is to be feared; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is the great Ruler over all the earth.

verses.vh1: God subdued the peoples under us ⁕
verses.vh2: and the nations under our feet.

verses.vh1: God has chosen our heritage for us, ⁕
verses.vh2: the pride of Jacob, whom God loves.

verses.vh1: God has gone up with a merry noise, ⁕
verses.vh2: God with the sound of the trumpet.

verses.vh1: O sing praises to God, sing praises; ⁕
verses.vh2: sing praises to our Sovereign, sing praises.

verses.vh1: For God is the Ruler of all the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: sing praises with all your skill.

verses.vh1: God reigns over the nations; ⁕
verses.vh2: God has taken God’s seat upon God’s holy throne.

verses.vh1: The nobles of the peoples are gathered together ⁕
verses.vh2: with the people of the God of Abraham.

verses.vh1: For the powers of the earth belong to God ⁕
verses.vh2: and God is very highly exalted.

refrain: O sing praises to God, sing praises.

verses.vh1: Great is God and highly to be praised, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the city of our God.

verses.vh1: God’s holy mountain is fair and lifted high, ⁕
verses.vh2: the joy of all the earth.

verses.vh1: On Mount Zion, the divine dwelling place, ⁕
verses.vh2: stands the city of the great Sovereign.

verses.vh1: In Zion’s palaces God has let it be known ⁕
verses.vh2: that God is a sure refuge.

verses.vh1: For behold, the rulers of the earth assembled ⁕
verses.vh2: and swept forward together.

verses.vh1: They saw, and were dumbfounded; ⁕
verses.vh2: dismayed, they fled in terror.

vh1: Trembling seized them there;
they writhed like a woman in labour, ⁕
verses.vh2: as when the east wind shatters the ships of Tarshish.

verses.vh1: As we had heard, so have we seen in the city of God of hosts, the city of our God: ⁕
verses.vh2: God has established Zion for ever.

verses.vh1: We have waited on your loving-kindness, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the midst of your temple.

vh1: As with your name, O God,
so your praise reaches to the ends of the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: your right hand is full of justice.

verses.vh1: Let Mount Zion rejoice and the children of Judah be glad, ⁕
verses.vh2: because of your judgements, O God.

vh1: Walk about Zion and go round about;
count all the towers; ⁕
verses.vh2: consider well the bulwarks; pass through the citadels,

verses.vh1: That you may tell those who come after that such is our God for ever and ever. ⁕
verses.vh2: It is God that shall be our guide for evermore.

refrain: We have waited on your loving-kindness, O God.

verses.vh1: Hear this, all you peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: listen, all you that dwell in the world,

verses.vh1: You of low or high degree, ⁕
verses.vh2: both rich and poor together.

verses.vh1: My mouth shall speak of wisdom ⁕
verses.vh2: and my heart shall meditate on understanding.

verses.vh1: I will incline my ear to a parable; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will unfold my riddle with the lyre.

verses.vh1: Why should I fear in evil days, ⁕
verses.vh2: when the malice of my foes surrounds me,

verses.vh1: Such as trust in their goods ⁕
verses.vh2: and glory in the abundance of their riches?

verses.vh1: For no one can indeed ransom another ⁕
verses.vh2: or pay to God the price of deliverance.

verses.vh1: To ransom a soul is too costly; ⁕
verses.vh2: there is no price one could pay for it,

verses.vh1: So that they might live for ever, ⁕
verses.vh2: and never see the grave.

vh1: For we see that the wise die also;
with the foolish and ignorant they perish ⁕
verses.vh2: and leave their riches to others.

vh1: Their tomb is their home for ever,
their dwelling through all generations, ⁕
verses.vh2: though they call their lands after their own names.

verses.vh1: Those who have honour, but lack understanding, ⁕
verses.vh2: are like the beasts that perish.

verses.vh1: Such is the way of those who boast in themselves, ⁕
verses.vh2: the end of those who delight in their own words.

vh1: Like a flock of sheep they are destined to die;
death is their shepherd; ⁕
verses.vh2: they go down straight to the Pit.

verses.vh1: Their beauty shall waste away, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the land of the dead shall be their dwelling.

verses.vh1: But God shall ransom my soul; ⁕
verses.vh2: from the grasp of death will God take me.

verses.vh1: Be not afraid if some grow rich ⁕
verses.vh2: and the glory of their house increases,

verses.vh1: For they will carry nothing away when they die, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor will their glory follow after them.

verses.vh1: Though they count themselves happy while they live ⁕
verses.vh2: and praise you for your success,

verses.vh1: They shall enter the company of their ancestors ⁕
verses.vh2: who will nevermore see the light.

verses.vh1: Those who have honour, but lack understanding, ⁕
verses.vh2: are like the beasts that perish.

refrain: Blessed is the one who trusts in God.

verses.vh1: God, the most mighty God, has spoken ⁕
verses.vh2: and called the world from the rising of the sun to its setting.

verses.vh1: Out of Zion, perfect in beauty, God shines forth; ⁕
verses.vh2: our God comes and will not keep silence.

verses.vh1: Consuming fire goes out before God ⁕
verses.vh2: and a mighty tempest stirs about God.

verses.vh1: God calls the heaven above, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the earth, that God may judge God’s people:

verses.vh1: ‘Gather to me my faithful, ⁕
verses.vh2: who have sealed my covenant with sacrifice.’

verses.vh1: Let the heavens declare God’s righteousness, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God is judge.

verses.vh1: Hear, O my people, and I will speak: ⁕
vh2: ‘I will testify against you, O Israel;
for I am God, your God.

verses.vh1: ‘I will not reprove you for your sacrifices, ⁕
verses.vh2: for your burnt offerings are always before me.

verses.vh1: ‘I will take no bull out of your house, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor he-goat out of your folds,

verses.vh1: ‘For all the beasts of the forest are mine, ⁕
verses.vh2: the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.vh1: ‘I know every bird of the mountains ⁕
verses.vh2: and the insect of the field is mine.

verses.vh1: ‘If I were hungry, I would not tell you, ⁕
verses.vh2: for the whole world is mine and all that fills it.

verses.vh1: ‘Do you think I eat the flesh of bulls, ⁕
verses.vh2: or drink the blood of goats?

verses.vh1: ‘Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving ⁕
verses.vh2: and fulfil your vows to God Most High.

verses.vh1: ‘Call upon me in the day of trouble; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will deliver you and you shall honour me.’

verses.vh1: But to the wicked, says God: ⁕
vh2: ‘Why do you recite my statutes
and take my covenant upon your lips,

verses.vh1: ‘Since you refuse to be disciplined ⁕
verses.vh2: and have cast my words behind you?

verses.vh1: ‘When you saw a thief, you made friends with them ⁕
verses.vh2: and you threw in your lot with adulterers.

verses.vh1: ‘You have loosed your lips for evil ⁕
verses.vh2: and harnessed your tongue to deceit.

verses.vh1: ‘You sit and speak evil of your sibling; ⁕
verses.vh2: you slander your own mother’s child.

verses.vh1: ‘These things have you done, and should I keep silence? ⁕
verses.vh2: Did you think that I am even such a one as yourself?

verses.vh1: ‘But no, I must reprove you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and set before your eyes the things that you have done.

verses.vh1: ‘You that forget God, consider this well, ⁕
verses.vh2: lest I tear you apart and there is none to deliver you.

verses.vh1: ‘Whoever offers me the sacrifice of thanksgiving honours me ⁕
verses.vh2: and to those who keep my way will I show the salvation of God.’

refrain: Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving.

verses.vh1: Have mercy on me, O God, in your great goodness; ⁕
verses.vh2: according to the abundance of your compassion blot out my offences.

verses.vh1: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness ⁕
verses.vh2: and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.vh1: For I acknowledge my faults ⁕
verses.vh2: and my sin is ever before me.

verses.vh1: Against you only have I sinned ⁕
verses.vh2: and done what is evil in your sight,

verses.vh1: So that you are justified in your sentence ⁕
verses.vh2: and righteous in your judgement.

verses.vh1: I have been wicked even from my birth, ⁕
verses.vh2: a sinner when my mother conceived me.

verses.vh1: Behold, you desire truth deep within me ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall make me understand wisdom in the depths of my heart.

verses.vh1: Purge me with hyssop and I shall be clean; ⁕
verses.vh2: wash me and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.vh1: Make me hear of joy and gladness, ⁕
verses.vh2: that the bones you have broken may rejoice.

verses.vh1: Turn your face from my sins ⁕
verses.vh2: and blot out all my misdeeds.

verses.vh1: Make me a clean heart, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.vh1: Cast me not away from your presence ⁕
verses.vh2: and take not your holy spirit from me.

verses.vh1: Give me again the joy of your salvation ⁕
verses.vh2: and sustain me with your gracious spirit;

verses.vh1: Then shall I teach your ways to the wicked ⁕
verses.vh2: and sinners shall return to you.

vh1: Deliver me from my guilt, O God,
the God of my salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness.

verses.vh1: O God, open my lips ⁕
verses.vh2: and my mouth shall proclaim your praise.

verses.vh1: For you desire no sacrifice, else I would give it; ⁕
verses.vh2: you take no delight in burnt offerings.

verses.vh1: The sacrifice of God is a broken spirit; ⁕
verses.vh2: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

verses.vh1: O be favourable and gracious to Zion; ⁕
verses.vh2: build up the walls of Jerusalem.

vh1: Then you will accept sacrifices offered in righteousness,
the burnt offerings and oblations; ⁕
verses.vh2: then shall they offer up bulls on your altar.

refrain: The sacrifice of God is a broken spirit.

verses.vh1: Why do you glory in evil, you tyrant, ⁕
verses.vh2: while the goodness of God endures continually?

verses.vh1: You plot destruction, you deceiver; ⁕
verses.vh2: your tongue is like a sharpened razor.

verses.vh1: You love evil rather than good, ⁕
verses.vh2: falsehood rather than the word of truth.

verses.vh1: You love all words that hurt, ⁕
verses.vh2: O you deceitful tongue.

verses.vh1: Therefore God shall utterly bring you down; ⁕
vh2: God shall take you and pluck you out of your tent
and root you out of the land of the living.

verses.vh1: The righteous shall see this and tremble; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall laugh you to scorn, and say:

verses.vh1: ‘This is the one who did not take God for a refuge, ⁕
verses.vh2: but trusted in great riches and relied upon wickedness.’

verses.vh1: But I am like a spreading olive tree in the house of God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I trust in the goodness of God for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: I will always give thanks to you for what you have done; ⁕
vh2: I will hope in your name,
for your faithful ones delight in it.

refrain: I trust in the goodness of God for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: Fools have said in their heart, ‘There is no God.’ ⁕
vh2: Corrupt are they, and abominable in their wickedness;
there is no one that does good.

verses.vh1: God has looked down from heaven upon the children of earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks after God.

vh1: They are all gone out of the way;
all alike have become corrupt; ⁕
verses.vh2: there is no one that does good, no not one.

verses.vh1: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers, ⁕
vh2: who eat up my people as if they ate bread,
and do not call upon God?

vh1: There shall they be in great fear,
such fear as never was; ⁕
verses.vh2: for God will scatter the bones of the ungodly.

verses.vh1: They will be put to shame, ⁕
verses.vh2: because God has rejected them.

verses.vh1: O that Israel’s salvation would come out of Zion! ⁕
vh2: When God restores the fortunes of God’s people
then will Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

refrain: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.

verses.vh1: Save me, O God, by your name ⁕
verses.vh2: and vindicate me by your power.

verses.vh1: Hear my prayer, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: give heed to the words of my mouth.

vh1: For strangers have risen up against me,
and the ruthless seek after my life; ⁕
verses.vh2: they have not set God before them.

verses.vh1: Behold, God is my helper; ⁕
verses.vh2: it is God who upholds my life.

verses.vh1: May evil rebound on those who lie in wait for me; ⁕
verses.vh2: destroy them in your faithfulness.

verses.vh1: An offering of a free heart will I give you ⁕
verses.vh2: and praise your name, O God, for it is gracious.

verses.vh1: For God has delivered me out of all my trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my eye has seen the downfall of my enemies.

refrain: Behold, God is my helper.

verses.vh1: Hear my prayer, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: hide not yourself from my petition.

verses.vh1: Give heed to me and answer me; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am restless in my complaining.

verses.vh1: I am alarmed at the voice of the enemy ⁕
verses.vh2: and at the clamour of the wicked;

verses.vh1: For they would bring down evil upon me ⁕
verses.vh2: and are set against me in fury.

verses.vh1: My heart is disquieted within me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the terrors of death have fallen upon me.

verses.vh1: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and a horrible dread has overwhelmed me.

verses.vh1: And I said: ‘O that I had wings like a dove, ⁕
verses.vh2: for then would I fly away and be at rest.

verses.vh1: ‘Then would I flee far away ⁕
verses.vh2: and make my lodging in the wilderness.

verses.vh1: ‘I would make haste to escape ⁕
verses.vh2: from the stormy wind and tempest.’

verses.vh1: Confuse their tongues, O God, and divide them, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

verses.vh1: Day and night they go about on its walls; ⁕
verses.vh2: mischief and trouble are in its midst.

verses.vh1: Wickedness walks in its streets; ⁕
verses.vh2: oppression and guile never leave its squares.

verses.vh1: For it was not an open enemy that reviled me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for then I could have borne it;

verses.vh1: Nor was it my adversary that puffed themself up against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for then I would have hid myself from them.

verses.vh1: But it was even you, one like myself, ⁕
verses.vh2: my companion and my own familiar friend.

verses.vh1: We took sweet counsel together ⁕
verses.vh2: and walked with the multitude in the house of God.

vh1: Let death come suddenly upon them;
let them go down alive to the Pit; ⁕
verses.vh2: for wickedness inhabits their dwellings, their very hearts.

verses.vh1: As for me, I will call upon God ⁕
verses.vh2: and God will deliver me.

vh1: In the evening and morning and at noonday
I will pray and make my supplication, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God shall hear my voice.

verses.vh1: God shall redeem my soul in peace from the battle waged against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for many have come upon me.

vh1: God, who is enthroned of old,
will hear and bring them down; ⁕
verses.vh2: they will not repent, for they have no fear of God.

verses.vh1: My companion stretched out their hands against their friend ⁕
verses.vh2: and has broken their covenant;

verses.vh1: Their speech was softer than butter, though war was in their heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: their words were smoother than oil, yet are they naked swords.

verses.vh1: Cast your burden upon God and God will sustain you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and will not let the righteous fall for ever.

verses.vh1: But those that are bloodthirsty and deceitful, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: you will bring down to the pit of destruction.

verses.vh1: They shall not live out half their days, ⁕
verses.vh2: but my trust shall be in you, O God.

refrain: Cast your burden upon God and God will sustain you.

verses.vh1: Have mercy on me, O God, for they trample over me; ⁕
verses.vh2: all day long they assault and oppress me.

verses.vh1: My adversaries trample over me all the day long; ⁕
verses.vh2: many are they that make proud war against me.

verses.vh1: In the day of my fear I put my trust in you, ⁕
verses.vh2: in God whose word I praise.

verses.vh1: In God I trust, and will not fear, ⁕
verses.vh2: for what can flesh do to me?

verses.vh1: All day long they wound me with words; ⁕
verses.vh2: their every thought is to do me evil.

verses.vh1: They stir up trouble; they lie in wait; ⁕
verses.vh2: marking my steps, they seek my life.

verses.vh1: Shall they escape for all their wickedness? ⁕
verses.vh2: In anger, O God, cast the peoples down.

vh1: You have counted up my groaning;
put my tears into your bottle; ⁕
verses.vh2: are they not written in your book?

verses.vh1: Then shall my enemies turn back on the day when I call upon you; ⁕
verses.vh2: this I know, for God is on my side.

vh1: In God whose word I praise,
in God whose word I praise, ⁕
vh2: in God I trust and will not fear:
what can flesh do to me?

verses.vh1: To you, O God, will I fulfil my vows; ⁕
verses.vh2: to you will I present my offerings of thanks,

vh1: For you will deliver my soul from death
and my feet from falling, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

refrain: In God I trust, and will not fear.

verses.vh1: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for my soul takes refuge in you;

verses.vh1: In the shadow of your wings will I take refuge ⁕
verses.vh2: until the storm of destruction has passed by.

verses.vh1: I will call upon the Most High God, ⁕
verses.vh2: the God who fulfils God’s purpose for me.

vh1: God will send from heaven and save me
and rebuke those that would trample upon me; ⁕
verses.vh2: God will send forth love and faithfulness.

verses.vh1: I lie in the midst of lions, ⁕
vh2: people whose teeth are spears and arrows,
and their tongue a sharp sword.

verses.vh1: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your glory over all the earth.

vh1: They have laid a net for my feet;
my soul is pressed down; ⁕
vh2: they have dug a pit before me
and will fall into it themselves.

verses.vh1: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing and give you praise.

verses.vh1: Awake, my soul; awake, harp and lyre, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may awaken the dawn.

verses.vh1: I will give you thanks, O God, among the peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing praise to you among the nations.

verses.vh1: For your loving-kindness is as high as the heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

verses.vh1: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your glory over all the earth.

verses.vh1: Do you indeed speak justly, you mighty? ⁕
verses.vh2: Do you rule the peoples with equity?

verses.vh1: With unjust heart you act throughout the land; ⁕
verses.vh2: your hands mete out violence.

verses.vh1: The wicked are estranged, even from the womb; ⁕
verses.vh2: those who speak falsehood go astray from their birth.

verses.vh1: They are as venomous as a serpent; ⁕
verses.vh2: they are like the deaf adder which stops its ears,

verses.vh1: Which does not heed the voice of the charmers, ⁕
verses.vh2: and is deaf to the skilful weaver of spells.

verses.vh1: Break, O God, their teeth in their mouths; ⁕
verses.vh2: smash the fangs of these lions, O God.

verses.vh1: Let them vanish like water that runs away; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them wither like trodden grass.

verses.vh1: Let them be as the slimy track of the snail, ⁕
verses.vh2: like the untimely birth that never sees the sun.

verses.vh1: Before ever their pots feel the heat of the thorns, ⁕
verses.vh2: green or blazing, let them be swept away.

verses.vh1: The righteous will be glad when they see God’s vengeance; ⁕
verses.vh2: they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

vh1: So that people will say,
‘Truly, there is a harvest for the righteous; ⁕
verses.vh2: truly, there is a God who judges in the earth.’

refrain: God is made known by acts of justice.

verses.vh1: Rescue me from my enemies, O my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: set me high above those that rise up against me.

verses.vh1: Save me from the evildoers ⁕
verses.vh2: and from murderous foes deliver me.

verses.vh1: For see how they lie in wait for my soul ⁕
verses.vh2: and the mighty stir up trouble against me.

verses.vh1: Not for any fault or sin of mine, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: for no offence, they run and prepare themselves for war.

verses.vh1: Rouse yourself, come to my aid and see; ⁕
verses.vh2: for you are God of hosts, the God of Israel.

verses.vh1: Awake, and judge all the nations; ⁕
verses.vh2: show no mercy to the evil traitors.

verses.vh1: They return at nightfall and snarl like dogs ⁕
verses.vh2: and prowl about the city.

vh1: They pour out evil words with their mouths;
swords are on their lips; ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘For who’, they say, ‘can hear us?’

verses.vh1: But you laugh at them, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: you hold all the nations in derision.

verses.vh1: For you, O my strength, will I watch; ⁕
verses.vh2: you, O God, are my strong tower.

verses.vh1: My God in steadfast love will come to me; ⁕
verses.vh2: God will let me behold the downfall of my enemies.

verses.vh1: Slay them not, lest my people forget; ⁕
vh2: send them reeling by your might
and bring them down, O God our shield.

verses.vh1: For the sins of their mouth, for the words of their lips, ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be taken in their pride.

verses.vh1: For the cursing and falsehood they have uttered, ⁕
verses.vh2: consume them in wrath, consume them till they are no more.

verses.vh1: And they shall know that God rules in Jacob, ⁕
verses.vh2: and to the ends of the earth.

verses.vh1: And still they return at nightfall and snarl like dogs ⁕
verses.vh2: and prowl about the city.

verses.vh1: Though they forage for something to devour, ⁕
verses.vh2: and howl if they are not filled,

verses.vh1: Yet will I sing of your strength ⁕
verses.vh2: and every morning praise your steadfast love;

verses.vh1: For you have been my stronghold, ⁕
verses.vh2: my refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.vh1: To you, O my strength, will I sing; ⁕
vh2: for you, O God, are my refuge,
my God of steadfast love.

refrain: You, O God, are my strong tower.

verses.vh1: O God, you have cast us off and broken us; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have been angry; restore us to yourself again.

verses.vh1: You have shaken the earth and torn it apart; ⁕
verses.vh2: heal its wounds, for it trembles.

verses.vh1: You have made your people drink bitter things; ⁕
verses.vh2: we reel from the deadly wine you have given us.

verses.vh1: You have made those who fear you to flee, ⁕
verses.vh2: to escape from the range of the bow.

verses.vh1: That your beloved may be delivered, ⁕
verses.vh2: save us by your right hand and answer us.

verses.vh1: God has spoken in God’s holiness: ⁕
vh2: ‘I will triumph and divide Shechem,
and share out the valley of Succoth.

verses.vh1: ‘Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; ⁕
verses.vh2: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my sceptre.

vh1: ‘Moab shall be my washpot;
over Edom will I cast my sandal; ⁕
verses.vh2: across Philistia will I shout in triumph.’

verses.vh1: Who will lead me into the strong city? ⁕
verses.vh2: Who will bring me into Edom?

verses.vh1: Have you not cast us off, O God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will you no longer go forth with our troops?

verses.vh1: Grant us your help against the enemy, ⁕
verses.vh2: for earthly help is in vain.

verses.vh1: Through God will we do great acts, ⁕
verses.vh2: for it is God that shall tread down our enemies.

refrain: Restore us again, O God our Saviour.

verses.vh1: Hear my crying, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and listen to my prayer.

verses.vh1: From the end of the earth I call to you with fainting heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: O set me on the rock that is higher than I.

verses.vh1: For you are my refuge, ⁕
verses.vh2: a strong tower against the enemy.

verses.vh1: Let me dwell in your tent for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and take refuge under the cover of your wings.

verses.vh1: For you, O God, will hear my vows; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will grant the request of those who fear your name.

verses.vh1: You will add length of days to the life of the King, ⁕
verses.vh2: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

verses.vh1: May he sit enthroned before God for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: may steadfast love and truth watch over him.

verses.vh1: So will I always sing praise to your name, ⁕
verses.vh2: and day by day fulfil my vows.

refrain: You are my refuge, O God,
a strong tower against the enemy.

verses.vh1: On God alone my soul in stillness waits; ⁕
verses.vh2: from God comes my salvation.

verses.vh1: God alone is my rock and my salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: my stronghold, so that I shall never be shaken.

verses.vh1: How long will all of you assail me to destroy me, ⁕
verses.vh2: as you would a tottering wall or a leaning fence?

vh1: They plot only to thrust me down from my place of honour;
lies are their chief delight; ⁕
verses.vh2: they bless with their mouth, but in their heart they curse.

verses.vh1: Wait on God alone in stillness, O my soul; ⁕
verses.vh2: for in God is my hope.

verses.vh1: God alone is my rock and my salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: my stronghold, so that I shall not be shaken.

verses.vh1: In God is my strength and my glory; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is my strong rock; in God is my refuge.

verses.vh1: Put your trust in God always, my people; ⁕
verses.vh2: pour out your hearts before God, for God is our refuge.

vh1: The peoples are but a breath,
the whole human race a deceit; ⁕
verses.vh2: on the scales they are altogether lighter than air.

verses.vh1: Put no trust in oppression; in robbery take no empty pride; ⁕
verses.vh2: though wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.

verses.vh1: God spoke once, and twice have I heard the same, ⁕
verses.vh2: that power belongs to God.

verses.vh1: Steadfast love belongs to you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you repay everyone according to their deeds.

refrain: Wait on God alone in stillness, O my soul.

verses.vh1: O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; ⁕
verses.vh2: my soul is athirst for you.

verses.vh1: My flesh also faints for you, ⁕
verses.vh2: as in a dry and thirsty land where there is no water.

verses.vh1: So would I gaze upon you in your holy place, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I might behold your power and your glory.

verses.vh1: Your loving-kindness is better than life itself ⁕
verses.vh2: and so my lips shall praise you.

verses.vh1: I will bless you as long as I live ⁕
verses.vh2: and lift up my hands in your name.

verses.vh1: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my mouth shall praise you with joyful lips,

verses.vh1: When I remember you upon my bed ⁕
verses.vh2: and meditate on you in the watches of the night.

verses.vh1: For you have been my helper ⁕
verses.vh2: and under the shadow of your wings will I rejoice.

verses.vh1: My soul clings to you; ⁕
verses.vh2: your right hand shall hold me fast.

verses.vh1: But those who seek my soul to destroy it ⁕
verses.vh2: shall go down to the depths of the earth;

verses.vh1: Let them fall by the edge of the sword ⁕
verses.vh2: and become a portion for jackals.

vh1: But the King shall rejoice in God;
all those who swear by God shall be glad, ⁕
verses.vh2: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

refrain: My soul is athirst for God, even for the living God.

verses.vh1: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; ⁕
verses.vh2: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.vh1: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: from the gathering of evildoers.

verses.vh1: They sharpen their tongue like a sword ⁕
verses.vh2: and aim their bitter words like arrows,

verses.vh1: That they may shoot at the blameless from hiding places; ⁕
verses.vh2: suddenly they shoot, and are not seen.

verses.vh1: They hold fast to their evil course; ⁕
verses.vh2: they talk of laying snares, saying, ‘Who will see us?’

verses.vh1: They search out wickedness and lay a cunning trap, ⁕
verses.vh2: for deep are the inward thoughts of the heart.

verses.vh1: But God will shoot at them with God’s swift arrow, ⁕
verses.vh2: and suddenly they shall be wounded.

verses.vh1: Their own tongues shall make them fall, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all who see them shall wag their heads in scorn.

verses.vh1: All peoples shall fear and tell what God has done, ⁕
verses.vh2: and they will ponder all God’s works.

vh1: The righteous shall rejoice in God
and put their trust in God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all that are true of heart shall exult.

refrain: The righteous shall rejoice in God.

verses.vh1: Praise is due to you, O God, in Zion; ⁕
verses.vh2: to you that answer prayer shall vows be paid.

verses.vh1: To you shall all flesh come to confess their sins; ⁕
vh2: when our misdeeds prevail against us,
you will purge them away.

vh1: Happy are they whom you choose
and draw to your courts to dwell there. ⁕
vh2: We shall be satisfied with the blessings of your house,
even of your holy temple.

vh1: With wonders you will answer us in your righteousness,
O God of our salvation, ⁕
vh2: O hope of all the ends of the earth
and of the farthest seas.

verses.vh1: In your strength you set fast the mountains ⁕
verses.vh2: and are girded about with might.

verses.vh1: You still the raging of the seas, ⁕
vh2: the roaring of their waves
and the clamour of the peoples.

verses.vh1: Those who dwell at the ends of the earth tremble at your marvels; ⁕
verses.vh2: the gates of the morning and evening sing your praise.

verses.vh1: You visit the earth and water it; ⁕
verses.vh2: you make it very plenteous.

verses.vh1: The river of God is full of water; ⁕
vh2: you prepare grain for your people,
for so you provide for the earth.

verses.vh1: You drench the furrows and smooth out the ridges; ⁕
verses.vh2: you soften the ground with showers and bless its increase.

verses.vh1: You crown the year with your goodness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your paths overflow with plenty.

verses.vh1: May the pastures of the wilderness flow with goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and the hills be girded with joy.

verses.vh1: May the meadows be clothed with flocks of sheep ⁕
verses.vh2: and the valleys stand so thick with corn that they shall laugh and sing.

refrain: Be joyful in God, all the earth.

verses.vh1: Be joyful in God, all the earth; ⁕
vh2: sing the glory of God’s name;
sing the glory of God’s praise.

verses.vh1: Say to God, ‘How awesome are your deeds! ⁕
verses.vh2: Because of your great strength your enemies shall bow before you.

verses.vh1: ‘All the earth shall worship you, ⁕
verses.vh2: sing to you, sing praise to your name.’

verses.vh1: Come now and behold the works of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: how wonderful God is with humankind.

vh1: God turned the sea into dry land;
the river they passed through on foot; ⁕
verses.vh2: there we rejoiced in God.

vh1: In God’s own might God rules for ever;
God’s eyes keep watch over the nations; ⁕
verses.vh2: let no rebel rise up against God.

verses.vh1: Bless our God, O you peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: make the voice of God’s praise to be heard,

verses.vh1: Who holds our souls in life ⁕
verses.vh2: and suffers not our feet to slip.

verses.vh1: For you, O God, have proved us; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have tried us as silver is tried.

verses.vh1: You brought us into the snare; ⁕
verses.vh2: you laid heavy burdens upon our backs.

vh1: You let enemies ride over our heads;
we went through fire and water; ⁕
verses.vh2: but you brought us out into a place of liberty.

vh1: I will come into your house with burnt offerings
and will pay you my vows, ⁕
vh2: which my lips uttered
and my mouth promised when I was in trouble.

verses.vh1: I will offer you fat burnt sacrifices with the smoke of rams; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sacrifice oxen and goats.

verses.vh1: Come and listen, all you who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will tell you what God has done for my soul.

verses.vh1: I called out to God with my mouth ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s praise was on my tongue.

verses.vh1: If I had nursed evil in my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: God would not have heard me,

verses.vh1: But in truth God has heard me; ⁕
verses.vh2: God has heeded the voice of my prayer.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God, who has not rejected my prayer, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor withheld God’s loving mercy from me.

refrain: All the earth shall worship you, O God.

verses.vh1: God be gracious to us and bless us ⁕
verses.vh2: and make God’s face to shine upon us,

verses.vh1: That your way may be known upon earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: your saving power among all nations.

verses.vh1: Let the peoples praise you, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let all the peoples praise you.

verses.vh1: O let the nations rejoice and be glad, ⁕
vh2: for you will judge the peoples righteously
and govern the nations upon earth.

verses.vh1: Let the peoples praise you, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let all the peoples praise you.

verses.vh1: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God, our own God, will bless us.

verses.vh1: God will bless us, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the ends of the earth shall fear God.

verses.vh1: Let God arise and let God’s enemies be scattered; ⁕
verses.vh2: let those that hate God flee before God.

verses.vh1: As the smoke vanishes, so may they vanish away; ⁕
vh2: as wax melts at the fire,
so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

verses.vh1: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them make merry with gladness.

vh1: Sing to God, sing praises to God’s name;
exalt God who rides on the clouds. ⁕
verses.vh2: God is God’s name; rejoice before God.

verses.vh1: Parent of orphans, defender of widows, ⁕
verses.vh2: God in God’s holy habitation!

vh1: God gives the solitary a home
and brings forth prisoners to songs of welcome, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the rebellious inhabit a burning desert.

verses.vh1: O God, when you went forth before your people, ⁕
verses.vh2: when you marched through the wilderness,

vh1: The earth shook and the heavens dropped down rain,
at the presence of God, God of Sinai, ⁕
verses.vh2: at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

verses.vh1: You sent down a gracious rain, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: you refreshed your inheritance when it was weary.

verses.vh1: Your people came to dwell there; ⁕
verses.vh2: in your goodness, O God, you provide for the poor.

vh1: God gave the word;
great was the company who bore the tidings: ⁕
vh2: ‘Rulers and their armies they flee, they flee!’
and those at home are dividing the spoil.

verses.vh1: Though you stayed among the sheepfolds, ⁕
vh2: see now a dove’s wings covered with silver
and its feathers with green gold.

verses.vh1: When the Almighty scattered the rulers, ⁕
verses.vh2: it was like snowflakes falling on Zalmon.

verses.vh1: You mighty mountain, great mountain of Bashan! ⁕
verses.vh2: You towering mountain, great mountain of Bashan!

vh1: Why look with envy, you towering mountains,
at the mount which God has desired for God’s dwelling, ⁕
verses.vh2: the place where God will dwell for ever?

vh1: The chariots of God are twice ten thousand,
even thousands upon thousands; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is among them, God of Sinai in holy power.

verses.vh1: You have gone up on high and led captivity captive; ⁕
vh2: you have received tribute,
even from those who rebelled,
that you may reign as God and God.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God who bears our burdens day by day, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God is our salvation.

verses.vh1: God is for us the God of our salvation; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is God who can deliver from death.

verses.vh1: God will smite the head of God’s enemies, ⁕
verses.vh2: the hairy scalp of those who walk in wickedness.

verses.vh1: God has said, ‘From the heights of Bashan, ⁕
verses.vh2: from the depths of the sea will I bring them back,

verses.vh1: ‘Till you dip your foot in blood ⁕
verses.vh2: and the tongue of your dogs has a taste of your enemies.’

verses.vh1: We see your solemn processions, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: your processions into the sanctuary, my God and my Sovereign.

verses.vh1: The singers go before, the musicians follow after, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the midst of youths playing on timbrels.

verses.vh1: In your companies, bless your God; ⁕
verses.vh2: bless God, you that are of the fount of Israel.

vh1: At the head there is Benjamin, least of the tribes,
the princes of Judah in joyful company, ⁕
verses.vh2: the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.

verses.vh1: Send forth your strength, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: establish, O God, what you have wrought in us.

verses.vh1: For your temple’s sake in Jerusalem ⁕
verses.vh2: rulers shall bring their gifts to you.

verses.vh1: Drive back with your word the wild beast of the reeds, ⁕
verses.vh2: the herd of the bull-like, the brutish hordes.

verses.vh1: Trample down those who lust after silver; ⁕
verses.vh2: scatter the peoples that delight in war.

verses.vh1: Vessels of bronze shall be brought from Egypt; ⁕
verses.vh2: Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God.

verses.vh1: Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: make music in praise of God;

verses.vh1: God rides on the ancient heaven of heavens ⁕
verses.vh2: and sends forth God’s voice, a mighty voice.

verses.vh1: Ascribe power to God, whose splendour is over Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: whose power is above the clouds.

verses.vh1: How terrible is God in God’s holy sanctuary, ⁕
vh2: the God of Israel, who gives power and strength to God’s people!
Blessed be God.

refrain: Sing to God, sing praises to God’s name.

verses.vh1: Save me, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for the waters have come up, even to my neck.

verses.vh1: I sink in deep mire where there is no foothold; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have come into deep waters and the flood sweeps over me.

verses.vh1: I have grown weary with crying; my throat is raw; ⁕
verses.vh2: my eyes have failed from looking so long for my God.

verses.vh1: Those who hate me without any cause ⁕
verses.vh2: are more than the hairs of my head;

verses.vh1: Those who would destroy me are mighty; ⁕
vh2: my enemies accuse me falsely:
must I now give back what I never stole?

verses.vh1: O God, you know my foolishness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my faults are not hidden from you.

verses.vh1: Let not those who hope in you be put to shame through me, God God of hosts; ⁕
vh2: let not those who seek you be disgraced because of me,
O God of Israel.

verses.vh1: For your sake have I suffered reproach; ⁕
verses.vh2: shame has covered my face.

verses.vh1: I have become a stranger to my kindred, ⁕
verses.vh2: an alien to my parents’ children.

verses.vh1: Zeal for your house has eaten me up; ⁕
verses.vh2: the scorn of those who scorn you has fallen upon me.

verses.vh1: I humbled myself with fasting, ⁕
verses.vh2: but that was turned to my reproach.

verses.vh1: I put on sackcloth also ⁕
verses.vh2: and became a byword among them.

verses.vh1: Those who sit at the gate murmur against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the drunkards make songs about me.

verses.vh1: But as for me, I make my prayer to you, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: at an acceptable time, O God.

verses.vh1: Answer me, O God, in the abundance of your mercy ⁕
verses.vh2: and with your sure salvation.

verses.vh1: Draw me out of the mire, that I sink not; ⁕
vh2: let me be rescued from those who hate me
and out of the deep waters.

vh1: Let not the water flood drown me,
neither the deep swallow me up; ⁕
verses.vh2: let not the Pit shut its mouth upon me.

verses.vh1: Answer me, God, for your loving-kindness is good; ⁕
verses.vh2: turn to me in the multitude of your mercies.

verses.vh1: Hide not your face from your servant; ⁕
verses.vh2: be swift to answer me, for I am in trouble.

verses.vh1: Draw near to my soul and redeem me; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver me because of my enemies.

verses.vh1: You know my reproach, my shame and my dishonour; ⁕
verses.vh2: my adversaries are all in your sight.

verses.vh1: Reproach has broken my heart; I am full of heaviness. ⁕
vh2: I looked for some to have pity, but there was no one,
neither found I any to comfort me.

verses.vh1: They gave me gall to eat, ⁕
verses.vh2: and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.vh1: Let the table before them be a trap ⁕
verses.vh2: and their sacred feasts a snare.

verses.vh1: Let their eyes be darkened, that they cannot see, ⁕
verses.vh2: and give them continual trembling in their loins.

verses.vh1: Pour out your indignation upon them, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let the heat of your anger overtake them.

verses.vh1: Let their camp be desolate, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let there be no one to dwell in their tents.

verses.vh1: For they persecute the one whom you have stricken, ⁕
verses.vh2: and increase the sorrows of the one whom you have pierced.

verses.vh1: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let them not receive your vindication.

verses.vh1: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living ⁕
verses.vh2: and not be written among the righteous.

verses.vh1: As for me, I am poor and in misery; ⁕
verses.vh2: your saving help, O God, will lift me up.

verses.vh1: I will praise the name of God with a song; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will proclaim God’s greatness with thanksgiving.

verses.vh1: This will please God more than an offering of oxen, ⁕
verses.vh2: more than bulls with horns and hooves.

verses.vh1: The humble shall see and be glad; ⁕
verses.vh2: you who seek God, your heart shall live.

verses.vh1: For God listens to the needy, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s own who are imprisoned God does not despise.

verses.vh1: Let the heavens and the earth praise God, ⁕
verses.vh2: the seas and all that moves in them;

verses.vh1: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall live there and have it in possession.

verses.vh1: The children of God’s servants shall inherit it, ⁕
verses.vh2: and they that love God’s name shall dwell therein.

refrain: Hide not your face from your servant, O God.

verses.vh1: O God, make speed to save me; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, make haste to help me.

verses.vh1: Let those who seek my life be put to shame and confusion; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be turned back and disgraced who wish me evil.

verses.vh1: Let those who mock and deride me ⁕
verses.vh2: turn back because of their shame.

verses.vh1: But let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; ⁕
verses.vh2: let those who love your salvation say always, ‘Great is God!’

verses.vh1: As for me, I am poor and needy; ⁕
verses.vh2: come to me quickly, O God.

verses.vh1: You are my help and my deliverer; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, do not delay.

refrain: Come to me quickly, O God.

verses.vh1: In you, O God, do I seek refuge; ⁕
verses.vh2: let me never be put to shame.

verses.vh1: In your righteousness, deliver me and set me free; ⁕
verses.vh2: incline your ear to me and save me.

verses.vh1: Be for me a stronghold to which I may ever resort; ⁕
verses.vh2: send out to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.

verses.vh1: Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor.

verses.vh1: For you are my hope, O God God, ⁕
verses.vh2: my confidence, even from my youth.

vh1: Upon you have I leaned from my birth,
when you drew me from my mother’s womb; ⁕
verses.vh2: my praise shall be always of you.

verses.vh1: I have become a portent to many, ⁕
verses.vh2: but you are my refuge and my strength.

verses.vh1: Let my mouth be full of your praise ⁕
verses.vh2: and your glory all the day long.

verses.vh1: Do not cast me away in the time of old age; ⁕
verses.vh2: forsake me not when my strength fails.

verses.vh1: For my enemies are talking against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.

vh1: They say, ‘God has forsaken them;
pursue them and take them, ⁕
verses.vh2: because there is none to deliver them.’

verses.vh1: O God, be not far from me; ⁕
verses.vh2: come quickly to help me, O my God.

verses.vh1: Let those who are against me be put to shame and disgrace; ⁕
verses.vh2: let those who seek to do me evil be covered with scorn and reproach.

verses.vh1: But as for me I will hope continually ⁕
verses.vh2: and will praise you more and more.

vh1: My mouth shall tell of your righteousness
and salvation all the day long, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I know no end of the telling.

verses.vh1: I will begin with the mighty works of God God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will recall your righteousness, yours alone.

verses.vh1: O God, you have taught me since I was young, ⁕
verses.vh2: and to this day I tell of your wonderful works.

vh1: Forsake me not, O God,
when I am old and grey-headed, ⁕
vh2: till I make known your deeds to the next generation
and your power to all that are to come.

verses.vh1: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the great things you have done, who is like you, O God?

verses.vh1: What troubles and adversities you have shown me, ⁕
vh2: and yet you will turn and refresh me
and bring me from the deep of the earth again.

verses.vh1: Increase my honour; ⁕
verses.vh2: turn again and comfort me.

verses.vh1: Therefore will I praise you upon the harp for your faithfulness, O my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.

verses.vh1: My lips will sing out as I play to you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and so will my soul, which you have redeemed.

verses.vh1: My tongue also will tell of your righteousness all the day long, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they shall be shamed and disgraced who sought to do me evil.

refrain: O God, be not far from me.

verses.vh1: Give the King your judgements, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your righteousness to the Son of a King.

verses.vh1: Then shall he judge your people righteously ⁕
verses.vh2: and your poor with justice.

verses.vh1: May the mountains bring forth peace, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the little hills righteousness for the people.

verses.vh1: May he defend the poor among the people, ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver the children of the needy and crush the oppressor.

verses.vh1: May he live as long as the sun and moon endure, ⁕
verses.vh2: from one generation to another.

verses.vh1: May he come down like rain upon the mown grass, ⁕
verses.vh2: like the showers that water the earth.

verses.vh1: In his time shall righteousness flourish, ⁕
verses.vh2: and abundance of peace till the moon shall be no more.

verses.vh1: May his dominion extend from sea to sea ⁕
verses.vh2: and from the River to the ends of the earth.

verses.vh1: May his foes kneel before him ⁕
verses.vh2: and his enemies lick the dust.

verses.vh1: The rulers of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute; ⁕
verses.vh2: the rulers of Sheba and Seba shall bring gifts.

verses.vh1: All rulers shall fall down before him; ⁕
verses.vh2: all nations shall do him service.

verses.vh1: For he shall deliver the poor that cry out, ⁕
verses.vh2: the needy and those who have no helper.

verses.vh1: He shall have pity on the weak and poor; ⁕
verses.vh2: he shall preserve the lives of the needy.

verses.vh1: He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence, ⁕
verses.vh2: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

vh1: Long may he live;
unto him may be given gold from Sheba; ⁕
vh2: may prayer be made for him continually
and may they bless him all the day long.

vh1: May there be abundance of grain on the earth,
standing thick upon the hilltops; ⁕
vh2: may its fruit flourish like Lebanon
and its grain grow like the grass of the field.

vh1: May his name remain for ever
and be established as long as the sun endures; ⁕
vh2: may all nations be blest in him
and call him blessed.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God, the God of Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: who alone does wonderful things.

verses.vh1: And blessed be God’s glorious name for ever. ⁕
vh2: May all the earth be filled with God’s glory.
Amen. Amen.

refrain: God is Sovereign; let the earth rejoice.

verses.vh1: Truly, God is loving to Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: to those who are pure in heart.

verses.vh1: Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone; ⁕
verses.vh2: my steps had well-nigh slipped.

verses.vh1: For I was envious of the proud; ⁕
verses.vh2: I saw the wicked in such prosperity;

verses.vh1: For they suffer no pains ⁕
verses.vh2: and their bodies are sleek and sound;

verses.vh1: They come to no misfortune like other folk; ⁕
verses.vh2: nor are they plagued as others are;

verses.vh1: Therefore pride is their necklace ⁕
verses.vh2: and violence wraps them like a cloak.

verses.vh1: Their iniquity comes from within; ⁕
verses.vh2: the conceits of their hearts overflow.

verses.vh1: They scoff, and speak only of evil; ⁕
verses.vh2: they talk of oppression from on high.

verses.vh1: They set their mouth against the heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their tongue ranges round the earth;

verses.vh1: And so the people turn to them ⁕
verses.vh2: and find in them no fault.

verses.vh1: They say, ‘How should God know? ⁕
verses.vh2: Is there knowledge in the Most High?’

verses.vh1: Behold, these are the wicked; ⁕
verses.vh2: ever at ease, they increase their wealth.

verses.vh1: Is it in vain that I cleansed my heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and washed my hands in innocence?

verses.vh1: All day long have I been stricken ⁕
verses.vh2: and chastened every morning.

verses.vh1: If I had said, ‘I will speak as they do,’ ⁕
verses.vh2: I should have betrayed the generation of your children.

verses.vh1: Then thought I to understand this, ⁕
verses.vh2: but it was too hard for me,

verses.vh1: Until I entered the sanctuary of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and understood the end of the wicked:

verses.vh1: How you set them in slippery places; ⁕
verses.vh2: you cast them down to destruction.

verses.vh1: How suddenly do they come to destruction, ⁕
verses.vh2: perish and come to a fearful end!

verses.vh1: As with a dream when one awakes, ⁕
verses.vh2: so, God, when you arise you will despise their image.

verses.vh1: When my heart became embittered ⁕
verses.vh2: and I was pierced to the quick,

verses.vh1: I was but foolish and ignorant; ⁕
verses.vh2: I was like a brute beast in your presence.

verses.vh1: Yet I am always with you; ⁕
verses.vh2: you hold me by my right hand.

verses.vh1: You will guide me with your counsel ⁕
verses.vh2: and afterwards receive me with glory.

verses.vh1: Whom have I in heaven but you? ⁕
verses.vh2: And there is nothing upon earth that I desire in comparison with you.

verses.vh1: Though my flesh and my heart fail me, ⁕
verses.vh2: God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.

verses.vh1: Truly, those who forsake you will perish; ⁕
verses.vh2: you will put to silence the faithless who betray you.

verses.vh1: But it is good for me to draw near to God; ⁕
vh2: in God God have I made my refuge,
that I may tell of all your works.

refrain: In God God have I made my refuge.

verses.vh1: O God, why have you utterly disowned us? ⁕
verses.vh2: Why does your anger burn against the sheep of your pasture?

verses.vh1: Remember your congregation that you purchased of old, ⁕
vh2: the tribe you redeemed for your own possession,
and Mount Zion where you dwelt.

verses.vh1: Hasten your steps towards the endless ruins, ⁕
verses.vh2: where the enemy has laid waste all your sanctuary.

verses.vh1: Your adversaries roared in the place of your worship; ⁕
verses.vh2: they set up their banners as tokens of victory.

verses.vh1: Like people brandishing axes on high in a thicket of trees, ⁕
verses.vh2: all the carved work they smashed down with hatchet and hammer.

verses.vh1: They set fire to your holy place; ⁕
vh2: they defiled the dwelling place of your name
and razed it to the ground.

verses.vh1: They said in their heart, ‘Let us make havoc of them altogether,’ ⁕
verses.vh2: and they burned down all the sanctuaries of God in the land.

verses.vh1: There are no signs to see, not one prophet left, ⁕
verses.vh2: not one among us who knows how long.

verses.vh1: How long, O God, will the adversary scoff? ⁕
verses.vh2: Shall the enemy blaspheme your name for ever?

verses.vh1: Why have you withheld your hand ⁕
verses.vh2: and hidden your right hand in your bosom?

verses.vh1: Yet God is my Sovereign from of old, ⁕
verses.vh2: who did deeds of salvation in the midst of the earth.

verses.vh1: It was you that divided the sea by your might ⁕
verses.vh2: and shattered the heads of the dragons on the waters;

verses.vh1: You alone crushed the heads of Leviathan ⁕
verses.vh2: and gave them to the beasts of the desert for food.

verses.vh1: You cleft the rock for fountain and flood; ⁕
verses.vh2: you dried up ever-flowing rivers.

verses.vh1: Yours is the day, yours also the night; ⁕
verses.vh2: you established the moon and the sun.

verses.vh1: You set all the bounds of the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: you fashioned both summer and winter.

verses.vh1: Remember now, God, how the enemy scoffed, ⁕
verses.vh2: how a foolish people despised your name.

verses.vh1: Do not give to wild beasts the soul of your turtle dove; ⁕
verses.vh2: forget not the lives of your poor for ever.

vh1: Look upon your creation,
for the earth is full of darkness, ⁕
verses.vh2: full of the haunts of violence.

verses.vh1: Let not the oppressed turn away ashamed, ⁕
verses.vh2: but let the poor and needy praise your name.

verses.vh1: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause; ⁕
verses.vh2: remember how fools revile you all the day long.

verses.vh1: Forget not the clamour of your adversaries, ⁕
verses.vh2: the tumult of your enemies that ascends continually.

refrain: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause.

verses.vh1: We give you thanks, O God, we give you thanks, ⁕
verses.vh2: for your name is near, as your wonderful deeds declare.

verses.vh1: ‘I will seize the appointed time; ⁕
verses.vh2: I, God, will judge with equity.

verses.vh1: ‘Though the earth reels and all that dwell therein, ⁕
verses.vh2: it is I that hold its pillars steady.

verses.vh1: ‘To the boasters I say, “Boast no longer,” ⁕
verses.vh2: and to the wicked, “Do not lift up your horn.

verses.vh1: ‘“Do not lift up your horn on high; ⁕
verses.vh2: do not speak with a stiff neck.” ’

verses.vh1: For neither from the east nor from the west, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor yet from the wilderness comes exaltation.

verses.vh1: But God alone is judge; ⁕
verses.vh2: God puts down one and raises up another.

verses.vh1: For in the hand of God there is a cup, ⁕
verses.vh2: well mixed and full of foaming wine.

verses.vh1: God pours it out for all the wicked of the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall drink it, and drain the dregs.

verses.vh1: But I will rejoice for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and make music to the God of Jacob.

verses.vh1: All the horns of the wicked will I break, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

refrain: God alone is judge.

verses.vh1: In Judah God is known; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s name is great in Israel.

verses.vh1: At Salem is God’s tabernacle, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s dwelling place in Zion.

verses.vh1: There God broke the flashing arrows of the bow, ⁕
verses.vh2: the shield, the sword and the weapons of war.

verses.vh1: In the light of splendour you appeared, ⁕
verses.vh2: glorious from the eternal mountains.

verses.vh1: The boastful were plundered; they have slept their sleep; ⁕
verses.vh2: none of the warriors can lift their hand.

verses.vh1: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, ⁕
verses.vh2: both horse and chariot fell stunned.

verses.vh1: Terrible are you in majesty: ⁕
verses.vh2: who can stand before your face when you are angry?

verses.vh1: You caused your judgement to be heard from heaven; ⁕
verses.vh2: the earth trembled and was still,

verses.vh1: When God arose to judgement, ⁕
verses.vh2: to save all the meek upon earth.

verses.vh1: You crushed the wrath of the peoples ⁕
verses.vh2: and bridled the wrathful remnant.

verses.vh1: Make a vow to God your God and keep it; ⁕
verses.vh2: let all who are round about God bring gifts to God that is worthy to be feared.

verses.vh1: He breaks down the spirit of princes ⁕
verses.vh2: and strikes terror in the rulers of the earth.

refrain: God has made fast God’s throne for judgement.

verses.vh1: I cry aloud to God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I cry aloud to God and God will hear me.

verses.vh1: In the day of my trouble I have sought God; ⁕
vh2: by night my hand is stretched out and does not tire;
my soul refuses comfort.

verses.vh1: I think upon God and I groan; ⁕
verses.vh2: I ponder, and my spirit faints.

verses.vh1: You will not let my eyelids close; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verses.vh1: I consider the days of old; ⁕
verses.vh2: I remember the years long past;

verses.vh1: I commune with my heart in the night; ⁕
verses.vh2: my spirit searches for understanding.

verses.vh1: Will God cast us off for ever? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will God no more show us any favour?

verses.vh1: Has God’s loving mercy clean gone for ever? ⁕
verses.vh2: Has God’s promise come to an end for evermore?

verses.vh1: Has God forgotten to be gracious? ⁕
verses.vh2: Is God’s compassion shut away in displeasure?

verses.vh1: And I said, ‘My grief is this: ⁕
verses.vh2: that the right hand of the Most High has lost its strength.’

verses.vh1: I will remember the works of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and call to mind your wonders of old time.

verses.vh1: I will meditate on all your works ⁕
verses.vh2: and ponder your mighty deeds.

verses.vh1: Your way, O God, is holy; ⁕
verses.vh2: who is so great a god as our God?

verses.vh1: You are the God who worked wonders ⁕
verses.vh2: and declared your power among the peoples.

verses.vh1: With a mighty arm you redeemed your people, ⁕
verses.vh2: the children of Jacob and Joseph.

vh1: The waters saw you, O God;
the waters saw you and were afraid; ⁕
verses.vh2: the depths also were troubled.

verses.vh1: The clouds poured out water; the skies thundered; ⁕
verses.vh2: your arrows flashed on every side;

vh1: The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind;
your lightnings lit up the ground; ⁕
verses.vh2: the earth trembled and shook.

verses.vh1: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters, ⁕
verses.vh2: but your footsteps were not known.

verses.vh1: You led your people like sheep ⁕
verses.vh2: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

refrain: In the day of my trouble I have sought God.

verses.vh1: Hear my teaching, O my people; ⁕
verses.vh2: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.vh1: I will open my mouth in a parable; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will pour forth mysteries from of old,

verses.vh1: Such as we have heard and known, ⁕
verses.vh2: which our forebears have told us.

vh1: We will not hide from their children,
but will recount to generations to come, ⁕
vh2: the praises of God and God’s power
and the wonderful works God has done.

vh1: God laid a solemn charge on Jacob
and made it a law in Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: which God commanded them to teach their children,

vh1: That the generations to come might know,
and the children yet unborn, ⁕
verses.vh2: that they in turn might tell it to their children;

verses.vh1: So that they might put their trust in God ⁕
vh2: and not forget the deeds of God,
but keep God’s commandments,

vh1: And not be like their forebears,
a stubborn and rebellious generation, ⁕
vh2: a generation whose heart was not steadfast,
and whose spirit was not faithful to God.

verses.vh1: The people of Ephraim, armed with the bow, ⁕
verses.vh2: turned back in the day of battle;

verses.vh1: They did not keep the covenant of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and refused to walk in God’s law;

verses.vh1: They forgot what God had done ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wonders God had shown them.

verses.vh1: For God did marvellous things in the sight of their forebears, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

verses.vh1: God divided the sea and let them pass through; ⁕
verses.vh2: God made the waters stand still in a heap.

verses.vh1: God led them with a cloud by day ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the night through with a blaze of fire.

verses.vh1: God split the hard rocks in the wilderness ⁕
verses.vh2: and gave them drink as from the great deep.

verses.vh1: God brought streams out of the rock ⁕
verses.vh2: and made water gush out like rivers.

verses.vh1: Yet for all this they sinned more against God ⁕
verses.vh2: and defied the Most High in the wilderness.

verses.vh1: They tested God in their hearts ⁕
verses.vh2: and demanded food for their craving.

verses.vh1: They spoke against God and said, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

vh1: ‘He struck the rock indeed, so that the waters gushed out
and the streams overflowed, ⁕
verses.vh2: but can God give bread or provide meat for God’s people?’

verses.vh1: God heard this and was full of wrath; ⁕
vh2: a fire was kindled against Jacob
and God’s anger went out against Israel,

verses.vh1: For they had no faith in God ⁕
verses.vh2: and put no trust in God’s saving help.

verses.vh1: So God commanded the clouds above ⁕
verses.vh2: and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.vh1: God rained down upon them manna to eat ⁕
verses.vh2: and gave them the grain of heaven.

verses.vh1: So mortals ate the bread of angels; ⁕
verses.vh2: God sent them food in plenty.

verses.vh1: God caused the east wind to blow in the heavens ⁕
verses.vh2: and led out the south wind by God’s might.

verses.vh1: God rained flesh upon them as thick as dust ⁕
verses.vh2: and winged fowl like the sand of the sea.

verses.vh1: God let it fall in the midst of their camp ⁕
verses.vh2: and round about their tents.

verses.vh1: So they ate and were well filled, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God gave them what they desired.

verses.vh1: But they did not stop their craving; ⁕
verses.vh2: their food was still in their mouths,

verses.vh1: When the anger of God rose against them, ⁕
vh2: and slew their strongest men
and felled the flower of Israel.

verses.vh1: But for all this, they sinned yet more ⁕
verses.vh2: and put no faith in God’s wonderful works.

verses.vh1: So God brought their days to an end like a breath ⁕
verses.vh2: and their years in sudden terror.

verses.vh1: Whenever God slew them, they would seek God; ⁕
verses.vh2: they would repent and earnestly search for God.

verses.vh1: They remembered that God was their rock ⁕
verses.vh2: and the Most High God their redeemer.

verses.vh1: Yet they did but flatter God with their mouth ⁕
verses.vh2: and dissembled with their tongue.

verses.vh1: Their heart was not steadfast towards God, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither were they faithful to God’s covenant.

vh1: But God was so merciful that God forgave their misdeeds
and did not destroy them; ⁕
vh2: many a time God turned back from wrath
and did not suffer God’s whole displeasure to be roused.

verses.vh1: For God remembered that they were but flesh, ⁕
verses.vh2: a wind that passes by and does not return.

refrain: O God, how glorious are your works.

verses.vh1: How often they rebelled against God in the wilderness ⁕
verses.vh2: and grieved God in the desert!

verses.vh1: Again and again they tempted God ⁕
verses.vh2: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

verses.vh1: They did not remember God’s power ⁕
verses.vh2: in the day when God redeemed them from the enemy;

verses.vh1: How God had wrought signs in Egypt ⁕
verses.vh2: and wonders in the field of Zoan.

verses.vh1: God turned their rivers into blood, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that they could not drink of their streams.

verses.vh1: God sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them, ⁕
verses.vh2: and frogs which brought them ruin.

verses.vh1: God gave their produce to the caterpillar, ⁕
verses.vh2: the fruit of their toil to the locust.

verses.vh1: God destroyed their vines with hailstones ⁕
verses.vh2: and their sycamore trees with the frost.

verses.vh1: God delivered their cattle to hailstones ⁕
verses.vh2: and their flocks to thunderbolts.

verses.vh1: God set loose on them a blazing anger: ⁕
vh2: fury, displeasure and trouble,
a troop of destroying angels.

vh1: God made a way for anger
and spared not their souls from death, ⁕
verses.vh2: but gave their life over to the pestilence.

verses.vh1: God smote the firstborn of Egypt, ⁕
verses.vh2: the first fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

verses.vh1: But God led out the people like sheep ⁕
verses.vh2: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.vh1: God led them to safety and they were not afraid, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verses.vh1: God brought them to God’s holy place, ⁕
verses.vh2: the mountain which God’s right hand took in possession.

vh1: God drove out the nations before them
and shared out to them their inheritance; ⁕
verses.vh2: God settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

vh1: Yet still they tested God Most High
and rebelled against God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and would not keep God’s commandments.

verses.vh1: They turned back and fell away like their forebears, ⁕
verses.vh2: starting aside like an unstrung bow.

verses.vh1: They grieved God with their hill altars ⁕
verses.vh2: and provoked God to displeasure with their idols.

verses.vh1: God heard and was greatly angered, ⁕
verses.vh2: and utterly rejected Israel.

verses.vh1: God forsook the tabernacle at Shiloh, ⁕
verses.vh2: the tent of God’s presence on earth.

verses.vh1: God gave the ark of God’s strength into captivity, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s splendour into the adversary’s hand.

verses.vh1: God delivered God’s own people to the sword ⁕
verses.vh2: and raged against God’s inheritance.

verses.vh1: The fire consumed their youths; ⁕
verses.vh2: there was no one to lament their young.

verses.vh1: Their priests fell by the sword, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their bereaved made no lamentation.

verses.vh1: Then God woke as out of sleep, ⁕
verses.vh2: like a warrior who had been overcome with wine.

verses.vh1: God struck the enemies from behind ⁕
verses.vh2: and put them to perpetual shame.

verses.vh1: God rejected the tent of Joseph ⁕
verses.vh2: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim,

verses.vh1: But God chose the tribe of Judah ⁕
verses.vh2: and the hill of Zion, which God loved.

verses.vh1: And there God built the sanctuary like the heights of heaven, ⁕
verses.vh2: like the earth which God founded for ever.

verses.vh1: God chose David also, God’s servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: and took him away from the sheepfolds.

verses.vh1: From following the ewes with their lambs God took him, ⁕
vh2: that he might shepherd Jacob God’s people
and Israel God’s inheritance.

verses.vh1: So he shepherded them with a devoted heart ⁕
verses.vh2: and with skilful hands he guided them.

refrain: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of God.

verses.vh1: O God, the heathen have come into your heritage; ⁕
vh2: your holy temple have they defiled
and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.

verses.vh1: The dead bodies of your servants they have given to be food for the birds of the air, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the field.

verses.vh1: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem, ⁕
verses.vh2: and there was no one to bury them.

verses.vh1: We have become the taunt of our neighbours, ⁕
verses.vh2: the scorn and derision of those that are round about us.

verses.vh1: God, how long will you be angry, for ever? ⁕
verses.vh2: How long will your jealous fury blaze like fire?

verses.vh1: Pour out your wrath upon the nations that have not known you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your name.

verses.vh1: For they have devoured Jacob ⁕
verses.vh2: and laid waste his dwelling place.

verses.vh1: Remember not against us our former sins; ⁕
vh2: let your compassion make haste to meet us,
for we are brought very low.

verses.vh1: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver us, and wipe away our sins for your name’s sake.

verses.vh1: Why should the heathen say, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Where is now their God?’

verses.vh1: Let vengeance for your servants’ blood that is shed ⁕
verses.vh2: be known among the nations in our sight.

verses.vh1: Let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and by your mighty arm preserve those who are condemned to die.

verses.vh1: May the taunts with which our neighbours taunted you, God, ⁕
verses.vh2: return sevenfold into their bosom.

verses.vh1: But we that are your people and the sheep of your pasture will give you thanks for ever, ⁕
verses.vh2: and tell of your praise from generation to generation.

refrain: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name.

verses.vh1: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: you that led Joseph like a flock;

verses.vh1: Shine forth, you that are enthroned upon the cherubim, ⁕
verses.vh2: before Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh.

verses.vh1: Stir up your mighty strength ⁕
verses.vh2: and come to our salvation.

verses.vh1: Turn us again, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

verses.vh1: O God God of hosts, ⁕
verses.vh2: how long will you be angry at your people’s prayer?

verses.vh1: You feed them with the bread of tears; ⁕
verses.vh2: you give them abundance of tears to drink.

verses.vh1: You have made us the derision of our neighbours, ⁕
verses.vh2: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

verses.vh1: Turn us again, O God of hosts; ⁕
verses.vh2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

verses.vh1: You brought a vine out of Egypt; ⁕
verses.vh2: you drove out the nations and planted it.

verses.vh1: You made room around it, ⁕
verses.vh2: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.

verses.vh1: The hills were covered with its shadow ⁕
verses.vh2: and the cedars of God by its boughs.

verses.vh1: It stretched out its branches to the Sea ⁕
verses.vh2: and its tendrils to the River.

verses.vh1: Why then have you broken down its wall, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that all who pass by pluck off its grapes?

verses.vh1: The wild boar out of the wood tears it off, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the insects of the field devour it.

verses.vh1: Turn again, O God of hosts, ⁕
verses.vh2: look down from heaven and behold;

verses.vh1: Cherish this vine which your right hand has planted, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the branch that you made so strong for yourself.

verses.vh1: Let those who burnt it with fire, who cut it down, ⁕
verses.vh2: perish at the rebuke of your countenance.

verses.vh1: Let your hand be upon the one at your right hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: the Son of Man you made so strong for yourself.

verses.vh1: And so will we not go back from you; ⁕
verses.vh2: give us life, and we shall call upon your name.

verses.vh1: Turn us again, O God God of hosts; ⁕
verses.vh2: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

verses.vh1: Sing merrily to God our strength, ⁕
verses.vh2: shout for joy to the God of Jacob.

verses.vh1: Take up the song and sound the timbrel, ⁕
verses.vh2: the tuneful lyre with the harp.

verses.vh1: Blow the trumpet at the new moon, ⁕
verses.vh2: as at the full moon, upon our solemn feast day.

verses.vh1: For this is a statute for Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: a law of the God of Jacob,

verses.vh1: The charge God laid on the people of Joseph, ⁕
verses.vh2: when they came out of the land of Egypt.

verses.vh1: I heard a voice I did not know, that said: ⁕
vh2: ‘I eased their shoulder from the burden;
their hands were set free from bearing the load.

verses.vh1: ‘You called upon me in trouble and I delivered you; ⁕
vh2: I answered you from the secret place of thunder
and proved you at the waters of Meribah.

verses.vh1: ‘Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you: ⁕
verses.vh2: O Israel, if you would but listen to me!

verses.vh1: ‘There shall be no strange god among you; ⁕
verses.vh2: you shall not worship a foreign god.

vh1: ‘I am God your God,
who brought you up from the land of Egypt; ⁕
verses.vh2: open your mouth wide and I shall fill it.’

verses.vh1: But my people would not hear my voice ⁕
verses.vh2: and Israel would not obey me.

verses.vh1: So I sent them away in the stubbornness of their hearts, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let them walk after their own counsels.

verses.vh1: O that my people would listen to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: that Israel would walk in my ways!

verses.vh1: Then I should soon put down their enemies ⁕
verses.vh2: and turn my hand against their adversaries.

verses.vh1: Those who hate God would be humbled before God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their punishment would last for ever.

verses.vh1: But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat ⁕
verses.vh2: and with honey from the rock would I satisfy them.

refrain: O come, let us sing to God.

verses.vh1: God has taken God’s stand in the council of heaven; ⁕
verses.vh2: God gives judgement in the midst of the gods:

verses.vh1: ‘How long will you judge unjustly ⁕
verses.vh2: and show such favour to the wicked?

verses.vh1: ‘You were to judge the weak and the orphan; ⁕
verses.vh2: defend the right of the humble and needy;

verses.vh1: ‘Rescue the weak and the poor; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver them from the hand of the wicked.

vh1: ‘They have no knowledge or wisdom;
they walk on still in darkness: ⁕
verses.vh2: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

verses.vh1: ‘Therefore I say that though you are gods ⁕
verses.vh2: and all of you children of the Most High,

verses.vh1: ‘Nevertheless, you shall die like mortals ⁕
verses.vh2: and fall like one of their princes.’

verses.vh1: Arise, O God and judge the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: for it is you that shall take all nations for your possession.

refrain: Arise, O God, and judge the earth.

verses.vh1: Hold not your peace, O God, do not keep silent; ⁕
verses.vh2: be not unmoved, O God;

verses.vh1: For your enemies are in tumult ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who hate you lift up their heads.

verses.vh1: They take secret counsel against your people ⁕
verses.vh2: and plot against those whom you treasure.

verses.vh1: They say, ‘Come, let us destroy them as a nation, ⁕
verses.vh2: that the name of Israel be remembered no more.’

verses.vh1: They have conspired together with one mind; ⁕
verses.vh2: they are in league against you:

verses.vh1: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, ⁕
verses.vh2: Moab and the Hagarenes,

verses.vh1: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, ⁕
verses.vh2: the Philistines and those who dwell in Tyre.

verses.vh1: Ashur also has joined them ⁕
verses.vh2: and has lent a strong arm to the children of Lot.

verses.vh1: Do to them as you did to Midian, ⁕
verses.vh2: to Sisera and to Jabin at the river of Kishon,

verses.vh1: Who perished at Endor ⁕
verses.vh2: and became as dung for the earth.

verses.vh1: Make their commanders like Oreb and Zeëb, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

verses.vh1: Who said, ‘Let us take for ourselves ⁕
verses.vh2: the pastures of God as our possession.’

verses.vh1: O my God, make them like thistledown, ⁕
verses.vh2: like chaff before the wind.

verses.vh1: Like fire that consumes a forest, ⁕
verses.vh2: like the flame that sets mountains ablaze,

verses.vh1: So drive them with your tempest ⁕
verses.vh2: and dismay them with your storm.

verses.vh1: Cover their faces with shame, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that they may seek your name.

verses.vh1: Let them be disgraced and dismayed for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be put to confusion and perish;

verses.vh1: And they shall know that you, whose name is God, ⁕
verses.vh2: are alone the Most High over all the earth.

refrain: The wicked shall not be able to stand in the judgement.

verses.vh1: How lovely is your dwelling place, O God of hosts! ⁕
