vh2: My soul has a desire and longing to enter the courts of God;
my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

vh1: The sparrow has found it a house
and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young: ⁕
verses.vh2: at your altars, O God of hosts, my Sovereign and my God.

verses.vh1: Blessed are they who dwell in your house: ⁕
verses.vh2: they will always be praising you.

verses.vh1: Blessed are those whose strength is in you, ⁕
verses.vh2: in whose heart are the highways to Zion,

verses.vh1: Who going through the barren valley find there a spring, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the early rains will clothe it with blessing.

verses.vh1: They will go from strength to strength ⁕
verses.vh2: and appear before God in Zion.

verses.vh1: O God God of hosts, hear my prayer; ⁕
verses.vh2: listen, O God of Jacob.

verses.vh1: Behold our defender, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and look upon the face of your anointed.

verses.vh1: For one day in your courts ⁕
verses.vh2: is better than a thousand.

verses.vh1: I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God ⁕
verses.vh2: than dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

vh1: For you O God are both sun and shield;
you will give grace and glory; ⁕
vh2: no good thing shall you withhold, O God,
from those who walk with integrity.

verses.vh1: O God of hosts, ⁕
verses.vh2: blessed are those who put their trust in you.

refrain: Blessed are they who dwell in your house.

verses.vh1: God, you were gracious to your land; ⁕
verses.vh2: you restored the fortunes of Jacob.

verses.vh1: You forgave the offence of your people ⁕
verses.vh2: and covered all their sins.

verses.vh1: You laid aside all your fury ⁕
verses.vh2: and turned from your wrathful indignation.

verses.vh1: Restore us again, O God our Saviour, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let your anger cease from us.

verses.vh1: Will you be displeased with us for ever? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will you stretch out your wrath from one generation to another?

verses.vh1: Will you not give us life again, ⁕
verses.vh2: that your people may rejoice in you?

verses.vh1: Show us your mercy, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and grant us your salvation.

verses.vh1: I will listen to what God will say, ⁕
vh2: for God shall speak peace to God’s people and to the faithful,
that they turn not again to folly.

verses.vh1: Truly, God’s salvation is near to those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that God’s glory may dwell in our land.

verses.vh1: Mercy and truth are met together, ⁕
verses.vh2: righteousness and peace have kissed each other;

verses.vh1: Truth shall spring up from the earth ⁕
verses.vh2: and righteousness look down from heaven.

verses.vh1: God will indeed give all that is good, ⁕
verses.vh2: and our land will yield its increase.

verses.vh1: Righteousness shall go before God ⁕
verses.vh2: and direct God’s steps in the way.

refrain: Show us your mercy, O God.

verses.vh1: Incline your ear, O God, and answer me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I am poor and in misery.

verses.vh1: Preserve my soul, for I am faithful; ⁕
verses.vh2: save your servant, for I put my trust in you.

verses.vh1: Be merciful to me, O God, for you are my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I call upon you all the day long.

verses.vh1: Gladden the soul of your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: for to you, O God, I lift up my soul.

verses.vh1: For you, God, are good and forgiving, ⁕
verses.vh2: abounding in steadfast love to all who call upon you.

verses.vh1: Give ear, O God, to my prayer ⁕
verses.vh2: and listen to the voice of my supplication.

verses.vh1: In the day of my distress I will call upon you, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you will answer me.

verses.vh1: Among the gods there is none like you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor any works like yours.

verses.vh1: All nations you have made shall come and worship you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall glorify your name.

verses.vh1: For you are great and do wonderful things; ⁕
verses.vh2: you alone are God.

verses.vh1: Teach me your way, O God, and I will walk in your truth; ⁕
verses.vh2: knit my heart to you, that I may fear your name.

verses.vh1: I will thank you, O God my God, with all my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: and glorify your name for evermore;

verses.vh1: For great is your steadfast love towards me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you have delivered my soul from the depths of the grave.

vh1: O God, the proud rise up against me
and a ruthless horde seek after my life; ⁕
verses.vh2: they have not set you before their eyes.

verses.vh1: But you, God, are gracious and full of compassion, ⁕
verses.vh2: slow to anger and full of kindness and truth.

verses.vh1: Turn to me and have mercy upon me; ⁕
vh2: give your strength to your servant
and save the child of your helper.

vh1: Show me a token of your favour,
that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; ⁕
verses.vh2: because you, O God, have helped and comforted me.

refrain: All nations you have made shall come and worship you, O God.

verses.vh1: The foudation of God is on the holy mountains. ⁕
verses.vh2: God loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.vh1: Glorious things are spoken of you, ⁕
verses.vh2: Zion, city of our God.

verses.vh1: I record Egypt and Babylon as those who know me; ⁕
vh2: behold Philistia, Tyre and Ethiopia:
in Zion were they born.

verses.vh1: And of Zion it shall be said, ‘Each one was born in Zion, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the Most High has established it.’

verses.vh1: God will record as God writes up the peoples, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘This one also was born there.’

verses.vh1: And as they dance they shall sing, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘All my fresh springs are in you.’

refrain: God has chosen Zion.

verses.vh1: O God, God of my salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: I have cried day and night before you.

verses.vh1: Let my prayer come into your presence; ⁕
verses.vh2: incline your ear to my cry.

verses.vh1: For my soul is full of troubles; ⁕
verses.vh2: my life draws near to the land of death.

verses.vh1: I am counted as one gone down to the Pit; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am like one that has no strength,

verses.vh1: Lost among the dead, ⁕
verses.vh2: like the slain who lie in the grave,

verses.vh1: Whom you remember no more, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they are cut off from your hand.

verses.vh1: You have laid me in the lowest pit, ⁕
verses.vh2: in a place of darkness in the abyss.

verses.vh1: Your anger lies heavy upon me, ⁕
verses.vh2: and you have afflicted me with all your waves.

verses.vh1: You have put my friends far from me ⁕
verses.vh2: and made me to be abhorred by them.

verses.vh1: I am so fast in prison that I cannot get free; ⁕
verses.vh2: my eyes fail from all my trouble.

verses.vh1: God, I have called daily upon you; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have stretched out my hands to you.

verses.vh1: Do you work wonders for the dead? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will the shades stand up and praise you?

verses.vh1: Shall your loving-kindness be declared in the grave, ⁕
verses.vh2: your faithfulness in the land of destruction?

verses.vh1: Shall your wonders be known in the dark ⁕
verses.vh2: or your righteous deeds in the land where all is forgotten?

verses.vh1: But as for me, O God, I will cry to you; ⁕
verses.vh2: early in the morning my prayer shall come before you.

verses.vh1: God, why have you rejected my soul? ⁕
verses.vh2: Why have you hidden your face from me?

verses.vh1: I have been wretched and at the point of death from my youth; ⁕
verses.vh2: I suffer your terrors and am no more seen.

verses.vh1: Your wrath sweeps over me; ⁕
verses.vh2: your horrors are come to destroy me;

verses.vh1: All day long they come about me like water; ⁕
verses.vh2: they close me in on every side.

verses.vh1: Lover and friend have you put far from me ⁕
verses.vh2: and hid my companions out of my sight.

refrain: You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

verses.vh1: My song shall be always of the loving-kindness of God: ⁕
verses.vh2: with my mouth will I proclaim your faithfulness throughout all generations.

verses.vh1: I will declare that your love is established for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have set your faithfulness as firm as the heavens.

verses.vh1: For you said: ‘I have made a covenant with my chosen one; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have sworn an oath to David my servant:

verses.vh1: “‘Your descendants will I establish for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and build up your throne for all generations.”’

verses.vh1: The heavens praise your wonders, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones;

verses.vh1: For who among the clouds can be compared to God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Who is like God among the host of heaven?

verses.vh1: A God feared in the council of the holy ones, ⁕
verses.vh2: great and terrible above all others.

verses.vh1: Who is like you, O God, God of hosts? ⁕
verses.vh2: Mighty God, your faithfulness is all around you.

verses.vh1: You rule the raging of the sea; ⁕
verses.vh2: you still its waves when they arise.

verses.vh1: You crushed Rahab with a deadly wound ⁕
verses.vh2: and scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

verses.vh1: Yours are the heavens; the earth also is yours; ⁕
verses.vh2: you established the world and all that fills it.

verses.vh1: You created the north and the south; ⁕
verses.vh2: Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.

verses.vh1: You have a mighty arm; ⁕
verses.vh2: strong is your hand and high is your right hand.

verses.vh1: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; ⁕
verses.vh2: steadfast love and faithfulness go before your face.

verses.vh1: Happy are the people who know the shout of triumph: ⁕
verses.vh2: they walk, O God, in the light of your countenance.

verses.vh1: In your name they rejoice all the day long ⁕
verses.vh2: and are exalted in your righteousness.

verses.vh1: For you are the glory of their strength, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in your favour you lift up our heads.

verses.vh1: Truly God is our shield; ⁕
verses.vh2: the Holy One of Israel is our Sovereign.

refrain: Truly God is our shield.

verses.vh1: You spoke once in a vision and said to your faithful people: ⁕
vh2: ‘I have set a youth above the mighty;
I have raised a young man over the people.

verses.vh1: ‘I have found David my servant; ⁕
verses.vh2: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

verses.vh1: ‘My hand shall hold him fast ⁕
verses.vh2: and my arm shall strengthen him.

verses.vh1: ‘No enemy shall deceive him, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor any wicked person afflict him.

verses.vh1: ‘I will strike down his foes before his face ⁕
verses.vh2: and beat down those that hate him.

verses.vh1: ‘My truth also and my steadfast love shall be with him, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in my name shall his head be exalted.

verses.vh1: I will set his dominion upon the sea ⁕
verses.vh2: and his right hand upon the rivers.

verses.vh1: ‘He shall call to me, “You are my Father, ⁕
verses.vh2: my God, and the rock of my salvation;’‘

verses.vh1: ‘And I will make him my firstborn, ⁕
verses.vh2: the most high above the rulers of the earth.

verses.vh1: ‘The love I have pledged to him will I keep for ever, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my covenant will stand fast with him.

verses.vh1: ‘His descendants also will I make to endure for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.vh1: ‘But if his children forsake my law ⁕
verses.vh2: and cease to walk in my judgements,

verses.vh1: ‘If they break my statutes ⁕
verses.vh2: and do not keep my commandments,

verses.vh1: ‘I will punish their offences with a rod ⁕
verses.vh2: and their sin with scourges.

verses.vh1: ‘But I will not take from him my steadfast love ⁕
verses.vh2: nor suffer my truth to fail.

verses.vh1: ‘My covenant will I not break ⁕
verses.vh2: nor alter what has gone out of my lips.

verses.vh1: ‘Once for all have I sworn by my holiness ⁕
verses.vh2: that I will not prove false to David.

verses.vh1: ‘His descendants shall endure for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and his throne as the sun before me;

verses.vh1: ‘It shall stand fast for ever as the moon, ⁕
verses.vh2: the enduring witness in the heavens.’

refrain: God has sworn an oath to David,
a promise from which God will not shrink.

verses.vh1: But you have cast off and rejected your anointed; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have shown fierce anger against him.

verses.vh1: You have broken the covenant with your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: and have cast his crown to the dust.

verses.vh1: You have broken down all his walls ⁕
verses.vh2: and laid his strongholds in ruins.

verses.vh1: All who pass by despoil him, ⁕
verses.vh2: and he has become the scorn of his neighbours.

verses.vh1: You have exalted the right hand of his foes ⁕
verses.vh2: and made all his enemies rejoice.

verses.vh1: You have turned back the edge of his sword ⁕
verses.vh2: and have not upheld him in battle.

verses.vh1: You have made an end of his radiance ⁕
verses.vh2: and cast his throne to the ground.

verses.vh1: You have cut short the days of his youth ⁕
verses.vh2: and have covered him with shame.

verses.vh1: How long will you hide yourself so utterly, O God? ⁕
verses.vh2: How long shall your anger burn like fire?

verses.vh1: Remember how short my time is, ⁕
verses.vh2: how frail you have made all mortal flesh.

verses.vh1: Which of the living shall not see death, ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall deliver their soul from the power of darkness?

verses.vh1: Where, O God, is your steadfast love of old, ⁕
verses.vh2: which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

verses.vh1: Remember, O God, how your servant is scorned, ⁕
verses.vh2: how I bear in my bosom the taunts of many peoples,

verses.vh1: While your enemies mock, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: while they mock the footsteps of your anointed.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God for evermore. ⁕
verses.vh2: Amen and Amen.

refrain: For your servant David’s sake,
turn not away the face of your anointed.

verses.vh1: God, you have been our refuge ⁕
verses.vh2: from one generation to another.

vh1: Before the mountains were brought forth,
or the earth and the world were formed, ⁕
verses.vh2: from everlasting to everlasting you are God.

verses.vh1: You turn us back to dust and say: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Turn back, O children of earth.’

verses.vh1: For a thousand years in your sight are but as yesterday, ⁕
verses.vh2: which passes like a watch in the night.

verses.vh1: You sweep them away like a dream; ⁕
verses.vh2: they fade away suddenly like the grass.

verses.vh1: In the morning it is green and flourishes; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the evening it is dried up and withered.

verses.vh1: For we consume away in your displeasure; ⁕
verses.vh2: we are afraid at your wrathful indignation.

verses.vh1: You have set our misdeeds before you ⁕
verses.vh2: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.

verses.vh1: When you are angry, all our days are gone; ⁕
verses.vh2: our years come to an end like a sigh.

vh1: The days of our life are three score years and ten,
or if our strength endures, even four score; ⁕
vh2: yet the sum of them is but labour and sorrow,
for they soon pass away and we are gone.

verses.vh1: Who regards the power of your wrath ⁕
verses.vh2: and your indignation like those who fear you?

verses.vh1: So teach us to number our days ⁕
verses.vh2: that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.

verses.vh1: Turn again, O God; how long will you delay? ⁕
verses.vh2: Have compassion on your servants.

verses.vh1: Satisfy us with your loving-kindness in the morning, ⁕
verses.vh2: that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

verses.vh1: Give us gladness for the days you have afflicted us, ⁕
verses.vh2: and for the years in which we have seen adversity.

verses.vh1: Show your servants your works, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let your glory be over their children.

verses.vh1: May the gracious favour of God our God be upon us; ⁕
verses.vh2: prosper our handiwork; O prosper the work of our hands.

refrain: O God my God, in you I take refuge.

verses.vh1: Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High ⁕
verses.vh2: and abides under the shadow of the Almighty,

verses.vh1: Shall say to God, ‘My refuge and my stronghold, ⁕
verses.vh2: my God, in whom I put my trust.’

verses.vh1: For God shall deliver you from the snare of the fowler ⁕
verses.vh2: and from the deadly pestilence.

vh1: God shall cover you with God’s wings
and you shall be safe under God’s feathers; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s faithfulness shall be your shield and buckler.

verses.vh1: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor of the arrow that flies by day;

verses.vh1: Of the pestilence that stalks in darkness, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor of the sickness that destroys at noonday.

vh1: Though a thousand fall at your side
and ten thousand at your right hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet it shall not come near you.

verses.vh1: Your eyes have only to behold ⁕
verses.vh2: to see the reward of the wicked.

verses.vh1: Because you have made God your refuge ⁕
verses.vh2: and the Most High your stronghold,

verses.vh1: There shall no evil happen to you, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither shall any plague come near your tent.

verses.vh1: For God shall give God’s angels charge over you, ⁕
verses.vh2: to keep you in all your ways.

verses.vh1: They shall bear you in their hands, ⁕
verses.vh2: lest you dash your foot against a stone.

verses.vh1: You shall tread upon the lion and adder; ⁕
verses.vh2: the young lion and the serpent you shall trample underfoot.

vh1: Because they have set their love upon me,
therefore will I deliver them; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will lift them up, because they know my name.

verses.vh1: They will call upon me and I will answer them; ⁕
vh2: I am with them in trouble,
I will deliver them and bring them to honour.

verses.vh1: With long life will I satisfy them ⁕
verses.vh2: and show them my salvation.

refrain: Keep me as the apple of your eye.

verses.vh1: It is a good thing to give thanks to God ⁕
verses.vh2: and to sing praises to your name, O Most High;

verses.vh1: To tell of your love early in the morning ⁕
verses.vh2: and of your faithfulness in the night-time,

verses.vh1: Upon the ten-stringed instrument, upon the harp, ⁕
verses.vh2: and to the melody of the lyre.

verses.vh1: For you, God, have made me glad by your acts, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I sing aloud at the works of your hands.

verses.vh1: O God, how glorious are your works! ⁕
verses.vh2: Your thoughts are very deep.

verses.vh1: The senseless do not know, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor do fools understand,

verses.vh1: That though the wicked sprout like grass ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the workers of iniquity flourish,

verses.vh1: It is only to be destroyed for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: but you, O God, shall be exalted for evermore.

vh1: For lo, your enemies, O God,
lo, your enemies shall perish, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

verses.vh1: But my horn you have exalted like the horns of wild oxen; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am anointed with fresh oil.

verses.vh1: My eyes will look down on my foes; ⁕
verses.vh2: my ears shall hear the ruin of the evildoers who rise up against me.

verses.vh1: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall spread abroad like a cedar of Lebanon.

verses.vh1: Such as are planted in the house of God ⁕
verses.vh2: shall flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.vh1: They shall still bear fruit in old age; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall be vigorous and in full leaf;

verses.vh1: That they may show that God is true; ⁕
vh2: God is my rock,
and there is no unrighteousness in God.

refrain: You, O God, shall be exalted for evermore.

verses.vh1: You, O God, are Sovereign, and have put on glorious apparel; ⁕
vh2: You have put on your glory
and girded yourself with strength.

verses.vh1: You have made the whole world so sure ⁕
verses.vh2: that it cannot be moved.

verses.vh1: Your throne has been established from of old; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are from everlasting.

vh1: The floods have lifted up, O God,
the floods have lifted up their voice; ⁕
verses.vh2: the floods lift up their pounding waves.

vh1: Mightier than the thunder of many waters,
mightier than the breakers of the sea, ⁕
verses.vh2: God on high is mightier.

verses.vh1: Your testimonies are very sure; ⁕
verses.vh2: holiness adorns your house, O God, for ever.

refrain: God shall reign for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: God God to whom vengeance belongs, ⁕
verses.vh2: O God to whom vengeance belongs, shine out in majesty.

verses.vh1: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: give the arrogant their just deserts.

verses.vh1: God, how long shall the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: how long shall the wicked triumph?

verses.vh1: How long shall the evildoers boast ⁕
verses.vh2: and pour out such impudent words?

verses.vh1: They crush your people, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and afflict your heritage.

verses.vh1: They murder the widow and the stranger; ⁕
verses.vh2: the orphans they put to death.

verses.vh1: And yet they say, ‘God will not see, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.’

verses.vh1: Consider, most stupid of people; ⁕
verses.vh2: you fools, when will you understand?

verses.vh1: Shall the one that planted the ear not hear? ⁕
verses.vh2: Shall the one that formed the eye not see?

verses.vh1: Shall the one who corrects the nations not punish? ⁕
verses.vh2: Does the one who teaches the peoples lack knowledge?

verses.vh1: God knows every human thought, ⁕
verses.vh2: that they are but a breath.

verses.vh1: Blessed are those whom you chasten, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: whom you instruct from your law;

verses.vh1: That you may give them rest in days of adversity, ⁕
verses.vh2: until a pit is dug for the wicked.

verses.vh1: For you, O God, will not fail your people, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither will you forsake God’s inheritance.

verses.vh1: For justice shall return to the righteous, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all that are true of heart shall follow it.

verses.vh1: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? ⁕
verses.vh2: Who will take my part against the evildoers?

verses.vh1: If God had not helped me, ⁕
verses.vh2: my soul would soon have been put to silence.

verses.vh1: And when I said, ‘My foot has slipped’, ⁕
verses.vh2: your loving mercy, O God, upheld me.

verses.vh1: In the multitude of cares that troubled my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: your comforts have refreshed my soul.

verses.vh1: Will you have anything to do with the throne of wickedness, ⁕
verses.vh2: which fashions evil through its law?

verses.vh1: They gather together against the life of the righteous ⁕
verses.vh2: and condemn the innocent to death.

verses.vh1: But you, O God, have become my stronghold ⁕
verses.vh2: and my God the rock of my trust.

vh1: You will turn against them their own wickedness
and silence them through their own malice; ⁕
verses.vh2: God our God will put them to silence.

refrain: Righteous are you, O God, and true are your judgements.

verses.vh1: O come, let us sing to God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let us heartily rejoice in the rock of our salvation.

verses.vh1: Let us come into God’s presence with thanksgiving ⁕
verses.vh2: and be glad in God with psalms.

verses.vh1: For God is a great God ⁕
verses.vh2: and a great Ruler above all gods.

verses.vh1: In God’s hand are the depths of the earth ⁕
verses.vh2: and the heights of the mountains are God’s also.

verses.vh1: The sea is God’s, for God made it, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s hands have moulded the dry land.

verses.vh1: Come, let us worship and bow down ⁕
verses.vh2: and kneel before God our Maker.

verses.vh1: For God is our God; ⁕
verses.vh2: we are the people of God’s pasture and the sheep of God’s hand.

verses.vh1: O that today you would listen to God’s voice: ⁕
vh2: ‘Harden not your hearts as at Meribah,
on that day at Massah in the wilderness,

verses.vh1: ‘When your forebears tested me, and put me to the proof, ⁕
verses.vh2: though they had seen my works.

verses.vh1: ‘Forty years long I detested that generation and said, ⁕
vh2: “This people are wayward in their hearts;
they do not know my ways.”

verses.vh1: ‘So I swore in my wrath, ⁕
verses.vh2: “They shall not enter into my rest.”’

refrain: Come, let us worship and bow down.

verses.vh1: Sing to God a new song; ⁕
verses.vh2: sing to God, all the earth.

verses.vh1: Sing to God and bless God’s name; ⁕
verses.vh2: tell out God’s salvation from day to day.

verses.vh1: Declare God’s glory among the nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s wonders among all peoples.

verses.vh1: For great is God and greatly to be praised; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is more to be feared than all gods.

verses.vh1: For all the gods of the nations are but idols; ⁕
verses.vh2: it is God who made the heavens.

verses.vh1: Honour and majesty are before God; ⁕
verses.vh2: power and splendour are in God’s sanctuary.

verses.vh1: Ascribe to God, you families of the peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: ascribe to God honour and strength.

verses.vh1: Ascribe to God the honour due to God’s name; ⁕
verses.vh2: bring offerings and come into God’s courts.

verses.vh1: O worship God in the beauty of holiness; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the whole earth tremble before God.

verses.vh1: Tell it out among the nations that God is Sovereign. ⁕
vh2: God has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved;
God will judge the peoples with equity.

verses.vh1: Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the sea thunder and all that is in it;

verses.vh1: Let the fields be joyful and all that is in them; ⁕
verses.vh2: let all the trees of the wood shout for joy before God.

verses.vh1: For God comes, God comes to judge the earth; ⁕
vh2: with righteousness God will judge the world
and the peoples with God’s truth.

refrain: O worship God in the beauty of holiness.

verses.vh1: God is Sovereign: let the earth rejoice; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the multitude of the isles be glad.

verses.vh1: Clouds and darkness are round about God; ⁕
verses.vh2: righteousness and justice are the foundation of God’s throne.

verses.vh1: Fire goes before God ⁕
verses.vh2: and burns up God’s enemies on every side.

verses.vh1: God’s lightnings lit up the world; ⁕
verses.vh2: the earth saw it and trembled.

verses.vh1: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: at the presence of God of the whole earth.

verses.vh1: The heavens declared God’s righteousness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the peoples have seen God’s glory.

vh1: Confounded be all who worship carved images
and delight in mere idols. ⁕
verses.vh2: Bow down before God, all you gods.

verses.vh1: Zion heard and was glad, and the children of Judah rejoiced, ⁕
verses.vh2: because of your judgements, O God.

verses.vh1: For you, God, are most high over all the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are exalted far above all gods.

verses.vh1: God loves those who hate evil; ⁕
vh2: God preserves the lives of God’s faithful
and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

verses.vh1: Light has sprung up for the righteous ⁕
verses.vh2: and joy for the true of heart.

verses.vh1: Rejoice in God, you righteous, ⁕
verses.vh2: and give thanks to God’s holy name.

refrain: You, God, are most high over all the earth.

verses.vh1: Sing to God a new song, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God has done marvellous things.

verses.vh1: God’s own right hand and God’s holy arm ⁕
verses.vh2: have won for God the victory.

verses.vh1: God has made known God’s salvation; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s deliverance has been openly shown in the sight of the nations.

verses.vh1: God has remembered God’s mercy and faithfulness towards the house of Israel, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.vh1: Sound praises to God, all the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: break into singing and make music.

verses.vh1: Make music to God with the lyre, ⁕
verses.vh2: with the lyre and the voice of melody.

verses.vh1: With trumpets and the sound of the horn ⁕
verses.vh2: sound praises before God, the Sovereign.

verses.vh1: Let the sea thunder and all that fills it, ⁕
verses.vh2: the world and all that dwell upon it.

verses.vh1: Let the rivers clap their hands ⁕
vh2: and let the hills ring out together before God,
for God comes to judge the earth.

verses.vh1: In righteousness shall God judge the world ⁕
verses.vh2: and the peoples with equity.

refrain: God has made known God’s salvation.

verses.vh1: God is Sovereign: let the peoples tremble; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is enthroned above the cherubim: let the earth shake.

verses.vh1: God is great in Zion ⁕
verses.vh2: and high above all peoples.

verses.vh1: Let them praise your name, which is great and awesome; ⁕
verses.vh2: God our God is holy.

vh1: Mighty Sovereign, who loves justice,
you have established equity; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.vh1: Exalt God our God; ⁕
verses.vh2: bow down before God’s footstool, for God is holy.

vh1: Moses and Aaron among God’s priests
and Samuel among those who call upon God’s name; ⁕
verses.vh2: they called upon God who answered them.

verses.vh1: God spoke to them out of the pillar of cloud; ⁕
verses.vh2: they kept God’s testimonies and the law that God gave them.

verses.vh1: You answered them, O God our God; ⁕
vh2: you were a God who forgave them
and pardoned them for their offences.

vh1: Exalt God our God
and worship God upon God’s holy hill, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God our God is holy.

verses.vh1: O be joyful in God, all the earth; ⁕
vh2: serve God with gladness
and come before God’s presence with a song.

verses.vh1: Know that God is God; ⁕
vh2: it is God that has made us and we are God’s;
we are God’s people and the sheep of God’s pasture.

vh1: Enter God’s gates with thanksgiving
and God’s courts with praise; ⁕
verses.vh2: give thanks to God and bless God’s name.

verses.vh1: For God is gracious; God’s steadfast love is everlasting, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s faithfulness endures from generation to generation.

refrain: God is gracious; God’s steadfast love is everlasting.

verses.vh1: I will sing of faithfulness and justice; ⁕
verses.vh2: to you, O God, will I sing.

verses.vh1: Let me be wise in the way that is perfect: ⁕
verses.vh2: when will you come to me?

verses.vh1: I will walk with purity of heart ⁕
verses.vh2: within the walls of my house.

verses.vh1: I will not set before my eyes ⁕
verses.vh2: a counsel that is evil.

verses.vh1: I abhor the deeds of unfaithfulness; ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall not cling to me.

verses.vh1: A crooked heart shall depart from me; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.vh1: One who slanders a neighbour in secret ⁕
verses.vh2: I will quickly put to silence.

verses.vh1: Haughty eyes and an arrogant heart ⁕
verses.vh2: I will not endure.

verses.vh1: My eyes are upon the faithful in the land, ⁕
verses.vh2: that they may dwell with me.

verses.vh1: One who walks in the way that is pure ⁕
verses.vh2: shall be my servant.

verses.vh1: There shall not dwell in my house ⁕
verses.vh2: one that practises deceit.

verses.vh1: One who utters falsehood ⁕
verses.vh2: shall not continue in my sight.

verses.vh1: Morning by morning will I put to silence ⁕
verses.vh2: all the wicked in the land,

verses.vh1: To cut off from the city of God ⁕
verses.vh2: all those who practise evil.

refrain: Blessed are those who fear God.

verses.vh1: O God, hear my prayer ⁕
verses.vh2: and let my crying come before you.

verses.vh1: Hide not your face from me ⁕
verses.vh2: in the day of my distress.

verses.vh1: Incline your ear to me; ⁕
verses.vh2: when I call, make haste to answer me,

verses.vh1: For my days are consumed in smoke ⁕
verses.vh2: and my bones burn away as in a furnace.

verses.vh1: My heart is smitten down and withered like grass, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.vh1: From the sound of my groaning ⁕
verses.vh2: my bones cleave fast to my skin.

verses.vh1: I am become like a vulture in the wilderness, ⁕
verses.vh2: like an owl that haunts the ruins.

verses.vh1: I keep watch and am become like a sparrow ⁕
verses.vh2: solitary upon the housetop.

verses.vh1: My enemies revile me all the day long, ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who rage at me have sworn together against me.

verses.vh1: I have eaten ashes for bread ⁕
verses.vh2: and mingled my drink with weeping,

verses.vh1: Because of your indignation and wrath, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you have taken me up and cast me down.

verses.vh1: My days fade away like a shadow, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I am withered like grass.

verses.vh1: But you, O God, shall endure for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and your name through all generations.

verses.vh1: You will arise and have pity on Zion; ⁕
vh2: it is time to have mercy upon Zion;
surely the time has come.

verses.vh1: For your servants love the very stones ⁕
verses.vh2: and feel compassion for the dust.

verses.vh1: Then shall the nations fear your name, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the rulers of the earth your glory,

verses.vh1: When you have built up Zion ⁕
verses.vh2: and shown yourself in glory;

verses.vh1: When you have turned to the prayer of the destitute ⁕
verses.vh2: and have not despised their plea.

verses.vh1: This shall be written for those that come after, ⁕
verses.vh2: and a people yet unborn shall praise God.

verses.vh1: For you have looked down from your holy height; ⁕
verses.vh2: from the heavens you beheld the earth,

verses.vh1: That you might hear the sighings of the prisoner ⁕
verses.vh2: and set free those condemned to die;

verses.vh1: That the name of God may be proclaimed in Zion ⁕
verses.vh2: and your praises in Jerusalem,

verses.vh1: When peoples are gathered together ⁕
verses.vh2: and kingdoms also, to serve God.

verses.vh1: You have brought down my strength in my journey ⁕
verses.vh2: and have shortened my days.

verses.vh1: I pray, ‘O my God, do not take me in the midst of my days; ⁕
verses.vh2: your years endure throughout all generations.

verses.vh1: ‘In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the heavens are the work of your hands;

verses.vh1: ‘They shall perish, but you will endure; ⁕
verses.vh2: they all shall wear out like a garment.

verses.vh1: ‘You change them like clothing, and they shall be changed; ⁕
verses.vh2: but you are the same, and your years will not fail.

verses.vh1: ‘The children of your servants shall continue, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their descendants shall be established in your sight.’

refrain: My help comes from God.

verses.vh1: Bless God, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all that is within me bless God’s holy name.

verses.vh1: Bless God, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: and forget not all God’s benefits;

verses.vh1: Who forgives all your sins ⁕
verses.vh2: and heals all your infirmities;

verses.vh1: Who redeems your life from the Pit ⁕
verses.vh2: and crowns you with faithful love and compassion;

verses.vh1: Who satisfies you with good things, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that your youth is renewed like an eagle’s.

verses.vh1: God executes righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and judgement for all who are oppressed.

verses.vh1: God’s ways were made known to Moses ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s works to the children of Israel.

verses.vh1: God is full of compassion and mercy, ⁕
verses.vh2: slow to anger and of great kindness.

verses.vh1: God will not always accuse us, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither will God remain angry for ever.

verses.vh1: God has not dealt with us according to our sins, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.

verses.vh1: For as the heavens are high above the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: so great is God’s mercy upon those who fear God.

verses.vh1: As far as the east is from the west, ⁕
verses.vh2: so far has God set our sins from us.

verses.vh1: As a parent has compassion on their children, ⁕
verses.vh2: so is God merciful towards those who fear God.

verses.vh1: For God know of what we are made; ⁕
verses.vh2: God remembers that we are but dust.

verses.vh1: Our days are but as grass; ⁕
verses.vh2: we flourish as a flower of the field;

verses.vh1: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone, ⁕
verses.vh2: and its place shall know it no more.

vh1: But the merciful goodness of God is from of old
and endures for ever on those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s righteousness on children’s children;

verses.vh1: On those who keep God’s covenant ⁕
verses.vh2: and remember God’s commandments to do them.

verses.vh1: God has established God’s throne in heaven, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s kingdom has dominion over all.

verses.vh1: Bless God, you angels of God, ⁕
vh2: you mighty ones who do God’s bidding
and hearken to the voice of God’s word.

verses.vh1: Bless God, all you God’s hosts, ⁕
verses.vh2: you ministers of God who do God’s will.

vh1: Bless God, all you works of God,
in all places of God’s dominion; ⁕
verses.vh2: bless God, O my soul.

refrain: God is full of compassion and mercy.

verses.vh1: Bless God, O my soul. ⁕
verses.vh2: O God my God, how excellent is your greatness!

verses.vh1: You are clothed with majesty and honour, ⁕
verses.vh2: wrapped in light as in a garment.

verses.vh1: You spread out the heavens like a curtain ⁕
verses.vh2: and lay the beams of your dwelling place in the waters above.

verses.vh1: You make the clouds your chariot ⁕
verses.vh2: and ride on the wings of the wind.

verses.vh1: You make the winds your messengers ⁕
verses.vh2: and flames of fire your servants.

verses.vh1: You laid the foundations of the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: that it never should move at any time.

verses.vh1: You covered it with the deep like a garment; ⁕
verses.vh2: the waters stood high above the hills.

verses.vh1: At your rebuke they fled; ⁕
verses.vh2: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

verses.vh1: They rose up to the hills and flowed down to the valleys beneath, ⁕
verses.vh2: to the place which you had appointed for them.

verses.vh1: You have set them their bounds that they should not pass, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor turn again to cover the earth.

verses.vh1: You send the springs into the brooks, ⁕
verses.vh2: which run among the hills.

verses.vh1: They give drink to every beast of the field, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wild asses quench their thirst.

verses.vh1: Beside them the birds of the air make their nests ⁕
verses.vh2: and sing among the branches.

verses.vh1: You water the hills from your dwelling on high; ⁕
verses.vh2: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

verses.vh1: You make grass to grow for the cattle ⁕
verses.vh2: and plants to meet our needs,

verses.vh1: Bringing forth food from the earth ⁕
verses.vh2: and wine to gladden our hearts,

verses.vh1: Oil to give us a cheerful countenance ⁕
verses.vh2: and bread to strengthen our hearts.

verses.vh1: The trees of God are full of sap, ⁕
verses.vh2: the cedars of Lebanon which God planted,

verses.vh1: In which the birds build their nests, ⁕
verses.vh2: while the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

verses.vh1: The mountains are a refuge for the wild goats ⁕
verses.vh2: and the stony cliffs for the conies.

verses.vh1: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the sun knows the time for its setting.

verses.vh1: You make darkness that it may be night, ⁕
verses.vh2: in which all the beasts of the forest creep forth.

verses.vh1: The lions roar for their prey ⁕
verses.vh2: and seek their food from God.

verses.vh1: The sun rises and they are gone ⁕
verses.vh2: to lay themselves down in their dens.

verses.vh1: People go forth to their work ⁕
verses.vh2: and to their labour until the evening.

verses.vh1: O God, how manifold are your works! ⁕
vh2: In wisdom you have made them all;
the earth is full of your creatures.

verses.vh1: There is the sea, spread far and wide, ⁕
verses.vh2: and there move creatures beyond number, both small and great.

verses.vh1: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan ⁕
verses.vh2: which you have made to play in the deep.

verses.vh1: All of these look to you ⁕
verses.vh2: to give them their food in due season.

verses.vh1: When you give it them, they gather it; ⁕
verses.vh2: you open your hand and they are filled with good.

verses.vh1: When you hide your face they are troubled; ⁕
vh2: when you take away their breath,
they die and return again to the dust.

verses.vh1: When you send forth your spirit, they are created, ⁕
verses.vh2: and you renew the face of the earth.

verses.vh1: May the glory of God endure for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: may God rejoice in God’s works;

verses.vh1: God looks on the earth and it trembles; ⁕
verses.vh2: God touches the mountains and they smoke.

verses.vh1: I will sing to God as long as I live; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will make music to my God while I have my being.

verses.vh1: So shall my song please God ⁕
verses.vh2: while I rejoice in God.

vh1: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth
and the wicked be no more. ⁕
vh2: Bless God, O my soul.
Alleluia.

refrain: I will sing to God as long as I live.

verses.vh1: O give thanks to God and call upon God’s name; ⁕
verses.vh2: make known God’s deeds among the peoples.

verses.vh1: Sing to God, sing praises, ⁕
verses.vh2: and tell of all God’s marvellous works.

verses.vh1: Rejoice in the praise of God’s holy name; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the hearts of them rejoice who seek God.

verses.vh1: Seek God and seek God’s strength; ⁕
verses.vh2: seek God’s face continually.

verses.vh1: Remember the marvels God has done, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s wonders and the judgements of God’s mouth,

verses.vh1: O descendants of Abraham God’s servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: O children of Jacob God’s chosen.

verses.vh1: God is our God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s judgements are in all the earth.

verses.vh1: God has always been mindful of God’s covenant, ⁕
verses.vh2: the promise that God made for a thousand generations:

verses.vh1: The covenant God made with Abraham, ⁕
verses.vh2: the oath that God swore to Isaac,

verses.vh1: Which God established as a statute for Jacob, ⁕
verses.vh2: an everlasting covenant for Israel,

verses.vh1: Saying, ‘To you will I give the land of Canaan ⁕
verses.vh2: to be the portion of your inheritance.’

verses.vh1: When they were but few in number, ⁕
verses.vh2: of little account, and sojourners in the land,

verses.vh1: Wandering from nation to nation, ⁕
verses.vh2: from one kingdom to another people,

verses.vh1: God suffered no one to do them wrong ⁕
verses.vh2: and rebuked even rulers for their sake,

verses.vh1: Saying, ‘Touch not my anointed ⁕
verses.vh2: and do my prophets no harm.’

verses.vh1: Then God called down famine over the land ⁕
verses.vh2: and broke every staff of bread.

verses.vh1: But God had sent a man before them, ⁕
verses.vh2: Joseph, who was sold as a slave.

verses.vh1: They shackled his feet with fetters; ⁕
verses.vh2: his neck was ringed with iron.

verses.vh1: Until all God foretold came to pass, ⁕
verses.vh2: the word of God tested him.

verses.vh1: The Sovereign sent and released him; ⁕
verses.vh2: the ruler of peoples set him free.

verses.vh1: God appointed him Lord of his household ⁕
verses.vh2: and ruler of all God possessed,

verses.vh1: To instruct his princes as God willed ⁕
verses.vh2: and to teach his counsellors wisdom.

verses.vh1: Then Israel came into Egypt; ⁕
verses.vh2: Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

verses.vh1: And God made his people exceedingly fruitful; ⁕
verses.vh2: God made them too many for their adversaries,

verses.vh1: Whose heart God turned, so that they hated God’s people ⁕
verses.vh2: and dealt craftily with God’s servants.

verses.vh1: Then Moses God’s servant was sent, ⁕
verses.vh2: and Aaron whom God had chosen.

verses.vh1: God showed signs through their word ⁕
verses.vh2: and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.vh1: God sent darkness and it grew dark; ⁕
verses.vh2: yet they did not heed God’s words.

verses.vh1: God turned their waters into blood ⁕
verses.vh2: and slew all their fish.

verses.vh1: Their land swarmed with frogs, ⁕
verses.vh2: even in their rulers’ chambers.

verses.vh1: God spoke the word, and there came clouds of flies, ⁕
verses.vh2: swarms of gnats within all their borders.

verses.vh1: God gave them hailstones for rain ⁕
verses.vh2: and flames of lightning in their land.

verses.vh1: God blasted their vines and their fig trees ⁕
verses.vh2: and shattered trees across their country.

verses.vh1: God spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came ⁕
verses.vh2: and young locusts without number;

verses.vh1: They ate every plant in their land ⁕
verses.vh2: and devoured the fruit of their soil.

verses.vh1: God smote all the firstborn in their land, ⁕
verses.vh2: the first fruits of all their strength.

verses.vh1: Then God brought them out with silver and gold; ⁕
verses.vh2: there was not one among their tribes that stumbled.

verses.vh1: Egypt was glad at their departing, ⁕
verses.vh2: for a dread of them had fallen upon them.

verses.vh1: God spread out a cloud for a covering ⁕
verses.vh2: and a fire to light up the night.

verses.vh1: They asked and God brought them quails; ⁕
verses.vh2: God satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

verses.vh1: God opened the rock, and the waters gushed out ⁕
verses.vh2: and ran in the dry places like a river.

verses.vh1: For God remembered God’s holy word ⁕
verses.vh2: and Abraham, God’s servant.

verses.vh1: So God brought forth God’s people with joy, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s chosen ones with singing.

verses.vh1: God gave them the lands of the nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and they took possession of the fruit of their toil,

verses.vh1: That they might keep God’s statutes ⁕
vh2: and faithfully observe God’s laws.
Alleluia.

refrain: Remember the marvels God has done.

vh1: Alleluia.
Give thanks to God, for God is gracious, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s faithfulness endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Who can express the mighty acts of God ⁕
verses.vh2: or show forth all God’s praise?

verses.vh1: Blessed are those who observe what is right ⁕
verses.vh2: and always do what is just.

verses.vh1: Remember me, O God, in the favour you bear for your people; ⁕
verses.vh2: visit me in the day of your salvation;

vh1: That I may see the prosperity of your chosen
and rejoice in the gladness of your people, ⁕
verses.vh2: and exult with your inheritance.

verses.vh1: We have sinned like our forebears; ⁕
verses.vh2: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

vh1: In Egypt they did not consider your wonders,
nor remember the abundance of your faithful love; ⁕
verses.vh2: they rebelled against the Most High at the Red Sea.

verses.vh1: But God saved them for God’s name’s sake, ⁕
verses.vh2: that God might make known God’s power.

verses.vh1: God rebuked the Red Sea and it was dried up; ⁕
verses.vh2: so God led them through the deep as through the wilderness.

verses.vh1: God saved them from the adversary’s hand ⁕
verses.vh2: and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.vh1: As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them; ⁕
verses.vh2: there was not one of them left.

verses.vh1: Then they believed God’s words ⁕
verses.vh2: and sang aloud God’s praise.

verses.vh1: But soon they forgot God’s deeds ⁕
verses.vh2: and would not wait for God’s counsel.

verses.vh1: A craving seized them in the wilderness, ⁕
verses.vh2: and they put God to the test in the desert.

verses.vh1: God gave them their desire, ⁕
verses.vh2: but sent a wasting sickness among them.

verses.vh1: They grew jealous of Moses in the camp ⁕
verses.vh2: and of Aaron, the holy one of God.

verses.vh1: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan ⁕
verses.vh2: and covered the company of Abiram.

verses.vh1: A fire was kindled in their company; ⁕
verses.vh2: the flame burnt up the wicked.

verses.vh1: They made a calf at Horeb ⁕
verses.vh2: and worshipped the molten image;

verses.vh1: Thus they exchanged their glory ⁕
verses.vh2: for the image of an ox that feeds on hay.

verses.vh1: They forgot God their saviour, ⁕
verses.vh2: who had done such great things in Egypt,

verses.vh1: Wonderful deeds in the land of Ham ⁕
verses.vh2: and fearful things at the Red Sea.

vh1: So God would have destroyed them,
had not Moses God’s chosen stood before God in the breach, ⁕
verses.vh2: to turn away God’s wrath from consuming them.

verses.vh1: Then they scorned the Promised Land ⁕
verses.vh2: and would not believe God’s word,

verses.vh1: But murmured in their tents ⁕
verses.vh2: and would not heed the voice of God.

verses.vh1: So God lifted a hand against them ⁕
verses.vh2: and swore to overthrow them in the wilderness,

verses.vh1: To disperse their descendants among the nations, ⁕
verses.vh2: and to scatter them throughout the lands.

verses.vh1: They joined themselves to the Baal of Peor ⁕
verses.vh2: and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

verses.vh1: They provoked God to anger with their evil deeds ⁕
verses.vh2: and a plague broke out among them.

verses.vh1: Then Phinehas stood up and interceded ⁕
verses.vh2: and so the plague was stayed.

verses.vh1: This was counted to him for righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: throughout all generations for ever.

verses.vh1: They angered God also at the waters of Meribah, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that Moses suffered for their sake;

verses.vh1: For they so embittered God’s spirit ⁕
verses.vh2: that rash words were spoken with God’s lips.

verses.vh1: They did not destroy the peoples ⁕
verses.vh2: as God had commanded them.

verses.vh1: They mingled with the nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and learned to follow their ways,

verses.vh1: So that they worshipped their idols, ⁕
verses.vh2: which became to them a snare.

verses.vh1: Their own children ⁕
verses.vh2: they sacrificed to evil spirits.

verses.vh1: They shed innocent blood, ⁕
verses.vh2: the blood of their children,

verses.vh1: Which they offered to the idols of Canaan, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the land was defiled with blood.

verses.vh1: Thus were they polluted by their actions, ⁕
verses.vh2: and in their wanton deeds went whoring after other gods.

vh1: Therefore was the wrath of God
kindled against God’s people, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God abhorred God’s inheritance.

verses.vh1: God gave them over to the hand of the nations, ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who hated them ruled over them.

verses.vh1: So their enemies oppressed them ⁕
verses.vh2: and put them in subjection under their hand.

vh1: Many a time did God deliver them,
but they rebelled through their own devices ⁕
verses.vh2: and were brought down through their wickedness.

verses.vh1: Nevertheless, God saw their adversity, ⁕
verses.vh2: when God heard their lamentation.

verses.vh1: God remembered the covenant with them ⁕
verses.vh2: and relented according to the greatness of God’s faithful love.

verses.vh1: God made them also to be pitied ⁕
verses.vh2: by all who had taken them captive.

vh1: Save us, O God our God,
and gather us from among the nations, ⁕
vh2: that we may give thanks to your holy name
and glory in your praise.

vh1: Blessed be God, the God of Israel,
from everlasting and to everlasting; ⁕
vh2: and let all the people say, Amen.
Alleluia.

refrain: God remembered God’s covenant.

verses.vh1: O give thanks to God, for God is gracious, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s steadfast love endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Let the redeemed of God say this, ⁕
verses.vh2: those God redeemed from the hand of the enemy,

verses.vh1: And gathered out of the lands from the east and from the west, ⁕
verses.vh2: from the north and from the south.

verses.vh1: Some went astray in desert wastes ⁕
verses.vh2: and found no path to a city to dwell in.

verses.vh1: Hungry and thirsty, ⁕
verses.vh2: their soul was fainting within them.

verses.vh1: So they cried to God in their trouble ⁕
verses.vh2: and God delivered them from their distress.

verses.vh1: God set their feet on the right way ⁕
verses.vh2: till they came to a city to dwell in.

verses.vh1: Let them give thanks to God for God’s goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wonders God does for God’s children.

verses.vh1: For God satisfies the longing soul ⁕
verses.vh2: and fills the hungry soul with good.

verses.vh1: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, ⁕
verses.vh2: bound fast in misery and iron,

verses.vh1: For they had rebelled against the words of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and despised the counsel of the Most High.

verses.vh1: So God bowed down their heart with heaviness; ⁕
verses.vh2: they stumbled and there was none to help them.

verses.vh1: Then they cried to God in their trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God delivered them from their distress.

verses.vh1: God brought them out of darkness and out of the shadow of death, ⁕
verses.vh2: and broke their bonds asunder.

verses.vh1: Let them give thanks to God for God’s goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wonders God does for God’s children.

verses.vh1: For God has broken the doors of bronze ⁕
verses.vh2: and breaks the bars of iron in pieces.

verses.vh1: Some were foolish and took a rebellious way, ⁕
verses.vh2: and were plagued because of their wrongdoing.

verses.vh1: Their soul abhorred all manner of food ⁕
verses.vh2: and drew near to the gates of death.

verses.vh1: Then they cried to God in their trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God delivered them from their distress.

verses.vh1: God sent forth God’s word and healed them, ⁕
verses.vh2: and saved them from destruction.

verses.vh1: Let them give thanks to God for his goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wonders God does for his children.

verses.vh1: Let them offer God sacrifices of thanksgiving ⁕
verses.vh2: and tell of his acts with shouts of joy.

verses.vh1: Those who go down to the sea in ships ⁕
verses.vh2: and ply their trade in great waters,

verses.vh1: These have seen the works of God ⁕
verses.vh2: and his wonders in the deep.

verses.vh1: For at his word the stormy wind arose ⁕
verses.vh2: and lifted up the waves of the sea.

vh1: They were carried up to the heavens
and down again to the deep; ⁕
verses.vh2: their soul melted away in their peril.

verses.vh1: They reeled and staggered like a drunkard ⁕
verses.vh2: and were at their wits’ end.

verses.vh1: Then they cried to God in their trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God brought them out of their distress.

verses.vh1: God made the storm be still ⁕
verses.vh2: and the waves of the sea were calmed.

verses.vh1: Then were they glad because they were at rest, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God brought them to the haven they desired.

verses.vh1: Let them give thanks to God for his goodness ⁕
verses.vh2: and the wonders God does for his children.

verses.vh1: Let them exalt God in the congregation of the people ⁕
verses.vh2: and praise God in the council of the elders.

verses.vh1: God turns rivers into wilderness ⁕
verses.vh2: and water springs into thirsty ground;

verses.vh1: A fruitful land God makes a salty waste, ⁕
verses.vh2: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.

verses.vh1: God makes the wilderness a pool of water ⁕
verses.vh2: and water springs out of a thirsty land.

verses.vh1: There God settles the hungry ⁕
verses.vh2: and they build a city to dwell in.

verses.vh1: They sow fields and plant vineyards ⁕
verses.vh2: and bring in a fruitful harvest.

verses.vh1: God blesses them, so that they multiply greatly; ⁕
verses.vh2: God does not let their herds of cattle decrease.

verses.vh1: God pours contempt on princes ⁕
verses.vh2: and makes them wander in trackless wastes.

verses.vh1: They are diminished and brought low, ⁕
verses.vh2: through stress of misfortune and sorrow,

verses.vh1: But God raises the poor from their misery ⁕
verses.vh2: and multiplies their families like flocks of sheep.

verses.vh1: The upright will see this and rejoice, ⁕
verses.vh2: but all wickedness will shut its mouth.

verses.vh1: Whoever is wise will ponder these things ⁕
verses.vh2: and consider the loving-kindness of God.

verses.vh1: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing and give you praise.

verses.vh1: Awake, my soul; awake, harp and lyre, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may awaken the dawn.

verses.vh1: I will give you thanks, O God, among the peoples; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will sing praise to you among the nations.

verses.vh1: For your loving-kindness is as high as the heavens ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

verses.vh1: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens ⁕
verses.vh2: and your glory over all the earth.

verses.vh1: That your beloved may be delivered, ⁕
verses.vh2: save us by your right hand and answer me.

verses.vh1: God has spoken in his holiness: ⁕
vh2: ‘I will triumph and divide Shechem
and share out the valley of Succoth.

verses.vh1: ‘Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; ⁕
verses.vh2: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my sceptre.

vh1: ‘Moab shall be my washpot,
over Edom will I cast my sandal, ⁕
verses.vh2: across Philistia will I shout in triumph.’

verses.vh1: Who will lead me into the strong city? ⁕
verses.vh2: Who will bring me into Edom?

verses.vh1: Have you not cast us off, O God? ⁕
verses.vh2: Will you no longer go forth with our troops?

verses.vh1: O grant us your help against the enemy, ⁕
verses.vh2: for earthly help is in vain.

verses.vh1: Through God will we do great acts, ⁕
verses.vh2: for it is God that shall tread down our enemies.

refrain: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens.

verses.vh1: Keep silent no longer, O God of my praise, ⁕
verses.vh2: for the mouth of wickedness and treachery is opened against me.

verses.vh1: They have spoken against me with a lying tongue; ⁕
vh2: they encompassed me with words of hatred
and fought against me without a cause.

verses.vh1: In return for my love, they set themselves against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: even though I had prayed for them.

verses.vh1: Thus have they repaid me with evil for good, ⁕
verses.vh2: and hatred for my good will.

verses.vh1: They say, ‘Appoint a wicked person over them, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let an accuser stand at their right hand.

verses.vh1: ‘When they are judged, let them be found guilty, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let their prayer be counted as sin.

verses.vh1: ‘Let their days be few ⁕
verses.vh2: and let another take their office.

verses.vh1: ‘Let their children lose their parent ⁕
verses.vh2: and their spouse be widowed.

verses.vh1: ‘Let their children wander to beg their bread; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them seek it in desolate places.

verses.vh1: ‘Let the creditor seize all that they have; ⁕
verses.vh2: let strangers plunder the fruit of their toil.

verses.vh1: ‘Let there be no one to keep faith with them, ⁕
verses.vh2: or have compassion on their grieving children.

verses.vh1: ‘Let their line soon come to an end ⁕
verses.vh2: and their name be blotted out in the next generation.

verses.vh1: ‘Let the wickedness of their ancestors be remembered before God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and no sin of his parents be blotted out;

verses.vh1: ‘Let their sin be always before God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that God may root out their name from the earth;

verses.vh1: ‘Because they were not minded to keep faith, ⁕
vh2: but persecuted the poor and needy
and sought to kill the brokenhearted.

verses.vh1: ‘They loved cursing and it came to them; ⁕
verses.vh2: they took no delight in blessing and it was far from them.

verses.vh1: ‘They clothed themself with cursing as with a garment: ⁕
vh2: it seeped into their body like water
and into their bones like oil;

verses.vh1: ‘Let it be to them like the cloak which they wrap around them ⁕
verses.vh2: and like the belt that they wear continually.’

verses.vh1: Thus may God repay my accusers ⁕
verses.vh2: and those who speak evil against me.

verses.vh1: But deal with me, O God my God, according to your name; ⁕
verses.vh2: O deliver me, for sweet is your faithfulness.

verses.vh1: For I am helpless and poor ⁕
verses.vh2: and my heart is disquieted within me.

verses.vh1: I fade like a shadow that lengthens; ⁕
verses.vh2: I am shaken off like a locust.

verses.vh1: My knees are weak through fasting ⁕
verses.vh2: and my flesh is dried up and wasted.

verses.vh1: I have become a reproach to them; ⁕
verses.vh2: those who see me shake their heads in scorn.

verses.vh1: Help me, O God my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: save me for your loving mercy’s sake,

verses.vh1: And they shall know that this is your hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: that you, O God, have done it.

verses.vh1: Though they curse, may you bless; ⁕
vh2: let those who rise up against me be confounded,
but let your servant rejoice.

verses.vh1: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace ⁕
verses.vh2: and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.

verses.vh1: I will give great thanks to God with my mouth; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the midst of the multitude will I praise God;

verses.vh1: Because God has stood at the right hand of the needy, ⁕
verses.vh2: to save them from those who would condemn them.

refrain: O God my God,
save me for your loving mercy’s sake.

verses.vh1: God said to my Lord, ‘Sit at my right hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: until I make your enemies your footstool.’

verses.vh1: May God stretch forth the sceptre of your power; ⁕
verses.vh2: rule from Zion in the midst of your enemies.

verses.vh1: ‘Noble are you on this day of your birth; ⁕
vh2: on the holy mountain, from the womb of the dawn
the dew of your new birth is upon you.’

verses.vh1: God has sworn and will not retract: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.’

verses.vh1: The King at your right hand, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: shall smite down rulers in the day of God’s wrath.

verses.vh1: In majesty, God shall judge among the nations, ⁕
verses.vh2: smiting heads over all the wide earth.

verses.vh1: God shall drink from the brook beside the way; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore shall God lift high God’s head.

refrain: God is Sovereign and has put on glorious apparel.

vh1: Alleluia.
I will give thanks to God with my whole heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the company of the faithful and in the congregation.

verses.vh1: The works of God are great, ⁕
verses.vh2: sought out by all who delight in them.

verses.vh1: His work is full of majesty and honour ⁕
verses.vh2: and his righteousness endures for ever.

verses.vh1: God appointed a memorial for his marvellous deeds; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is gracious and full of compassion.

verses.vh1: God gave food to those who feared God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is ever mindful of his covenant.

verses.vh1: God showed his people the power of his works ⁕
verses.vh2: in giving them the heritage of the nations.

verses.vh1: The works of his hands are truth and justice; ⁕
verses.vh2: all his commandments are sure.

verses.vh1: They stand fast for ever and ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: they are done in truth and equity.

vh1: God sent redemption to his people;
God commanded his covenant for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: holy and awesome is his name.

vh1: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom;
a good understanding have those who live by it; ⁕
verses.vh2: his praise endures for ever.

refrain: God is gracious and full of compassion.

vh1: Alleluia.
Blessed are those who fear God ⁕
verses.vh2: and have great delight in his commandments.

verses.vh1: Their descendants will be mighty in the land, ⁕
verses.vh2: a generation of the faithful that will be blest.

verses.vh1: Wealth and riches will be in their house, ⁕
verses.vh2: and their righteousness endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Light shines in the darkness for the upright; ⁕
verses.vh2: gracious and full of compassion are the righteous.

verses.vh1: It goes well with those who are generous in lending ⁕
verses.vh2: and order their affairs with justice,

verses.vh1: For they will never be shaken; ⁕
verses.vh2: the righteous will be held in everlasting remembrance.

verses.vh1: They will not be afraid of any evil tidings; ⁕
verses.vh2: their heart is steadfast, trusting in God.

verses.vh1: Their heart is sustained and will not fear, ⁕
verses.vh2: until they see the downfall of their foes.

vh1: They have given freely to the poor;
their righteousness stands fast for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: their head will be exalted with honour.

vh1: The wicked shall see it and be angry;
they shall gnash their teeth in despair; ⁕
verses.vh2: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

refrain: The righteous will be held in everlasting remembrance.

vh1: Alleluia.
Give praise, you servants of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: O praise the name of God.

verses.vh1: Blessed be the name of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: from this time forth and for evermore.

verses.vh1: From the rising of the sun to its setting ⁕
verses.vh2: let the name of God be praised.

verses.vh1: God is high above all nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and his glory above the heavens.

vh1: Who is like God our God,
that has his throne so high, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet is humbled to behold the things of heaven and earth?

verses.vh1: God raises the poor from the dust ⁕
verses.vh2: and lifts the needy from the ashes,

verses.vh1: To set them with princes, ⁕
verses.vh2: with the princes of his people.

verses.vh1: God gives the barren woman a place in the house ⁕
vh2: and makes her a joyful mother of children.
Alleluia.

refrain: From the rising of the sun to its setting
let the name of God be praised.

verses.vh1: When Israel came out of Egypt, ⁕
verses.vh2: the house of Jacob from a people of a strange tongue,

verses.vh1: Judah became his sanctuary, ⁕
verses.vh2: Israel his dominion.

verses.vh1: The sea saw that, and fled; ⁕
verses.vh2: Jordan was driven back.

verses.vh1: The mountains skipped like rams, ⁕
verses.vh2: the little hills like young sheep.

verses.vh1: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled? ⁕
verses.vh2: O Jordan, that you were driven back?

verses.vh1: You mountains, that you skipped like rams, ⁕
verses.vh2: you little hills like young sheep?

verses.vh1: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

verses.vh1: Who turns the hard rock into a pool of water, ⁕
verses.vh2: the flint-stone into a springing well.

refrain: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of God.

vh1: Not to us, God, not to us,
but to your name give the glory, ⁕
verses.vh2: for the sake of your loving mercy and truth.

verses.vh1: Why should the nations say, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Where is now their God?’

verses.vh1: Our God is in heaven; ⁕
verses.vh2: and does whatever God pleases.

verses.vh1: Their idols are silver and gold, ⁕
verses.vh2: the work of human hands.

verses.vh1: They have mouths, but cannot speak; ⁕
verses.vh2: eyes have they, but cannot see;

verses.vh1: They have ears, but cannot hear; ⁕
verses.vh2: noses have they, but cannot smell;

vh1: They have hands, but cannot feel;
feet have they, but cannot walk; ⁕
verses.vh2: not a whisper do they make from their throats.

verses.vh1: Those who make them shall become like them ⁕
verses.vh2: and so will all who put their trust in them.

verses.vh1: But you, Israel, put your trust in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is their help and their shield.

verses.vh1: House of Aaron, trust in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is their help and their shield.

verses.vh1: You that fear God, trust in God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is their help and their shield.

verses.vh1: God has been mindful of us and God will bless us; ⁕
vh2: may God bless the house of Israel;
may God bless the house of Aaron;

verses.vh1: May God bless those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: both small and great together.

verses.vh1: May God increase you more and more, ⁕
verses.vh2: you and your children after you.

verses.vh1: May you be blest by God, ⁕
verses.vh2: the maker of heaven and earth.

verses.vh1: The heavens are the heavens of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: but the earth God has entrusted to God’s children.

verses.vh1: The dead do not praise God, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor those gone down into silence;

verses.vh1: But we will bless God, ⁕
vh2: from this time forth for evermore.
Alleluia.

refrain: God has been mindful of us and God will bless us.

vh1: I love God,
for God has heard the voice of my supplication; ⁕
verses.vh2: because God inclined God’s ear to me on the day I called to God.

vh1: The snares of death encompassed me;
the pains of hell took hold of me; ⁕
verses.vh2: by grief and sorrow was I held.

verses.vh1: Then I called upon the name of God: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘O God, I beg you, deliver my soul.’

verses.vh1: Gracious is God and righteous; ⁕
verses.vh2: our God is full of compassion.

verses.vh1: God watches over the simple; ⁕
verses.vh2: I was brought very low and God saved me.

verses.vh1: Turn again to your rest, O my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God has been gracious to you.

verses.vh1: For you have delivered my soul from death, ⁕
verses.vh2: my eyes from tears and my feet from falling.

verses.vh1: I will walk before God ⁕
verses.vh2: in the land of the living.

vh1: I believed that I should perish
for I was sorely troubled; ⁕
vh2: and I said in my alarm,
‘Everyone is a liar.’

verses.vh1: How shall I repay God ⁕
verses.vh2: for all the benefits God has given to me?

verses.vh1: I will lift up the cup of salvation ⁕
verses.vh2: and call upon the name of God.

verses.vh1: I will fulfil my vows to God ⁕
verses.vh2: in the presence of all his people.

verses.vh1: Precious in the sight of God ⁕
verses.vh2: is the death of his faithful servants.

verses.vh1: O God, I am your servant, ⁕
vh2: your servant, the child of your helper;
you have freed me from my bonds.

verses.vh1: I will offer to you a sacrifice of thanksgiving ⁕
verses.vh2: and call upon the name of God.

verses.vh1: I will fulfil my vows to God ⁕
verses.vh2: in the presence of all his people,

verses.vh1: In the courts of the house of God, ⁕
vh2: in the midst of you, O Jerusalem.
Alleluia.

refrain: Gracious is God and righteous.

verses.vh1: O praise God, all you nations; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God, all you peoples.

verses.vh1: For great is his steadfast love towards us, ⁕
vh2: and the faithfulness of God endures for ever.
Alleluia.

refrain: Alleluia.

verses.vh1: O give thanks to God, for God is good; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s mercy endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Let Israel now proclaim, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘God’s mercy endures for ever.’

verses.vh1: Let the house of Aaron now proclaim, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘God’s mercy endures for ever.’

verses.vh1: Let those who fear God proclaim, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘God’s mercy endures for ever.’

verses.vh1: In my constraint I called to God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God answered and set me free.

verses.vh1: God is at my side; I will not fear; ⁕
verses.vh2: what can flesh do to me?

verses.vh1: With God at my side as my saviour, ⁕
verses.vh2: I shall see the downfall of my enemies.

verses.vh1: It is better to take refuge in God ⁕
verses.vh2: than to put any confidence in flesh.

verses.vh1: It is better to take refuge in God ⁕
verses.vh2: than to put any confidence in princes.

verses.vh1: All the nations encompassed me, ⁕
verses.vh2: but by the name of God I drove them back.

verses.vh1: They hemmed me in, they hemmed me in on every side, ⁕
verses.vh2: but by the name of God I drove them back.

vh1: They swarmed about me like bees;
they blazed like fire among thorns, ⁕
verses.vh2: but by the name of God I drove them back.

verses.vh1: Surely, I was thrust to the brink, ⁕
verses.vh2: but God came to my help.

verses.vh1: God is my strength and my song, ⁕
verses.vh2: and God has become my salvation.

verses.vh1: Joyful shouts of salvation ⁕
verses.vh2: sound from the tents of the righteous:

vh1: ‘The right hand of God does mighty deeds;
the right hand of God raises up; ⁕
verses.vh2: the right hand of God does mighty deeds.’

verses.vh1: I shall not die, but live ⁕
verses.vh2: and declare the works of God.

verses.vh1: God has punished me sorely, ⁕
verses.vh2: but God has not given me over to death.

verses.vh1: Open to me the gates of righteousness, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may enter and give thanks to God.

verses.vh1: This is the gate of God; ⁕
verses.vh2: the righteous shall enter through it.

verses.vh1: I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me ⁕
verses.vh2: and have become my salvation.

verses.vh1: The stone which the builders rejected ⁕
verses.vh2: has become the chief cornerstone.

verses.vh1: This is God’s doing, ⁕
verses.vh2: and it is marvellous in our eyes.

verses.vh1: This is the day that God has made; ⁕
verses.vh2: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.vh1: Come, O God, and save us we pray. ⁕
verses.vh2: Come, God, send us now prosperity.

verses.vh1: Blessed is the one who comes in the name of God; ⁕
verses.vh2: we bless you from the house of God.

verses.vh1: God is God and has given us light; ⁕
verses.vh2: link the pilgrims with cords right to the horns of the altar.

verses.vh1: You are my God and I will thank you; ⁕
verses.vh2: you are my God and I will exalt you.

verses.vh1: O give thanks to God, for God is good; ⁕
verses.vh2: his mercy endures for ever.

refrain: I will give thanks to you,
for you have become my salvation.
Teach me, O God, the way of your statutes.

verses.vh1: Blessed are those whose way is pure, ⁕
verses.vh2: who walk in the law of God.

verses.vh1: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies ⁕
verses.vh2: and seek God with their whole heart,

verses.vh1: Those who do no wickedness, ⁕
verses.vh2: but walk in his ways.

verses.vh1: You, O God, have charged ⁕
verses.vh2: that we should diligently keep your commandments.

verses.vh1: O that my ways were made so direct ⁕
verses.vh2: that I might keep your statutes.

verses.vh1: Then should I not be put to shame, ⁕
verses.vh2: because I have regard for all your commandments.

verses.vh1: I will thank you with an unfeigned heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: when I have learned your righteous judgements.

verses.vh1: I will keep your statutes; ⁕
verses.vh2: O forsake me not utterly.

verses.vh1: How shall young people cleanse their way ⁕
verses.vh2: to keep themselves according to your word?

verses.vh1: With my whole heart have I sought you; ⁕
verses.vh2: O let me not go astray from your commandments.

verses.vh1: Your words have I hidden within my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I should not sin against you.

verses.vh1: Blessed are you, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: O teach me your statutes.

verses.vh1: With my lips have I been telling ⁕
verses.vh2: of all the judgements of your mouth.

verses.vh1: I have taken greater delight in the way of your testimonies ⁕
verses.vh2: than in all manner of riches.

verses.vh1: I will meditate on your commandments ⁕
verses.vh2: and contemplate your ways.

verses.vh1: My delight shall be in your statutes ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will not forget your word.

verses.vh1: O do good to your servant that I may live, ⁕
verses.vh2: and so shall I keep your word.

verses.vh1: Open my eyes, that I may see ⁕
verses.vh2: the wonders of your law.

verses.vh1: I am a stranger upon earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: hide not your commandments from me.

verses.vh1: My soul is consumed at all times ⁕
verses.vh2: with fervent longing for your judgements.

verses.vh1: You have rebuked the arrogant; ⁕
verses.vh2: cursed are those who stray from your commandments.

verses.vh1: Turn from me shame and rebuke, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I have kept your testimonies.

verses.vh1: Rulers also sit and speak against me, ⁕
verses.vh2: but your servant meditates on your statutes.

verses.vh1: For your testimonies are my delight; ⁕
verses.vh2: they are my faithful counsellors.

verses.vh1: My soul cleaves to the dust; ⁕
verses.vh2: O give me life according to your word.

verses.vh1: I have acknowledged my ways and you have answered me; ⁕
verses.vh2: O teach me your statutes.

verses.vh1: Make me understand the way of your commandments, ⁕
verses.vh2: and so shall I meditate on your wondrous works.

verses.vh1: My soul melts away in tears of sorrow; ⁕
verses.vh2: raise me up according to your word.

verses.vh1: Take from me the way of falsehood; ⁕
verses.vh2: be gracious to me through your law.

verses.vh1: I have chosen the way of truth ⁕
verses.vh2: and your judgements have I laid before me.

verses.vh1: I hold fast to your testimonies; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, let me not be put to shame.

verses.vh1: I will run the way of your commandments, ⁕
verses.vh2: when you have set my heart at liberty.

refrain: My delight shall be in your commandments.

verses.vh1: Teach me, O God, the way of your statutes ⁕
verses.vh2: and I shall keep it to the end.

verses.vh1: Give me understanding and I shall keep your law; ⁕
verses.vh2: I shall keep it with my whole heart.

verses.vh1: Lead me in the path of your commandments, ⁕
verses.vh2: for therein is my delight.

verses.vh1: Incline my heart to your testimonies ⁕
verses.vh2: and not to unjust gain.

verses.vh1: Turn away my eyes lest they gaze on vanities; ⁕
verses.vh2: O give me life in your ways.

verses.vh1: Confirm to your servant your promise, ⁕
verses.vh2: which stands for all who fear you.

verses.vh1: Turn away the reproach which I dread, ⁕
verses.vh2: because your judgements are good.

verses.vh1: Behold, I long for your commandments; ⁕
verses.vh2: in your righteousness give me life.

verses.vh1: Let your faithful love come unto me, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: even your salvation, according to your promise.

verses.vh1: Then shall I answer those who taunt me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for my trust is in your word.

verses.vh1: O take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, ⁕
verses.vh2: for my hope is in your judgements.

verses.vh1: So shall I always keep your law; ⁕
verses.vh2: I shall keep it for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: I will walk at liberty, ⁕
verses.vh2: because I study your commandments.

verses.vh1: I will tell of your testimonies, even before rulers, ⁕
verses.vh2: and will not be ashamed.

verses.vh1: My delight shall be in your commandments, ⁕
verses.vh2: which I have greatly loved.

vh1: My hands will I lift up to your commandments,
which I love, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will meditate on your statutes.

verses.vh1: Remember your word to your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: on which you have built my hope.

verses.vh1: This is my comfort in my trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: that your promise gives me life.

verses.vh1: The proud have derided me cruelly, ⁕
verses.vh2: but I have not turned aside from your law.

verses.vh1: I have remembered your everlasting judgements, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and have been comforted.

verses.vh1: I am seized with indignation at the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they have forsaken your law.

verses.vh1: Your statutes have been like songs to me ⁕
verses.vh2: in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.vh1: I have thought on your name in the night, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and so have I kept your law.

verses.vh1: These blessings have been mine, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I have kept your commandments.

refrain: I know, O God, that your judgements are right.

verses.vh1: You only are my portion, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have promised to keep your words.

verses.vh1: I entreat you with all my heart, ⁕
verses.vh2: be merciful to me according to your promise.

verses.vh1: I have considered my ways ⁕
verses.vh2: and turned my feet back to your testimonies.

verses.vh1: I made haste and did not delay ⁕
verses.vh2: to keep your commandments.

verses.vh1: Though the cords of the wicked entangle me, ⁕
verses.vh2: I do not forget your law.

verses.vh1: At midnight I will rise to give you thanks, ⁕
verses.vh2: because of your righteous judgements.

verses.vh1: I am a companion of all those who fear you, ⁕
verses.vh2: those who keep your commandments.

verses.vh1: The earth, O God, is full of your faithful love; ⁕
verses.vh2: instruct me in your statutes.

verses.vh1: You have dealt graciously with your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: according to your word, O God.

verses.vh1: O teach me true understanding and knowledge, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I have trusted in your commandments.

verses.vh1: Before I was afflicted I went astray, ⁕
verses.vh2: but now I keep your word.

verses.vh1: You are gracious and do good; ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, teach me your statutes.

verses.vh1: The proud have smeared me with lies, ⁕
verses.vh2: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.

verses.vh1: Their heart has become gross with fat, ⁕
verses.vh2: but my delight is in your law.

verses.vh1: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may learn your statutes.

verses.vh1: The law of your mouth is dearer to me ⁕
verses.vh2: than a hoard of gold and silver.

verses.vh1: Your hands have made me and fashioned me; ⁕
verses.vh2: give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

verses.vh1: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me, ⁕
