verses.vh2: because I have hoped in your word.

verses.vh1: I know, O God, that your judgements are right, ⁕
verses.vh2: and that in very faithfulness you caused me to be troubled.

verses.vh1: Let your faithful love be my comfort, ⁕
verses.vh2: according to your promise to your servant.

verses.vh1: Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live, ⁕
verses.vh2: for your law is my delight.

verses.vh1: Let the proud be put to shame, for they wrong me with lies; ⁕
verses.vh2: but I will meditate on your commandments.

verses.vh1: Let those who fear you turn to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: even those who know your testimonies.

verses.vh1: Let my heart be sound in your statutes, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may not be put to shame.

refrain: Give me life, O God, according to your word.

verses.vh1: My soul is pining for your salvation; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have hoped in your word.

verses.vh1: My eyes fail with watching for your word, ⁕
verses.vh2: while I say, ‘O when will you comfort me?’

verses.vh1: I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet I do not forget your statutes.

verses.vh1: How many are the days of your servant? ⁕
verses.vh2: When will you bring judgement on those who persecute me?

verses.vh1: The proud have dug pits for me ⁕
verses.vh2: in defiance of your law.

verses.vh1: All your commandments are true; ⁕
verses.vh2: help me, for they persecute me with falsehood.

verses.vh1: They had almost made an end of me on earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: but I have not forsaken your commandments.

verses.vh1: Give me life according to your loving-kindness; ⁕
verses.vh2: so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth.

verses.vh1: O God, your word is everlasting; ⁕
verses.vh2: it ever stands firm in the heavens.

verses.vh1: Your faithfulness also remains from one generation to another; ⁕
verses.vh2: you have established the earth and it abides.

verses.vh1: So also your judgements stand firm this day, ⁕
verses.vh2: for all things are your servants.

verses.vh1: If your law had not been my delight, ⁕
verses.vh2: I should have perished in my trouble.

verses.vh1: I will never forget your commandments, ⁕
verses.vh2: for by them you have given me life.

verses.vh1: I am yours, O save me! ⁕
verses.vh2: For I have sought your commandments.

verses.vh1: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me, ⁕
verses.vh2: but I will meditate on your testimonies.

verses.vh1: I have seen an end of all perfection, ⁕
verses.vh2: but your commandment knows no bounds.

verses.vh1: God, how I love your law! ⁕
verses.vh2: All the day long it is my study.

verses.vh1: Your commandments have made me wiser than my enemies, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they are ever with me.

verses.vh1: I have more understanding than all my teachers, ⁕
verses.vh2: for your testimonies are my meditation.

verses.vh1: I am wiser than the aged, ⁕
verses.vh2: because I keep your commandments.

verses.vh1: I restrain my feet from every evil way, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may keep your word.

verses.vh1: I have not turned aside from your judgements, ⁕
verses.vh2: for you have been my teacher.

verses.vh1: How sweet are your words on my tongue! ⁕
verses.vh2: They are sweeter than honey to my mouth.

verses.vh1: Through your commandments I get understanding; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore I hate all lying ways.

refrain: O deal with your servant according to your faithful love.

verses.vh1: Your word is a lantern to my feet ⁕
verses.vh2: and a light upon my path.

verses.vh1: I have sworn and will fulfil it, ⁕
verses.vh2: to keep your righteous judgements.

verses.vh1: I am troubled above measure; ⁕
verses.vh2: give me life, O God, according to your word.

verses.vh1: Accept the freewill offering of my mouth, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and teach me your judgements.

verses.vh1: My soul is ever in my hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet I do not forget your law.

verses.vh1: The wicked have laid a snare for me, ⁕
verses.vh2: but I have not strayed from your commandments.

verses.vh1: Your testimonies have I claimed as my heritage for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: for they are the very joy of my heart.

verses.vh1: I have applied my heart to fulfil your statutes: ⁕
verses.vh2: always, even to the end.

verses.vh1: I hate those who are double-minded, ⁕
verses.vh2: but your law do I love.

verses.vh1: You are my hiding place and my shield ⁕
verses.vh2: and my hope is in your word.

verses.vh1: Away from me, you wicked! ⁕
verses.vh2: I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.vh1: Sustain me according to your promise, that I may live, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.

verses.vh1: Hold me up and I shall be saved, ⁕
verses.vh2: and my delight shall be ever in your statutes.

verses.vh1: You set at nought those who depart from your statutes, ⁕
verses.vh2: for their deceiving is in vain.

verses.vh1: You consider all the wicked as dross; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore I love your testimonies.

verses.vh1: My flesh trembles for fear of you ⁕
verses.vh2: and I am afraid of your judgements.

verses.vh1: I have done what is just and right; ⁕
verses.vh2: O give me not over to my oppressors.

verses.vh1: Stand surety for your servant’s good; ⁕
verses.vh2: let not the proud oppress me.

verses.vh1: My eyes fail with watching for your salvation ⁕
verses.vh2: and for your righteous promise.

verses.vh1: O deal with your servant according to your faithful love ⁕
verses.vh2: and teach me your statutes.

verses.vh1: I am your servant; O grant me understanding, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may know your testimonies.

verses.vh1: It is time for you to act, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they frustrate your law.

verses.vh1: Therefore I love your commandments ⁕
verses.vh2: above gold, even much fine gold.

verses.vh1: Therefore I direct my steps by all your precepts, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all false ways I utterly abhor.

refrain: The opening of your word gives light.

verses.vh1: Your testimonies are wonderful; ⁕
verses.vh2: therefore my soul keeps them.

verses.vh1: The opening of your word gives light; ⁕
verses.vh2: it gives understanding to the simple.

verses.vh1: I open my mouth and draw in my breath, ⁕
verses.vh2: as I long for your commandments.

verses.vh1: Turn to me and be gracious to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: as is your way with those who love your name.

verses.vh1: Order my steps by your word, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let no wickedness have dominion over me.

verses.vh1: Redeem me from earthly oppressors ⁕
verses.vh2: so that I may keep your commandments.

verses.vh1: Show the light of your countenance upon your servant ⁕
verses.vh2: and teach me your statutes.

verses.vh1: My eyes run down with streams of water, ⁕
verses.vh2: because the wicked do not keep your law.

verses.vh1: Righteous are you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and true are your judgements.

verses.vh1: You have ordered your decrees in righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and in great faithfulness.

verses.vh1: My indignation destroys me, ⁕
verses.vh2: because my adversaries forget your word.

verses.vh1: Your word has been tried to the uttermost ⁕
verses.vh2: and so your servant loves it.

verses.vh1: I am small and of no reputation, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet do I not forget your commandments.

verses.vh1: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and your law is the truth.

verses.vh1: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet my delight is in your commandments.

verses.vh1: The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting; ⁕
verses.vh2: O grant me understanding and I shall live.

verses.vh1: I call with my whole heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: answer me, O God, that I may keep your statutes.

verses.vh1: To you I call, O save me! ⁕
verses.vh2: And I shall keep your testimonies.

verses.vh1: Early in the morning I cry to you, ⁕
verses.vh2: for in your word is my trust.

verses.vh1: My eyes are open before the night watches, ⁕
verses.vh2: that I may meditate on your word.

verses.vh1: Hear my voice, O God, according to your faithful love; ⁕
verses.vh2: according to your judgement, give me life.

verses.vh1: They draw near that in malice persecute me, ⁕
verses.vh2: who are far from your law.

verses.vh1: You, O God, are near at hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all your commandments are true.

verses.vh1: Long have I known of your testimonies, ⁕
verses.vh2: that you have founded them for ever.

refrain: I have longed for your salvation, O God.

verses.vh1: O consider my affliction and deliver me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I do not forget your law.

verses.vh1: Plead my cause and redeem me; ⁕
verses.vh2: according to your promise, give me life.

verses.vh1: Salvation is far from the wicked, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they do not seek your statutes.

verses.vh1: Great is your compassion, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: give me life, according to your judgements.

verses.vh1: Many there are that persecute and oppress me, ⁕
verses.vh2: yet do I not swerve from your testimonies.

verses.vh1: It grieves me when I see the treacherous, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they do not keep your word.

verses.vh1: Consider, O God, how I love your commandments; ⁕
verses.vh2: give me life according to your loving-kindness.

verses.vh1: The sum of your word is truth, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all your righteous judgements endure for evermore.

verses.vh1: Princes have persecuted me without a cause, ⁕
verses.vh2: but my heart stands in awe of your word.

verses.vh1: I am as glad of your word ⁕
verses.vh2: as one who finds great spoils.

verses.vh1: As for lies, I hate and abhor them, ⁕
verses.vh2: but your law do I love.

verses.vh1: Seven times a day do I praise you, ⁕
verses.vh2: because of your righteous judgements.

verses.vh1: Great peace have they who love your law; ⁕
verses.vh2: nothing shall make them stumble.

verses.vh1: God, I have looked for your salvation ⁕
verses.vh2: and I have fulfilled your commandments.

verses.vh1: My soul has kept your testimonies ⁕
verses.vh2: and greatly have I loved them.

verses.vh1: I have kept your commandments and testimonies, ⁕
verses.vh2: for all my ways are before you.

verses.vh1: Let my cry come before you, O God; ⁕
verses.vh2: give me understanding, according to your word.

verses.vh1: Let my supplication come before you; ⁕
verses.vh2: deliver me, according to your promise.

verses.vh1: My lips shall pour forth your praise, ⁕
verses.vh2: when you have taught me your statutes.

verses.vh1: My tongue shall sing of your word, ⁕
verses.vh2: for all your commandments are righteous.

verses.vh1: Let your hand reach out to help me, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I have chosen your commandments.

verses.vh1: I have longed for your salvation, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your law is my delight.

verses.vh1: Let my soul live and it shall praise you, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let your judgements be my help.

verses.vh1: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost; ⁕
verses.vh2: O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

verses.vh1: When I was in trouble I called to God; ⁕
verses.vh2: I called to God and God answered me.

verses.vh1: Deliver me, O God, from lying lips ⁕
verses.vh2: and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.vh1: What shall be given to you? ⁕
verses.vh2: What more shall be done to you, deceitful tongue?

verses.vh1: The sharp arrows of a warrior, ⁕
verses.vh2: tempered in burning coals!

verses.vh1: Woe is me, that I must lodge in Meshech ⁕
verses.vh2: and dwell among the tents of Kedar.

verses.vh1: My soul has dwelt too long ⁕
verses.vh2: with enemies of peace.

verses.vh1: I am for making peace, ⁕
verses.vh2: but when I speak of it, they make ready for war.

refrain: Deliver me, O God, from lying lips.

verses.vh1: I lift up my eyes to the hills; ⁕
verses.vh2: from where is my help to come?

verses.vh1: My help comes from God, ⁕
verses.vh2: the maker of heaven and earth.

verses.vh1: God will not suffer your foot to stumble; ⁕
verses.vh2: God who watches over you will not sleep.

verses.vh1: Behold, the one who keeps watch over Israel ⁕
verses.vh2: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.vh1: It is God who watches over you; ⁕
verses.vh2: God is your shade at your right hand,

verses.vh1: So that the sun shall not strike you by day, ⁕
verses.vh2: neither the moon by night.

verses.vh1: God shall keep you from all evil; ⁕
verses.vh2: it is God who shall keep your soul.

vh1: God shall keep watch over your going out
and your coming in, ⁕
verses.vh2: from this time forth for evermore.

refrain: God shall keep you from all evil.

verses.vh1: I was glad when they said to me, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Let us go to the house of God.’

verses.vh1: And now our feet are standing ⁕
verses.vh2: within your gates, O Jerusalem;

verses.vh1: Jerusalem, built as a city ⁕
verses.vh2: that is at unity in itself.

verses.vh1: Thither the tribes go up, the tribes of God, ⁕
vh2: as is decreed for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of God.

verses.vh1: For there are set the thrones of judgement, ⁕
verses.vh2: the thrones of the house of David.

verses.vh1: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘May they prosper who love you.

verses.vh1: ‘Peace be within your walls ⁕
verses.vh2: and tranquillity within your palaces.’

verses.vh1: For my kindred and companions’ sake, ⁕
verses.vh2: I will pray that peace be with you.

verses.vh1: For the sake of the house of God our God, ⁕
verses.vh2: I will seek to do you good.

refrain: How lovely is your dwelling place, O God of hosts.

verses.vh1: To you I lift up my eyes, ⁕
verses.vh2: to you that are enthroned in the heavens.

verses.vh1: As the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, ⁕
verses.vh2: or the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress,

verses.vh1: So our eyes wait upon God our God, ⁕
verses.vh2: until God have mercy upon us.

verses.vh1: Have mercy upon us, O God, have mercy upon us, ⁕
verses.vh2: for we have had more than enough of contempt.

verses.vh1: Our soul has had more than enough of the scorn of the arrogant, ⁕
verses.vh2: and of the contempt of the proud.

refrain: Our eyes wait upon God our God.

verses.vh1: If God had not been on our side, ⁕
verses.vh2: now may Israel say;

verses.vh1: If God had not been on our side, ⁕
verses.vh2: when enemies rose up against us;

verses.vh1: Then would they have swallowed us alive ⁕
verses.vh2: when their anger burned against us;

vh1: Then would the waters have overwhelmed us
and the torrent gone over our soul; ⁕
verses.vh2: over our soul would have swept the raging waters.

verses.vh1: But blessed be God ⁕
verses.vh2: who has not given us over to be a prey for their teeth.

verses.vh1: Our soul has escaped as a bird from the snare of the fowler; ⁕
verses.vh2: the snare is broken and we are delivered.

verses.vh1: Our help is in the name of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: who has made heaven and earth.

refrain: Our help is in the name of God.

verses.vh1: Those who trust in God are like Mount Zion, ⁕
verses.vh2: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.

verses.vh1: As the hills stand about Jerusalem, ⁕
vh2: so God stands round about God’s people,
from this time forth for evermore.

verses.vh1: The sceptre of wickedness shall not hold sway over the land allotted to the righteous, ⁕
verses.vh2: lest the righteous turn their hands to evil.

verses.vh1: Do good, O God, to those who are good, ⁕
verses.vh2: and to those who are true of heart.

verses.vh1: Those who turn aside to crooked ways God shall take away with the evildoers; ⁕
verses.vh2: but let there be peace upon Israel.

refrain: Glorious things are spoken of you,
Zion, city of our God.

verses.vh1: When God restored the fortunes of Zion, ⁕
verses.vh2: then were we like those who dream.

verses.vh1: Then was our mouth filled with laughter ⁕
verses.vh2: and our tongue with songs of joy.

verses.vh1: Then said they among the nations, ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘God has done great things for them.’

verses.vh1: God has indeed done great things for us, ⁕
verses.vh2: and therefore we rejoiced.

verses.vh1: Restore again our fortunes, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: as the river beds of the desert.

verses.vh1: Those who sow in tears ⁕
verses.vh2: shall reap with songs of joy.

verses.vh1: Those who go out weeping, bearing the seed, ⁕
vh2: will come back with shouts of joy,
bearing their sheaves with them.

refrain: God has indeed done great things for us.

verses.vh1: Unless God builds the house, ⁕
verses.vh2: those who build it labour in vain.

verses.vh1: Unless God keeps the city, ⁕
verses.vh2: the guard keeps watch in vain.

vh1: It is in vain that you hasten to rise up early
and go so late to rest, eating the bread of toil, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s beloved are given sleep.

verses.vh1: Children are a heritage from God ⁕
verses.vh2: and the fruit of the womb is God’s gift.

verses.vh1: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, ⁕
verses.vh2: so are the children of one’s youth.

verses.vh1: Happy are those who have their quiver full of them: ⁕
verses.vh2: they shall not be put to shame when they dispute with their enemies in the gate.

refrain: God shall keep watch over your going out
and your coming in.

verses.vh1: Blessed are all those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and walk in God’s ways.

verses.vh1: You shall eat the fruit of the toil of your hands; ⁕
verses.vh2: it shall go well with you, and happy shall you be.

verses.vh1: Your wife within your house shall be like a fruitful vine; ⁕
vh2: your children round your table,
like fresh olive branches.

verses.vh1: Thus shall the one be blest ⁕
verses.vh2: who fears God.

verses.vh1: God from out of Zion bless you, ⁕
verses.vh2: that you may see Jerusalem in prosperity all the days of your life.

verses.vh1: May you see your children’s children, ⁕
verses.vh2: and may there be peace upon Israel.

refrain: How abundant is your goodness, O God.

verses.vh1: ‘Many a time have they fought against me from my youth,’ ⁕
verses.vh2: may Israel now say;

verses.vh1: ‘Many a time have they fought against me from my youth, ⁕
verses.vh2: but they have not prevailed against me.’

verses.vh1: The ploughers ploughed upon my back ⁕
verses.vh2: and made their furrows long.

verses.vh1: But the righteous God ⁕
verses.vh2: has cut the cords of the wicked in pieces.

verses.vh1: Let them be put to shame and turned backwards, ⁕
verses.vh2: as many as are enemies of Zion.

verses.vh1: Let them be like grass upon the housetops, ⁕
verses.vh2: which withers before it can grow,

verses.vh1: So that no reaper can fill his hand, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor a binder of sheaves his bosom;

vh1: And none who go by may say,
‘The blessing of God be upon you. ⁕
verses.vh2: We bless you in the name of God.’

refrain: God ransoms the life of God’s servants.

vh1: Out of the depths have I cried to you, O God;
God, hear my voice; ⁕
verses.vh2: let your ears consider well the voice of my supplication.

verses.vh1: If you, God, were to mark what is done amiss, ⁕
verses.vh2: O God, who could stand?

verses.vh1: But there is forgiveness with you, ⁕
verses.vh2: so that you shall be feared.

verses.vh1: I wait for God; my soul waits for God; ⁕
verses.vh2: in God’s word is my hope.

vh1: My soul waits for God,
more than the night watch for the morning, ⁕
verses.vh2: more than the night watch for the morning.

verses.vh1: O Israel, wait for God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for with God there is mercy;

verses.vh1: With God is plenteous redemption ⁕
verses.vh2: and God shall redeem Israel from all their sins.

refrain: My soul waits for God.

verses.vh1: O God, my heart is not proud; ⁕
verses.vh2: my eyes are not raised in haughty looks.

verses.vh1: I do not occupy myself with great matters, ⁕
verses.vh2: with things that are too high for me.

vh1: But I have quieted and stilled my soul,
like a weaned child on its mother’s breast; ⁕
verses.vh2: so my soul is quieted within me.

verses.vh1: O Israel, trust in God, ⁕
verses.vh2: from this time forth for evermore.

refrain: O Israel, trust in God.

verses.vh1: God, remember for David ⁕
verses.vh2: all the hardships God endured;

verses.vh1: How he swore an oath to God ⁕
verses.vh2: and vowed a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:

verses.vh1: ‘I will not come within the shelter of my house, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor climb up into my bed;

verses.vh1: ‘I will not allow my eyes to sleep, ⁕
verses.vh2: nor let my eyelids slumber,

verses.vh1: ‘Until I find a place for God, ⁕
verses.vh2: a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.’

verses.vh1: Now, we heard of the ark in Ephrathah ⁕
verses.vh2: and found it in the fields of Ja-ar.

verses.vh1: Let us enter God’s dwelling place ⁕
verses.vh2: and fall low before God’s footstool.

verses.vh1: Arise, O God, into your resting place, ⁕
verses.vh2: you and the ark of your strength.

verses.vh1: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithful ones sing with joy.

verses.vh1: For your servant David’s sake, ⁕
verses.vh2: turn not away the face of your anointed.

verses.vh1: God has sworn an oath to David, ⁕
verses.vh2: a promise from which God will not shrink:

verses.vh1: ‘Of the fruit of your body ⁕
verses.vh2: shall I set upon your throne.

vh1: ‘If your children keep my covenant
and my testimonies that I shall teach them, ⁕
verses.vh2: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.’

verses.vh1: For God has chosen Zion; ⁕
verses.vh2: God has desired Zion for a habitation:

verses.vh1: ‘This shall be my resting place for ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: here will I dwell, for I have longed for Zion.

verses.vh1: ‘I will abundantly bless Zion’s provision; ⁕
verses.vh2: Zion’s poor will I satisfy with bread.

verses.vh1: ‘I will clothe Zion’s priests with salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: and Zion’s faithful ones shall rejoice and sing.

verses.vh1: ‘There will I make a horn to spring up for David; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will keep a lantern burning for my anointed.

verses.vh1: ‘As for his enemies, I will clothe them with shame; ⁕
verses.vh2: but on him shall his crown be bright.’

refrain: Arise, O God, into your resting place.

verses.vh1: Behold how good and pleasant it is ⁕
verses.vh2: to dwell together in unity.

verses.vh1: It is like the precious oil upon the head, ⁕
verses.vh2: running down upon the beard,

verses.vh1: Even on Aaron’s beard, ⁕
verses.vh2: running down upon the collar of his clothing.

verses.vh1: It is like the dew of Hermon ⁕
verses.vh2: running down upon the hills of Zion.

verses.vh1: For there God has promised God’s blessing: ⁕
verses.vh2: even life for evermore.

refrain: Mercy and truth are met together,
righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.vh1: Come, bless God, all you servants of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: you that by night stand in the house of God.

verses.vh1: Lift up your hands towards the sanctuary ⁕
verses.vh2: and bless God.

verses.vh1: God who made heaven and earth ⁕
verses.vh2: give you blessing out of Zion.

refrain: Bless God, O my soul.

vh1: Alleluia.
Praise the name of God; ⁕
verses.vh2: give praise, you servants of God,

verses.vh1: You that stand in the house of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.vh1: Praise God, for God is good; ⁕
verses.vh2: make music to God’s name, for it is lovely.

verses.vh1: For God has chosen Jacob ⁕
verses.vh2: and Israel for God’s own possession.

verses.vh1: For I know that God is great ⁕
verses.vh2: and that our God is above all gods.

vh1: God does whatever God pleases
in heaven and on earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: in the seas and in all the deeps.

verses.vh1: God brings up the clouds from the ends of the earth; ⁕
vh2: God makes lightning with the rain
and brings the winds out of God’s treasuries.

verses.vh1: God smote the firstborn of Egypt, ⁕
verses.vh2: the firstborn of human and beast.

verses.vh1: God sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, ⁕
verses.vh2: upon Pharaoh and all his servants.

verses.vh1: God smote many nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and slew mighty rulers:

vh1: Sihon, king of the Amorites,
and Og, the king of Bashan, ⁕
verses.vh2: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

verses.vh1: God gave their land as a heritage, ⁕
verses.vh2: a heritage for Israel God’s people.

verses.vh1: Your name, O God, endures for ever ⁕
verses.vh2: and shall be remembered through all generations.

verses.vh1: For God will vindicate God’s people ⁕
verses.vh2: and have compassion on God’s servants.

verses.vh1: The idols of the nations are but silver and gold, ⁕
verses.vh2: the work of human hands.

verses.vh1: They have mouths, but cannot speak; ⁕
verses.vh2: eyes have they, but cannot see;

verses.vh1: They have ears, but cannot hear; ⁕
verses.vh2: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.vh1: Those who make them shall become like them, ⁕
verses.vh2: and so will all who put their trust in them.

verses.vh1: Bless God, O house of Israel; ⁕
verses.vh2: O house of Aaron, bless God.

verses.vh1: Bless God, O house of Levi; ⁕
verses.vh2: you who fear God, bless God.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God from Zion, ⁕
vh2: who dwells in Jerusalem.
Alleluia.

refrain: Praise God, for God is good.

verses.vh1: Give thanks to God, for God is gracious, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Give thanks to the God of gods, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Give thanks to the Ruler of rulers, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who alone does great wonders, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who by wisdom made the heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who laid out the earth upon the waters, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who made the great lights, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: The sun to rule the day, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: The moon and the stars to govern the night, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And brought out Israel from among them, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: With a mighty hand and outstretched arm, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who divided the Red Sea in two, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: But Pharaoh and his host God overthrew in the Red Sea, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who led God’s people through the wilderness, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who smote great rulers, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And slew mighty rulers, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Sihon, king of the Amorites, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And Og, the king of Bashan, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And gave away their land for a heritage, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: A heritage for Israel God’s servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who remembered us when we were in trouble, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: And delivered us from our enemies, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever;

verses.vh1: Who gives food to all creatures, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever.

verses.vh1: Give thanks to the God of heaven, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God’s mercy endures for ever.

verses.vh1: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept, ⁕
verses.vh2: when we remembered Zion.

verses.vh1: As for our lyres, we hung them up ⁕
verses.vh2: on the willows that grow in that land.

vh1: For there our captors asked for a song,
our tormentors called for mirth: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘Sing us one of the songs of Zion.’

verses.vh1: How shall we sing God’s song ⁕
verses.vh2: in a strange land?

verses.vh1: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, ⁕
verses.vh2: let my right hand forget its skill.

verses.vh1: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, ⁕
verses.vh2: if I set not Jerusalem above my highest joy.

vh1: Remember, O God, against the people of Edom
the day of Jerusalem, ⁕
vh2: how they said, ‘Down with it, down with it,
even to the ground.’

verses.vh1: O children of Babylon, doomed to destruction, ⁕
verses.vh2: happy the one who repays you for all you have done to us;

verses.vh1: Who takes your little ones, ⁕
verses.vh2: and dashes them against the rock.

refrain: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem.

verses.vh1: I will give thanks to you, O God, with my whole heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: before the gods will I sing praise to you.

vh1: I will bow down towards your holy temple and praise your name,
because of your love and faithfulness; ⁕
vh2: for you have glorified your name
and your word above all things.

verses.vh1: In the day that I called to you, you answered me; ⁕
verses.vh2: you put new strength in my soul.

verses.vh1: All the rulers of the earth shall praise you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for they have heard the words of your mouth.

verses.vh1: They shall sing of the ways of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that great is the glory of God.

verses.vh1: God is high, but watches over the lowly; ⁕
verses.vh2: as for the proud, God regards them from afar.

vh1: Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
you will preserve me; ⁕
vh2: you will stretch forth your hand against the fury of my enemies;
your right hand will save me.

verses.vh1: God shall make good God’s purpose for me; ⁕
vh2: your loving-kindness, O God, endures for ever;
forsake not the work of your hands.

refrain: Your loving-kindness, O God, endures for ever.

verses.vh1: O God, you have searched me out and known me; ⁕
vh2: you know my sitting down and my rising up;
you discern my thoughts from afar.

verses.vh1: You mark out my journeys and my resting place ⁕
verses.vh2: and are acquainted with all my ways.

verses.vh1: For there is not a word on my tongue, ⁕
verses.vh2: but you, O God, know it altogether.

verses.vh1: You encompass me behind and before ⁕
verses.vh2: and lay your hand upon me.

verses.vh1: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, ⁕
verses.vh2: so high that I cannot attain it.

verses.vh1: Where can I go then from your spirit? ⁕
verses.vh2: Or where can I flee from your presence?

verses.vh1: If I climb up to heaven, you are there; ⁕
verses.vh2: if I make the grave my bed, you are there also.

verses.vh1: If I take the wings of the morning ⁕
verses.vh2: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

verses.vh1: Even there your hand shall lead me, ⁕
verses.vh2: your right hand hold me fast.

verses.vh1: If I say, ‘Surely the darkness will cover me ⁕
verses.vh2: and the light around me turn to night,’

vh1: Even darkness is no darkness with you;
the night is as clear as the day; ⁕
verses.vh2: darkness and light to you are both alike.

verses.vh1: For you yourself created my inmost parts; ⁕
verses.vh2: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

verses.vh1: I thank you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; ⁕
verses.vh2: marvellous are your works, my soul knows well.

verses.vh1: My frame was not hidden from you, ⁕
vh2: when I was made in secret
and woven in the depths of the earth.

verses.vh1: Your eyes beheld my form, as yet unfinished; ⁕
verses.vh2: already in your book were all my members written,

verses.vh1: As day by day they were fashioned ⁕
verses.vh2: when as yet there was none of them.

verses.vh1: How deep are your counsels to me, O God! ⁕
verses.vh2: How great is the sum of them!

verses.vh1: If I count them, they are more in number than the sand, ⁕
verses.vh2: and at the end, I am still in your presence.

verses.vh1: O that you would slay the wicked, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: that the bloodthirsty might depart from me!

verses.vh1: They speak against you with wicked intent; ⁕
verses.vh2: your enemies take up your name for evil.

verses.vh1: Do I not oppose those, O God, who oppose you? ⁕
verses.vh2: Do I not abhor those who rise up against you?

verses.vh1: I hate them with a perfect hatred; ⁕
verses.vh2: they have become my own enemies also.

verses.vh1: Search me out, O God, and know my heart; ⁕
verses.vh2: try me and examine my thoughts.

verses.vh1: See if there is any way of wickedness in me ⁕
verses.vh2: and lead me in the way everlasting.

refrain: Search me out, O God, and know my heart.

verses.vh1: Deliver me, O God, from evildoers ⁕
verses.vh2: and protect me from the violent,

verses.vh1: Who devise evil in their hearts ⁕
verses.vh2: and stir up strife all the day long.

verses.vh1: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; ⁕
verses.vh2: adder’s poison is under their lips.

verses.vh1: Keep me, O God, from the hands of the wicked; ⁕
verses.vh2: protect me from the violent who seek to make me stumble.

vh1: The proud have laid a snare for me
and spread out a net of cords; ⁕
verses.vh2: they have set traps along my path.

verses.vh1: I have said to God, ‘You are my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: listen, O God, to the voice of my supplication.

verses.vh1: ‘O God God, the strength of my salvation, ⁕
verses.vh2: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

verses.vh1: ‘Do not grant the desires of the wicked, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: do not prosper their wicked plans.

verses.vh1: ‘Let not those who surround me lift up their heads; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the evil of their own lips fall upon them.

verses.vh1: ‘Let hot burning coals rain upon them; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them be cast into the depths, that they rise not again.’

verses.vh1: No slanderer shall prosper on the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: and evil shall hunt down the violent to overthrow them.

verses.vh1: I know that God will bring justice for the oppressed ⁕
verses.vh2: and maintain the cause of the needy.

verses.vh1: Surely, the righteous will give thanks to your name, ⁕
verses.vh2: and the upright shall dwell in your presence.

refrain: Keep me, O God, from the hands of the wicked.

verses.vh1: O God, I call to you; come to me quickly; ⁕
verses.vh2: hear my voice when I cry to you.

verses.vh1: Let my prayer rise before you as incense, ⁕
verses.vh2: the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

verses.vh1: Set a watch before my mouth, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and guard the door of my lips;

verses.vh1: Let not my heart incline to any evil thing; ⁕
vh2: let me not be occupied in wickedness with evildoers,
nor taste the pleasures of their table.

vh1: Let the righteous smite me in friendly rebuke;
but let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head; ⁕
verses.vh2: for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.

verses.vh1: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places; ⁕
verses.vh2: then they may know that my words are sweet.

verses.vh1: As when a plough turns over the earth in furrows, ⁕
verses.vh2: let their bones be scattered at the mouth of the Pit.

verses.vh1: But my eyes are turned to you, God God; ⁕
verses.vh2: in you I take refuge; do not leave me defenceless.

verses.vh1: Protect me from the snare which they have laid for me ⁕
verses.vh2: and from the traps of the evildoers.

verses.vh1: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, ⁕
verses.vh2: while I pass by in safety.

refrain: Set a watch before my mouth, O God.

verses.vh1: I cry aloud to God; ⁕
verses.vh2: to God I make my supplication.

verses.vh1: I pour out my complaint before God ⁕
verses.vh2: and tell God of my trouble.

verses.vh1: When my spirit faints within me, you know my path; ⁕
verses.vh2: in the way wherein I walk have they laid a snare for me.

verses.vh1: I look to my right hand, and find no one who knows me; ⁕
verses.vh2: I have no place to flee to, and no one cares for my soul.

verses.vh1: I cry out to you, O God, and say: ⁕
verses.vh2: ‘You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

verses.vh1: ‘Listen to my cry, for I am brought very low; ⁕
verses.vh2: save me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

vh1: ‘Bring my soul out of prison,
that I may give thanks to your name; ⁕
vh2: when you have dealt bountifully with me,
then shall the righteous gather around me.’

refrain: Bring my soul out of prison,
that I may give thanks to your name.

vh1: Hear my prayer, O God,
and in your faithfulness give ear to my supplications; ⁕
verses.vh2: answer me in your righteousness.

verses.vh1: Enter not into judgement with your servant, ⁕
verses.vh2: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.

vh1: For the enemy has pursued me,
crushing my life to the ground, ⁕
verses.vh2: making me sit in darkness like those long dead.

verses.vh1: My spirit faints within me; ⁕
verses.vh2: my heart within me is desolate.

verses.vh1: I remember the time past; I muse upon all your deeds; ⁕
verses.vh2: I consider the works of your hands.

verses.vh1: I stretch out my hands to you; ⁕
verses.vh2: my soul gasps for you like a thirsty land.

verses.vh1: O God, make haste to answer me; my spirit fails me; ⁕
vh2: hide not your face from me
lest I be like those who go down to the Pit.

vh1: Let me hear of your loving-kindness in the morning,
for in you I put my trust; ⁕
vh2: show me the way I should walk in,
for I lift up my soul to you.

verses.vh1: Deliver me, O God, from my enemies, ⁕
verses.vh2: for I flee to you for refuge.

verses.vh1: Teach me to do what pleases you, for you are my God; ⁕
verses.vh2: let your kindly spirit lead me on a level path.

verses.vh1: Revive me, O God, for your name’s sake; ⁕
verses.vh2: for your righteousness’ sake, bring me out of trouble.

vh1: In your faithfulness, slay my enemies,
and destroy all the adversaries of my soul, ⁕
verses.vh2: for truly I am your servant.

refrain: Show me, O God, the way that I should walk in.

verses.vh1: Blessed be God my rock, ⁕
verses.vh2: who teaches my hands for war and my fingers for battle;

vh1: My steadfast help and my fortress,
my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield in whom I trust, ⁕
verses.vh2: who subdues the peoples under me.

verses.vh1: O God, what are mortals that you should consider them; ⁕
verses.vh2: mere human beings, that you should take thought for them?

verses.vh1: They are like a breath of wind; ⁕
verses.vh2: their days pass away like a shadow.

verses.vh1: Bow your heavens, O God, and come down; ⁕
verses.vh2: touch the mountains and they shall smoke.

verses.vh1: Cast down your lightnings and scatter them; ⁕
verses.vh2: shoot out your arrows and let thunder roar.

verses.vh1: Reach down your hand from on high; ⁕
vh2: deliver me and take me out of the great waters,
from the hand of foreign enemies,

verses.vh1: Whose mouth speaks wickedness ⁕
verses.vh2: and their right hand is the hand of falsehood.

verses.vh1: O God, I will sing to you a new song; ⁕
verses.vh2: I will play to you on a ten-stringed harp,

verses.vh1: You that give salvation to rulers ⁕
verses.vh2: and have delivered David your servant.

verses.vh1: Save me from the peril of the sword ⁕
verses.vh2: and deliver me from the hand of foreign enemies,

verses.vh1: Whose mouth speaks wickedness ⁕
verses.vh2: and whose right hand is the hand of falsehood;

verses.vh1: So that our descendants may be like well-nurtured plants, ⁕
verses.vh2: our children like pillars carved for the corners of the temple;

verses.vh1: Our barns be filled with all manner of store; ⁕
vh2: our flocks bearing thousands,
and ten thousands in our fields;

verses.vh1: Our cattle be heavy with young: ⁕
vh2: may there be no miscarriage or untimely birth,
no cry of distress in our streets.

verses.vh1: Happy are the people whose blessing this is. ⁕
verses.vh2: Happy are the people who have God for their God.

refrain: Happy are the people who have God for their God.

verses.vh1: I will exalt you, O God my Sovereign, ⁕
verses.vh2: and bless your name for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: Every day will I bless you ⁕
verses.vh2: and praise your name for ever and ever.

verses.vh1: Great is God and highly to be praised; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s greatness is beyond all searching out.

verses.vh1: One generation shall praise your works to another ⁕
verses.vh2: and declare your mighty acts.

verses.vh1: They shall speak of the majesty of your glory, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.

verses.vh1: They shall speak of the might of your marvellous acts, ⁕
verses.vh2: and I will also tell of your greatness.

verses.vh1: They shall pour forth the story of your abundant kindness ⁕
verses.vh2: and joyfully sing of your righteousness.

verses.vh1: God is gracious and merciful, ⁕
verses.vh2: long-suffering and of great goodness.

verses.vh1: God is loving to everyone ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s mercy is over all God’s creatures.

verses.vh1: All your works praise you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and your faithful servants bless you.

verses.vh1: They tell of the glory of your kingdom ⁕
verses.vh2: and speak of your mighty power,

verses.vh1: To make known to all peoples your mighty acts ⁕
verses.vh2: and the glorious splendour of your kingdom.

verses.vh1: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom; ⁕
verses.vh2: your dominion endures throughout all ages.

verses.vh1: God is sure in all God’s words ⁕
verses.vh2: and faithful in all God’s deeds.

verses.vh1: God upholds all those who fall ⁕
verses.vh2: and lifts up all those who are bowed down.

verses.vh1: The eyes of all wait upon you, O God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and you give them their food in due season.

verses.vh1: You open wide your hand ⁕
verses.vh2: and fill all things living with plenty.

verses.vh1: God is righteous in all God’s ways ⁕
verses.vh2: and loving in all God’s works.

verses.vh1: God is near to those who call upon God, ⁕
verses.vh2: to all who call upon God faithfully.

verses.vh1: God fulfils the desire of those who fear God; ⁕
verses.vh2: God hears their cry and saves them.

verses.vh1: God watches over those who love God, ⁕
verses.vh2: but all the wicked shall God destroy.

verses.vh1: My mouth shall speak the praise of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: and let all flesh bless God’s holy name for ever and ever.

refrain: Great is God and highly to be praised.

vh1: Alleluia.
Praise God, O my soul:
while I live will I praise God; ⁕
vh2: as long as I have any being,
I will sing praises to my God.

vh1: Put not your trust in princes,
nor in any human power, ⁕
verses.vh2: for there is no help in them.

verses.vh1: When their breath goes forth, they return to the earth; ⁕
verses.vh2: on that day all their thoughts perish.

verses.vh1: Happy are those who have the God of Jacob for their help, ⁕
verses.vh2: whose hope is in God their God;

vh1: Who made heaven and earth,
the sea and all that is in them; ⁕
verses.vh2: who keeps God’s promise for ever;

verses.vh1: Who gives justice to those that suffer wrong ⁕
verses.vh2: and bread to those who hunger.

verses.vh1: God looses those that are bound; ⁕
verses.vh2: God opens the eyes of the blind;

verses.vh1: God lifts up those who are bowed down; ⁕
verses.vh2: God loves the righteous;

vh1: God watches over the stranger in the land;
God upholds the orphan and widow; ⁕
verses.vh2: but the way of the wicked God turns upside down.

verses.vh1: God shall reign for ever, ⁕
vh2: your God, O Zion, throughout all generations.
Alleluia.

refrain: God shall reign for ever.

vh1: Alleluia.
How good it is to make music for our God, ⁕
verses.vh2: how joyful to honour God with praise.

verses.vh1: God builds up Jerusalem ⁕
verses.vh2: and gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

verses.vh1: God heals the brokenhearted ⁕
verses.vh2: and binds up all their wounds.

verses.vh1: God counts the number of the stars ⁕
verses.vh2: and calls them all by their names.

verses.vh1: Great is our God and mighty in power; ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s wisdom is beyond all telling.

verses.vh1: God lifts up the poor, ⁕
verses.vh2: but casts down the wicked to the ground.

verses.vh1: Sing to God with thanksgiving; ⁕
verses.vh2: make music to our God upon the lyre;

verses.vh1: Who covers the heavens with clouds ⁕
verses.vh2: and prepares rain for the earth;

verses.vh1: Who makes grass to grow upon the mountains ⁕
verses.vh2: and green plants to serve our needs.

verses.vh1: God gives the beasts their food ⁕
verses.vh2: and the young ravens when they cry.

verses.vh1: God takes no pleasure in the power of a horse, ⁕
verses.vh2: no delight in human strength;

verses.vh1: But God delights in those who fear God, ⁕
verses.vh2: who put their trust in God’s steadfast love.

verses.vh1: Sing praise to God, O Jerusalem; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise your God, O Zion;

verses.vh1: For God has strengthened the bars of your gates ⁕
verses.vh2: and has blest your children within you.

verses.vh1: God has established peace in your borders ⁕
verses.vh2: and satisfies you with the finest wheat.

verses.vh1: God sends forth God’s command to the earth ⁕
verses.vh2: and God’s word runs very swiftly.

verses.vh1: God gives snow like wool ⁕
verses.vh2: and scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.

verses.vh1: God casts down hailstones like morsels of bread; ⁕
verses.vh2: who can endure God’s frost?

verses.vh1: God sends forth God’s word and melts them; ⁕
verses.vh2: God blows with wind and the waters flow.

verses.vh1: God declares God’s word to Jacob, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s statutes and judgements to Israel.

verses.vh1: God has not dealt so with any other nation; ⁕
vh2: they do not know God’s laws.
Alleluia.

refrain: Great is our God and mighty in power.

vh1: Alleluia.
Praise God from the heavens; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God in the heights.

verses.vh1: Praise God, all you God’s angels; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God, all God’s host.

verses.vh1: Praise God, sun and moon; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God, all you stars of light.

verses.vh1: Praise God, heaven of heavens, ⁕
verses.vh2: and you waters above the heavens.

verses.vh1: Let them praise the name of God, ⁕
verses.vh2: for God commanded and they were created.

verses.vh1: God made them fast for ever and ever; ⁕
verses.vh2: God gave them a law which shall not pass away.

verses.vh1: Praise God from the earth, ⁕
verses.vh2: you sea monsters and all deeps;

verses.vh1: Fire and hail, snow and mist, ⁕
verses.vh2: tempestuous wind, fulfilling God’s word;

verses.vh1: Mountains and all hills, ⁕
verses.vh2: fruit trees and all cedars;

verses.vh1: Wild beasts and all cattle, ⁕
verses.vh2: creeping things and birds on the wing;

verses.vh1: Governors of the earth and all peoples, ⁕
verses.vh2: nobles and all rulers of the world;

vh1: Young people,
old and young together; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them praise the name of God.

verses.vh1: For God’s name only is exalted, ⁕
verses.vh2: God’s splendour above earth and heaven.

vh1: God has raised up the horn of God’s people
and praise for all God’s faithful servants, ⁕
vh2: the children of Israel, a people who are near God.
Alleluia.

refrain: O praise the name of God.

vh1: Alleluia.
O sing to God a new song; ⁕
verses.vh2: sing God’s praise in the congregation of the faithful.

verses.vh1: Let Israel rejoice in their maker; ⁕
verses.vh2: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

verses.vh1: Let them praise God’s name in the dance; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them sing praise to God with timbrel and lyre.

verses.vh1: For God has pleasure in God’s people ⁕
verses.vh2: and adorns the poor with salvation.

verses.vh1: Let the faithful be joyful in glory; ⁕
verses.vh2: let them rejoice in their ranks,

verses.vh1: With the praises of God in their mouths ⁕
verses.vh2: and a two-edged sword in their hands;

verses.vh1: To execute vengeance on the nations ⁕
verses.vh2: and punishment on the peoples;

verses.vh1: To bind their rulers in chains ⁕
verses.vh2: and their nobles with fetters of iron;

verses.vh1: To execute on them the judgement decreed: ⁕
vh2: such honour have all God’s faithful servants.
Alleluia.

refrain: Sound praises to God, all the earth.

vh1: Alleluia.
O praise God in God’s holiness; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God in the firmament of God’s power.

verses.vh1: Praise God for God’s mighty acts; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God according to God’s excellent greatness.

verses.vh1: Praise God with the blast of the trumpet; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God upon the harp and lyre.

verses.vh1: Praise God with timbrel and dances; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God upon the strings and pipe.

verses.vh1: Praise God with ringing cymbals; ⁕
verses.vh2: praise God upon the clashing cymbals.

verses.vh1: Let everything that has breath ⁕
vh2: praise God.
Alleluia.

refrain: Let everything that has breath praise God.
